Reviews.Title: “Excellent 6 days, Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Scotspiper66
Reviews.Content: My Villa was Gorgeous. Everything inside the Villa was brand new, and the place was sparkling clean. I stayed in a One bedroom Villa that had everything you could even need. A wide screen HD TV in both the Living room, and another in the bedroom. A new full size stove and refrigerator, dishwasher, micro wave and garbage disposal. Hidden away behind a door was a new Washer and Dryer (Not Coin operated). The grounds were very well kept and beautiful. There were even some exotic birds roaming around, and were very friendly. There was a Great pool with a nice Tiki Bar, the bar man is from England a a super nice guy. I read a review here where someone was worried about the area, As far as i'm converned that made no sense at all, its a nice area. You can only access the property using your room key at the main gate, its a very safe place. I had family staying at a Disney resort (3 times the price for onlly a room) It took me exactly `14 minutes to drive to Disney. There are tons of eating places within minutes of this property. I had a slight problem with the front desk apon check in, but its not even worth talking about. All in all I love the place, and will return the next time I am in Central Florida for sure. In my humble opinion this should be a 3 1/2 Star facility. If you are a couple looking for a romantic stay, or if you are solo, ask for Villa 1007, You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “A Gamble”
Reviews.Author: CCEABen12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Resort on two separate occasions. The first time in May 2009 and most recently one night in September 2011. We have stayed in both the regular and updated/renovated villa's and if you have the choice try for the upgraded. The regular villa was out of date and the carpet smelled pretty bad. The sofa's were dirty, the shower curtain rod was rusted and the bathtub scratched. The newer villa was immaculate and modern. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is very nice. There is a small "waterfall" area which is great for small children. The service on both occasions was okay but on our first visit our washing machine jammed and we requested a handy man come in to fix it. Our clothes were stuck in the washer for 3 days before someone showed up. Also we were were charged a small fee for any telephone call we made even if it was local. Our first visit in the modern villa was a good one and lead to us returning on our next trip. On the other hand our second experience made us not want to go back. So I guess I would consider it a bit of a gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nfourie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at oak plantation for a month and enjoyed every minute! The rooms are not the newest and the cleanest but big enough including a little kitchenette with a washing machine, stove, microwave, dishwasher and big fridge and the property is lovely with lots of trees and and a dam filled with birdlife. There are mosquitos and bugs because of the water and trees so if this is a problem for someone they wonr appreciate the place. There are also two swimming pools and a jacuzzi with a tiki bar and daily happy hour from 4 to 7! They have activities like karaoki sunday and hotdog cookouts etc that you can take part in if you feel like it. There is also a free shuttle service to the disney parks with an informative helpful driver that is always early for in case you are tired and ready to go back (which we were) The 2 barmen were lovely and the frontdesk staff (esp larissa who can organize anything) helpful. The cleaning staff were all very friendly except for their one female supervisor who screamed at them to our embarrassment. They were also honest and the guy called german made an effort to get my cell phone back to me after I forgot it in the fitness centre! We were sad to leave this lovely large property where we met new people and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay!”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay. Got the room from Hotwire, who listed **1/2 stars. Not sure I would go that far. Driving to the resort, we were really nervous from the area if we were gong to be safe, once on resort, it was just okay. We were there to go to Disney not stay in the resort and relax. Condo was a great size, larger than Disney living room. Kitchen was okay, 2 of the 4 burners did not work, didn't call front desk, sure they already knew. The appliances were out of date. TV's are not flat screens, but we were not there to watch TV, but would have been nice. The remotes backs were broken and had electrical tape to keep batteries in, you had to push really hard with one hand to keep the batteries tight and with your other hand, change the stations. Laundry was nice having it in the room, took 30 minues to wash clothes and 2-1/2 hours to dry. The bathroom was less than desirable, the spout was not attached to the wall, no need to call front desk, housekeeping knew there was an issue, they had just cleaned it. The bed was very comfortable the first night, although the sheets were double stretched on a king size bed. The next morning when I went to stretch the sheets, there were roaches underneath the sheets. I was grossed out. I went and got a can of bug spray and sprayed the room down. I did not want them things coming home with us. After spraying, we found about 5 to 6 dead roaches that afternoon. I washed the sheets and covering and replaced it on our bed. We got these rooms for $50 a night on hotwire. We would NEVER pay the $115 they advertise for these condos. It was about 20 minutes from the parks which were okay with us, however after 6 days, that 20 minutes got really old. They do have transportation to parks, but very limited pick up to and from parks. The staff up in the lobby were very kind, courteous, but not very professional. Inappropriate language used by several of the workers at the front desk. If you can get these condo's for $50.00 or less, you might like it, but you will be very upset if you paid over $75 per night, you can do better at other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Family perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here! It's not new and it's not fancy - but who cares? We didn't go to Florida to sit in a room. I loved the park-like setting complete with wandering peacocks. There was a nice shaded bench near the pond to view the cranes and ducks. We had a second floor condo in the back of the complex and it felt like we were in a tree house looking out the window (and it was VERY quiet). My two kids enjoyed the playground near our room completely covered with sand for digging. The pools were very nice and I appreciatd the shallow splash area with sprinklers for the little ones. They had a fun movie night by the pool complete with popcorn as well. I would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “I will never come and stay here again and everyone should really think twice about it!”
Reviews.Author: Christina N
Reviews.Content: First of all I'm staying in the hotel now and must say I'm very disappointed and upset on how unprofessional and rude front desk is ,I recently asked them for a first aid kit which they had none, so they had the nerve to tell me to go to CVS and get one...first night we got here I was disgusted by the room they had given us ,we had them change us 10 mins later, but this place is dirty,old and cockroaches in it,I killed at least 5 ..I'm very scared that they come home with me so I have to clean everything out...also everything needs to be updated the carpets are disgusting . Fitness room nothing works, pool is dirty with bugs in it...the room was dirty and not clean well... Biggest problem is the HOUSEKEEPERS who are unprofessional, rude ,loud women and men, they wake us up every day at 7:00am talking and gossiping loud outside our window , saying things like how much they hate there job,how much they hate people leaving a mess for them to clean....I heard it all....a little note: if you don't like working with people then don't work at all..clean toilets or flip burgers...because I come on vacation to relax not have people make me feel uncomfortable ...I will never come here again and I'm going to make sure no one else I know comes here ...horrible place.....plus the rooms are always dirty because the housekeepers are lazy and never want to do anything right but gossip.....This place is a joke waste of time and money....

Reviews.Title: “mostly good”
Reviews.Author: BrianJ59_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekd during Spring Break. Based upon the cost (which was quite economical) it was fair value. Sure the units are somewhat dated and the beddng is not top-shelf, but for what I paid, the results were reasonable. The unit itself was well laid-out with good amenities. It was especially nice to have the laundry room. The only real complaint I had was that the unit reeked of cigaarette SMOKE. It was disgusting; must have been coming from the air system. The only reason I did not complain is that it was Spring Break and reckoned there would be nothing else available. But again, all in all, for what it cost, the property was decent.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: liamgalway
Reviews.Content: the villa was fab as was the pool area and tiki bar which stayed open til 1am.met lovely people from canada there who we hope to meet again. will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “"Great Value, nice pool, would stay again"”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: Orlando has been around as a tourist town since the early 70's when Disney opened, so most of the area outside the park area is older and run down, with some newness mixed in. This resort was an old timeshare that has been sold and is still a timeshare and hotel mixed. Renovations are slow but they are having to (like everything/one) take time to fix it up. Check in was easy and the staff was very nice and helpful as the first room did not work out (needed carpet cleaned), they put us in another unit no problem. The room was outdated but since we knew it would be it was what we expected so can't complain. It is nicer than a standard hotel, because you at least have space to sit in a living room and use of a full kitchen if needed, plus a king bedroom with walk-in closet. The bathroom was kinda small, but had plenty of hot water! The washer/dryer was old and leaked but it served it's purpose, as did the kitchen (the fridge/icemaker and dishwasher worked great). We travel a lot so I always take extra paper products and soap etc. just to make it more home like. The kids loved the peacocks that have run of the property and loved the nice pool area. After a day at the park we could enjoy the very nice pool at night. Resort grounds are small and quaint with a small lake, gazebo, and playground too. The property is located near plenty of shopping and central to a lot of things in Kissimee. It feels very safe. If you are wanting a nice place (with family atmosphere), with nice people to vacation with, this is for you. Nothing spectacular, but worth it for us!! Think about it if you are budget conscious, and still like to have some niceities try it you might like it :) One day when it gets completely renovated the rates may not be so affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: rstwilburn
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't very clean. Dirt in cracks in kitchen, pieces of garbage between stove and fridge, found a couple roaches, various other bugs like ants in all rooms, shower head sprayed everywhere and got water outside curtains, carpets were dingy, washer/dryer combo did not dry clothes even after being in there for 2 hours, outdated furniture and tvs, and pull out couch was broken. But, room was roomy, good location, staff was polite, pool area was nice, other guests were great, nice having full kitchen, and bedding was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value,location & amenities for Families!”
Reviews.Author: 11canadian1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a week at this resort during the March Break. I was a little worried by the bad reviews but realized that some people will complain about the dumbest things. Yes its not the Hilton but for a family of 5, we found the space perfect. We were given two 1 bedroom apartments joined by a door in building 10. We had unbelievable space which included 4 flat screen tvs! Yes its a bit tired and dated but who cares! The maids came everyday and they cleaned very well. Sometimes they forgot soap or towels but 1 phone call and received double the amount we needed. The pool area is fantastic and laid out very well. The Tiki bar prices are good but one of the bartenders is a grump and probably needs to look for another job. The grounds are lovely and we loved the beautiful peacocks roaming around. We found the staff friendly and helpful, especially the shuttle driver to the theme parks. Hopefuly they will update this resort because you can't beat the space,location and privacy. We were NOT hassled at all regarding timeshares....If you're not looking for the Ritz, this is a great affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: Salman S
Reviews.Content: Indeed the place is old but with mature trees, lake, pool , four peacocks the place was very peaceful and relaxing, space was adequate but upgrade will make it better. For the price I paid it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are in need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: cb78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2012 with my GF and 1 yr old daughter. The website pictures make it look a lot better than it is. Considering we used my aunt's Vacation Exchange, I was expecting better. I'll break down my review in sections. Resort Grounds - From the outside when you enter, the resort looks great. Plenty of trees and there's a pond in the middle of the resort with many different birds species. The pool area is nice as well, with a gazebo covered jacuzzi and little tiki bar at the back. Did not use the Tennis/Basketball Court, Gameroom or Internet Cafe (used a PC in the lobby). Front Desk/Service - Front desk service was okay if we needed something, but daily room cleaning was not included with our stay. This was highly disappointing, and one of the reasons I would not come back here. Also, our Washer/Dryer broke down and they were unable to fix it. Not a big deal as we were on vacay, but another thing to note. Rooms - Our 1 Bedroom Villa was fully equipped, but very dated and in need of an update. This is the other reason I would not recommend this place. Appliances, flooring, walls, furniture all definitely need upgrading. I originally had Westgate Lakes booked but changed over here because of the full kitchen feature. If I knew how it looked here I wouldn't have switched. Location - In relation to Disney and the other main attractions, the resort was a little out of the way. They do offer shuttle service to the main attractions, and there are plenty of restaurants/shopping close by. It's across the street from Osceola Mall, but it's a run down place with mainly discount shops. With all the other options available in Orlando, I definitely would not recommend staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Zero service”
Reviews.Author: koraltop
Reviews.Content: We checked in (mom, dad, boys 4 and 7), only to find, that there were no bedsheets or beds for the kids - the receptionist was rude and had an attitude, and suggested, that if we didn't like the accomondations, we could just move. As there was no wifi in the room as promised, the room looked old and scraped together from bits here and there, and there was no room for the kids, we took her up on her word and left. The stay lasted 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst places I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible. The pictures looked good and the reviews not bad, but the pictures was of the one bedrooms that were upgraded. The Two bedrooms are not. It was like a shack. The couch was so gross we had to cover it with a blanket. The carpet was so dirty i could not let my 1 year old play on it. Dirty towels in the bathroom and pee behind the toilet. The washer didn't work. And the beds and pillows looked like they came from a $30 motel. Not to mention one of the outlets had metal sticking out of it. They tried to cover it with a piece of tape. And my son almost got electrocuted.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Harriet W
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room "was not ready" Many other people arrived after we did, several were told the same thing while others, all hispanic, went straight to their rooms. The front desk staff was rude, While I was talking to one, she immediately turned to a man who had just entered the office. He was hispanic. When we finally got our suite, it was hot. The maintanence man told us the air conditioner was working, it would just take a while to cool off because the room had not been occupied. Supposedly they had just finished cleaning it. Why did they not have the air on. It must have been occupied the night before. It never cooled off, though I went to the office three times complaining. Finally at 10pm I told them we were leaving and I would speak to the manager the next day. Before I could get back to the suite, the front dest called to say they had a suite available. The air was working in that suite, it was all ready cool. The next day when I asked to speak to the manager, I was told she was busy. I tried again throughout our stay, but was never able to talk to her. No apology was offered. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “umm.. not going there again”
Reviews.Author: MissMiami
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short weekend and this place is exactly as the other viewers wrote. PIctures do not lie. Only difference was that my apt. was clean, just super older furniture, the tv, dvd player in the living room did not work at all. It was great to have a full washer and dryer but that room smelled like a dirty dog. The tiles in the bathroom looked cruddy, the towels are so skimpy and the tub creaked when u step in and out. I didnt tour the grounds, just saw the lovely peakcocks. U need a card to get through the gate which seemed like good security but after 9 pm or so, the gate arm was always up. Anyways, if u are not picky, just want a place to put your bags down, then go ahead stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague-”
Reviews.Author: uniquenames
Reviews.Content: I truly feel so sorry for those people who have invested with this roach palace. I had two nights here through hotwire, and will remember again why to never go under 3 stars. Not sure that I would even give this place two stars. The place is falling apart. Staff are limited, and stressed (likely from being yelled at by angry renters) there was stains on the sheets, the washer dryer thingy took forver to use. The grounds are falling apart, there were bugs in the washroom, mostly hardly anything worked. It's truly sad, because I can see that twenty years ago, it would have been a great property. The little tiki bar is cute by the pool, and I think that the people who are working there, are trying with what they have. :(

Reviews.Title: “not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: JAWEMYSS3175
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here the previous year, and although it was not the best (pool was shut down the entire vacation. We decided to give it another go. As my son and a friend were with us, we rented a 2 bedroom. To sum up: A) there was mould on the ceiling of the master bedroom B) the sheets were full of holes and filthy C) kitchen utensits were far and few between D) it took 3 days to get a remote for the TV. If anything, this place went down hill. The pool was open this time, and quite nice, and the peacocks were entertaining, but that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “This company is extremely rude and dishonest”
Reviews.Author: faithzmom
Reviews.Content: By sharing your experiences you're helping travelers make better choices and plan their dream trips.Please pass this information to anyone you know. If you ever want to buy a time share, or use one: DO NOT DEAL WITH OAK PLANTATION IN KISSIMMEE FLORIDA. They do not deal courteously with the owners of the time shares. They do not state things clearly and plainly or even factually in their communications to their owners. For example, I called at 5 pm. I was told, "Maam, it is almost 5 o' clock and ...she may not even be there any more." The office hours clearly state open until 5:00 pm. Also, I was told that they did not hear from us. The date of the letter is 2/1/12. The date from the collection letter is twelve days later. If they do not have to honor their business hours, and they do not have to provide service to their customers, WHY would anyone do business with them??? Please pass this on as I have promised free advertising to Oak Plantation. DO NOT buy from them.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but very basic”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: Ok... for starters. I have been to almost every resort around Orlando/Kissimmee. This one rates lowest on a couple of things. Check in (during which they try to sign you up for tours no matter how tired you are) check in takes an eternity. Also things broken in room wont be attended to if you call. Its kinda tucked away in a cute little spot. I have stayed twice. Once in early spring. They say pool is heated? Dont believe it!!! Icy! Bed kinda hard. Very small condo. Very dated and kinda cramped. Ok the upside? Sometimes you can find a really good deal on a travel site and get it dirtcheap. It has ( in a 1 br.) A small br. A full albeit tiny kitchen. A pull out sofa. So you can have most of the comforts of home. Be able to cook etc. A mini wasker/dryer combo that didnt work. (Mighta just been ours) give it a shot but only if you can get it cheap and are on a budget. They may also put an unexpected hold on your card. Which we did get back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Connorb1993
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, it was nothing short of brilliant. The location and the set up of the rooms means that there is no ugly main roads, just wonderful glistening lakes and fountains, The breakfast deal is a must! (we had to buy our own waffle maker when we came back home, after being spoiled with the buffet!) Peacocks were a lovely attition too! As for the rooms, they were simple, clean and completely equipped (bar a corkscrew). Beds were lovely and a proper nights sleep was simply too easy. They say you get what you pay for, but I'd happily pay 3 times the price for my week here and still of been satisfied! Looking forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Roach Plantation Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sue I
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three year old daughter spent three LOOONG weeks at this place because our home was sold and we needed accommodations while we searched for a new home. We were on the Internet every day in the office or Internet cafe trying desperately to find somewhere else to go. We only went there in the first place because it had a separate bedroom, free electricity, cable, utilities and a washer and dryer. First of all, it is WAY too expensive for what you get. The room was small and everything just felt dirty. I wore my socks or slippers the entire time. We were going to stay another month, but luckily I found a WONDERFUL place with three bedrooms, two baths and a large kitchen with granite and a water dispenser for two hundred a month LESS! You would think Oak Plantation would have lowered the price for a long term renter. NOT AT ALL! The girl at the front desk even told me that even MOTEL 6 has Internet in the rooms, when I asked her why Oak Plantation does not have Internet access in all the rooms! A red flag. I found two dead roaches in the kitchen one morning. The fact that they were dead is a good thing, I suppose. The raccoons are a concern, but are to be expected in that area with all those trees. They are not afraid of humans. The peacocks are pretty to look at. It took an act of Congress and a lot of complaining on my part to get the maids to the room, but finally they came and after that, once a week, as it should be. It sounded like the people above us were moving furniture at 5 AM. That wasn't too great. My daughter and I liked the bracelet making activity every Friday by the pool. Overall, I would never stay here again and I would tell you the same thing...you can find something better. You cannot go wrong with Hampton Inn! Heavy, clean comforters, FREE delicious breakfast, maid service every day. Oak Plantation has thin blankets. The decor is very early 80's. Another thing I almost forgot...I let my daughter go barefoot once and after a couple of hours, her little feet were BLACK! Don't they shampoo the carpets??? The fridge leaked water. That's all I have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review for your own good.”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyDouglass11
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this resort, no matter how many good reviews you read. When something seems too good to be true, IT USUALLY IS. I traveled in a group of two couples in May of 2011 to the Orlando area and stayed at this resort. Check in was easy, area surrounding villas seemed quaint, and generally the villa itself was decent. When I say decent I mean exactly that. If you consider late 80's to early 90's beach decor, uncomfortable beds, and outdated appliances your cup of tea, then hell this may just be your Hilton. We spent one night at Oak Plantation with virtually no complaints until we discovered that there was a lizard in our room and 1:00 in the morning. If you know anything about Florida you know the state is teeming with tiny lizards. It's not a big deal, they're harmless really. We were just going to catch it and throw it outside. Upon moving our bed we discovered several dead COCKROACHES. Yes, you read that right. The vermin of all vermin. Directly below us as we slept. Naturally we were appalled and called management at the hotel as well as Expedia.com customer service, but not before we disgustedly moved the cockroach onto the kitchen floor, so that it's existence could not be denied by the staff! Staff was not helpful whatsoever. Offered us a different room in the same bug infested resort in a different building. To add insult to injury they only offered to comp our stay for one night. We weren't satisfied with this offer, as I'm sure anyone who was a thousand miles from home wouldn't be and demanded to be moved to another hotel. Just as we are on the phone with Expedia who comes to join the party but a tick! (As if needing to sanitize my belongings and buy new luggage wasn't enough.) Due to the fact that it was so late, we decided to stay in another room on the opposite side of the resort and switch hotels early in the morning. We pack all of our things into our rental car, drive to the other side of the resort which is comaprable to a large apartment complex, and walk to our new room which is on the back of a building facing the woods. Just as we think we are done with pests/animals for the day, we encounter two LARGE raccoons at the door of the room. I'm serious, these things were bigger than my dog. We finally got in the room and stayed reluctantly for the next 7 hours until we could change hotels at 8am. It was the worst hotel/villa stay of my entire life and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Side Note: This place is swarming with peacocks. Spring is their mating season, so we had the pleasure of hearing a God awful honking from these birds. Beautiful to look at, annoying to listen to.

Reviews.Title: “No problems.”
Reviews.Author: danaful
Reviews.Content: We made the trip down to Orlando area to spend a week at Disney over Christmas week. There were 3 of us. Whereas it's not high class, it was perfectly acceptable for our needs. The rooms were clean(ish--sometimes it's best just not to look all that closely), it was convienient to the parks, and it was exactly what we needed it to be. A place to sleep. The people at the front counter were friendly and helpful, but I wish they'd mentioned that they ran a shuttle to the parks before our last day there. We still would have rented a car, but it would have saved on parking. I'd absolutely stay here again. I'd love to know, however, who the chairs at the counter are meant to accommodate, as the are about 6 inches higher than anyone under 5'8" can navigate gracefully.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Anh N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate New Year 2012. The place was reasonable for the price we paid for. We did not notice the check-in time was at 4 pm and arrived early so we had to wait to get our room. The room overlooked the pond so the view was very peaceful. We even saw some peacock near the pond. The place is close to US 192 which has plenty of restaurants and stores. Quick drive to Disney World. Pros: Price, room size, green surrounding, location, kitchen (enough to cook quick meals and grocery store is within 1 mile), 24-hour front desk, quick response. Cons: very old carpet. room service was on and off (I think they was overloaded with guests for New Year) and most of the day they only take out the trash (no cleaning), have to ask them to bring towel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this motel”
Reviews.Author: vagrantchild
Reviews.Content: It would be a good idea to stay here if you just need a motel. The room is clean and no bedbugs (some roaches though) Unfortunately, if you are traveling with you family and booking from the Hotwire or Expedia looking for a room fitting 3 or 4 people, you might end up with a ONE-bedroom in this hotel. Since, it claims its one bedroom can fit 4 people with the so called sofa-bed! Brilliant ! Believe me, at that time, sleeping on the floor is not that bad. Also, it claimed it has free internet connection around the pool, in their internet cafe and the front-desk room. Sounds great! right ? I just want to warn you guys that the internet cafe is open 9am-5pm, equipped 3 computers only. In the front dest, only ONE Linux box is available to guests. The most important thing is that you NEVER get any wireless connections anywhere. Another thing, during our stay, the workers were working downstairs from 9am to 5pm and the noise is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Honest apartments located in a private park although some issues should be fixed”
Reviews.Author: Koizumi
Reviews.Content: There was a mistake in the flat # so that we discovered some pieces of luggage that did not belong to us in our room. This is definitely not secure. Large rooms but you'll wake up rather early as blinds are not completely dark. Fully equipped kitchen with microwave oven, electric cooker, electric oven, refrigerator with deep freeze, dish washer, washing machine and dryer. DVD player. Very noisy due to refrigerator and AC equipment even if you don't use it (neighbors). Located in a private park. Ask for an apartment away from AC equipment that can be extremely noisy. No WiFi in rooms unless you are lucky enough to have an apartment nearby the few WiFi hot spots. Decent beds except sofa. Plumbing quality is very very low (close to Egyptian standards).

Reviews.Title: “An all around horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: OhioGhh
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week at Oak Plantation where I was staying with a group of 7 others while we were on a volunteer service trip. This was the second time I have personally stayed there and it was horrible. The room was dirty, there was mold in the showers, and the appliances were breaking. With a room that sleeps 8, we were given 4 towels. Anytime we called to get more they would never come. When housekeeping would come to the room they would only make 1 of the 4 beds and then leave. The trash was never removed and we ran out of toilet paper 3 times over the course of the week. When we would request more they would tell us that we could come get it ourselves at the front desk. Our door wouldn't close properly and it took until half way through the week before it was fixed. Our power also went out one night and it didn't seem like it was a priority to get it back on. As for the staff, with the exception of a select few friendly faces, everyone treated us like we were a complete burden to them just for asking for towels and toilet paper. I talked to multiple managers and they essentially told me that because I didn't come specifically to a manager when these problems happened, there was nothing they could do. One also told us that the staff should have been documenting these problems, but there were none on file. We ended up getting one night compensated, but it wasn't exactly "making it right" like they claimed that they would do. Overall the experience was terrible and the service was horrifying. There is no way I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I think it is safe to say that our organization will be finding other arrangements in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: melblake4
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews... You can't please everyone. For the price you pay Oak Plantation exceeds expectations. If you want 5* luxruy creme de la creme then pay for a ritz carlton and stop complaining about small minor issues such as not enough towels. Please! Its hardly a vacation spoiler if the maid forgets to leave 10 towels instead of the 9 she/he leaves. Goodness!! It was clean, plenty of ammentities and spacious accomodation for 2 families. For me it is better than a hotel as the use of a kitchen keeps eating costs down, you can cook instead of paying to go to restaurants every night. I would recommend this resort

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ambishen1981
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews just talking about the bad things at a hotel but this place really doesn't have much going for it. I pretty much only need a clean safe place to lay my head. This place seemed pretty safe but clean it was not. The service was pretty terrible as well. To start I would agree with everyone else that there were tons of bugs in this place. I expected a few weird bugs just because it's a humid place but this was just down right gross. We had left cinnamon buns in a container on the counter and the next morning they were crawling with bugs. There was also mold in the bathrooms. We had a 2 bedroom suite with 5 adults. One day we came back around 11pm and they had cleaned the unit but left us 1 towel for 5 people. When I went to the desk to get more they didn't have any and had to go raid other empty united for more. Another day we went to the Chees Cake Factory for dinner and had brought back a piece of cheese cake each to have the next day. we went out for the day and when we came home for dinner and cheese cake someone had been in our unit and ATE one of the cheese cakes!! The grounds were very nice and the ducks and peacocks were cool but it was one of the small advantages. In closing I have never stayed in such a dirty place wit such terribe service. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “OK Property”
Reviews.Author: Roque M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a few friends. The property could best be described as "tired" and need big renovation. Our condo was on the first floor. I would recommend staying above the first floor. The condo was comfortable and had everything you need, we had the two bedroom unit but it had a small kitchen which was fine. There is no restaurant on the property, but close to local restaurants and easy access to main roads, great Customer Service and professional sales manager Ms. Consuela.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACHES”
Reviews.Author: della154976
Reviews.Content: I want to tell you not to go there as it is infested with cockroaches . the little bugs on the walls and counters are the babies . we left that place at 1am on the second day there is nothing they could do for us except say sorry sorry sorry . We found another nice place 10 min away very nice clean place and shuttle to Disney day and night . very disappointed with Oak Plantation Kissimee .We were 4 of us from Canada

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: Swheelz
Reviews.Content: The first night we got here we pulled out the sleeper sofa and there was a dead roach in it and had to call the front desk and get another mattress, the next morning we brewed coffee and there was a roach crawling on the coffee maker, housekeeping had to come and spray for roaches however a couple days later when we were packing up to leave I had a roach in my sock!!!! DISGUSTING!!!! We were offered another room however it was late at night and we have two 4 year olds and who's to say the other room wasnt roach infested?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Looks are Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: pompano12
Reviews.Content: This resort is very appealing on the outside. It is a gated community requiring your room key to get in the gate at the complex which is good. It goes a long way in keeping the rif raf out. The pool is nice, as well as the hot tub. The peacocks are a nice touch too. The office staff was very nice and professional too. There is really nothing else nice to say about this resort. It is sad to see a resort such as this, that could be so awesome, be allowed to deteriorate into what is is now. When we checked in we were assigned an upstairs unit. When we got to that unit the door locks did not work, and it was directly above an area with signs indicated "Hazardous Materials". The smoke alarm was dangling from the wires and the room had a strong smell of mildew when we got in. My mother-in-law had recent hip issues so the office was kind enough to change us to a downstairs room, which smelled slightly better and was not located near any "Hazardous Materials". In the new room the air conditioner drain was stopped up and someone had stuffed a towel in the closet to catch the drainage instead of fixing it, and the filter was just laid up against the unit and not even installed. A general feeling of uncleanliness was about in the room, especially if you have small kids crawling about. The air vents appeared to have something resembling mold around them, and the dryer had a huge lint build up in the hose to the point we were somewhat concerned about the safety of using it. The maintenance man came to check on the air conditioner, but said he could not do anything for it at that time. At least it did blow cold air. When we checked in there were only four towels, no wash cloths or hand towels. One of the beds was queen size, but had a king size sheet on it that was not fitted and slid off of it every night. It is a stretch to say that the kitchen is minimally stocked, it is BARELY MINIMAL..very basics. I feel very sorry for the office staff for having to try and rent these units in the condition that these units are in. The office staff seem to be very nice people. Would I stay at this place again...absolutely NOT. Did this place ruin our vacation...absolutely NOT, the power of Mickey Mouse is much too great for that; however, until some MAJOR renovations are made I would steer clear of this resort. My lesson has been learned.

Reviews.Title: “The best decision you can take”
Reviews.Author: Carmen R
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, very close to places of interest to visit, excellent quality of service in the rooms, the pool, restaurant, excellent quality food at breakfast. In fact one of the best hotels in service and quality that we have chosen. We recommend them 100%

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place to Stay at a Decent Pice”
Reviews.Author: esdoorn
Reviews.Content: Needless to say was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on here. However, the resort was decent and the room ( #109 ) was right by the pool and was a clean, we bought some cleaning products just in case we needed them, but only used the clean wipes to clean in the kitchen. We had to ask for towels, extra toilet paper and some pots and pans, the staff responded very well to our requests. The kids had fun swimming in the pool ( there is one heated pool and one unheated pool ) we stuck to the heated pool. The grounds were well kept as was all the appliances in our unit. All in all fo $85.00 pe night for a ground floor one-bedoom suite (Charleston), you cannot be this place as it had all the comforts of home. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “JUST DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: Gillian E
Reviews.Content: We read all the tripadvisor's on this resort and at the time we thought it couldn't be that bad. How wrong could we have been. Our accommodation was disgustingly unclean. Dirty stained furniture. Fridge/Freezer very rusty, Serving utensils dirty and just laid on shelf in a rotten cupboard. Then you go into the bathroom Oh my god how disgusting. The sink overflow looked like it had never had any cleaner near it and as for the rim of the toilet, Black scum all the way round. The Bath had no stopper so you could not have a bath only a shower. The bedroom in fairness was not to bad although the bedding could have been better. (Old Linen). There was also no towels. Went to reception to lodge our complaints. Very nice young girl who said she would get it sorted..Off we then went to get some groceries.. We returned to find out that the bath stopper had been fitted, (well we thought it had been fitted) but as for the rest, nothing had been done. Good job we purchased some cleaning products when we went shopping. We had been travelling all day so had a bite to eat shower's and off to bed. You know i said the stopper had been fitted well it hadn't, it had just been dropped in the hole so unknown to us the water from the shower had leaked straight into the walk in cupboard in the bedroom. The carpet was saturated. Another trip to reception. Again they would get it sorted. Off we went out for the day. On our return, there was a note on our door from an engineer to say they had repaired the bath and the leak and that they had left a dryer on to help dry the carpet which was so loud. Its a wonder our neighbours didn't complain. We informed reception that the dryer needed to stay as the carpet was still very wet but after we came back from dinner it had gone so we just shut the door and lived out of our suitcases. After a few days my wife opened the door to the cupboard and was physically sick from the smell. Yet another trip to reception. Needless to say nothing was done so the door was kept well and truly shut. Only opened on the day of departure. Oh i nearly forgot to mention the bugs. And yes there were loads.. Cockroaches like i have never seen before and some other little bugs that were over the surfaces. Well thats the room now for the resort: Quite pleasant. buildings could do with a lick of paint, grounds just need a tidy, the breakfast room was nice. Breakfast itself was good but not much verity. The internet cafe was also nice. The pool area really did need an overhaul, Tiles in the pools were broken, filters needed emptying, pathing slabs broken, some sun loungers in need of repair. Oh and don't go barefoot the ants bite..They also don't tell you that the resort is on a flight path to Kissimmee airport so the planes are quite low and noisy when they fly over. I know that people like to make up their own minds but this is an honest report.. Traveller beware

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Upgrading!! Home For Bugs and Poor Housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: kynatv
Reviews.Content: Rooms appeared clean upon arrival, although carpet was filthy, as was the couch and chair. Upon turning back the first bed, there were hairs, glitter and dirt on the sheets. Checked second bed - it definitely had not been changed and there were ANTS crawling around inside. Called desk about 9:00 p.m. Sent a man to spray about 10:00. Didn't get fresh? linens until after 11:00 p.m. which did not fit the beds. Small bugs in both bathrooms. Heating & air was out and never got fixed before we left. Napkins & placemats had crusted food on them. Our stay was non-refundable, so we went to Wal-mart and bought bug spray, air freshener, Clorox clean-up. Had to go back later for toilet tissue, soap and dishwashing detergent. The staff was not friendly at all. The exterior and pools were nice and inviting is the only good part. Talked to another vacationer at breakfast who also had bugs, mold, wet carpet from water heater and unclean bedding. They changed rooms 5 times, finally to an upgraded one, which they were still unhappy with. Apparently the check-out desk had been programmed not to ask "How was your stay?" We just got a "thank-you" as we checked out. Come on, Oak Plantations, come CLEAN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A return worth”
Reviews.Author: Knaapje
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the second time. Last year sinsle in a small app. This year with a travelmate in a large 2bed 2 bath app. Worth its price. A great park with all the tries and birds. Appts need a real update. It gets a little worn. The carpets and bedding are over its date. The app was very clean and everithing in the app worked, omly the internet outside was disappointing, even next to the internetcafe it lost its connection everytime. But given its price, specially if booked via Expedia in connection with an interncontinental flight, it worth to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect-But very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: tatgirl661
Reviews.Content: Out 1st Anniversary 10-10-11....where to go? Orlando....where to stay...Oak Plantation Resort? Reading the reviews I was so so nervous but mid August it was time to choose....Okay gonna give them a try it seems they have all we were looking for! October 5th evening of arrival....the moment we stepped into the lobby the staff made us feel so at ease and and home. Check in was a breeze and the 2 ladies answered many questions for us on where things were. Now onto our room...we were in 1114- 1 bedroom 1 bath nice little apt type room. As sson as we walked in the door I breathed a sigh of releaf....there was no horrid smell of smoke as complained about, the apt was clean and no musty smell or odor of any kind which was a prior complaint. The room was a little dated...but that I don't fault or complain about as everything was usable. The washer/dryer combo was something I had never even heard of before...it was the washer then after the washing cycle was done it was the dryer....how cool is that. We did try and do a load which did take a long time and we did have to end up letting our jeans dry by hanging them over a couple of chairs, so not so efficient but if given more time the job could have been successful...we just waited till the last minute to do our laundry. Won't do that next time(yes we will return). The dishwasher worker perfectly and was not all rusted out as previously complained about. We had sufficient cookware and service for 4. We did need a skillet called down and they told us they would bring it in the AM which was fine as we did not need it that night. We then went to wal-mart (just down 192) to get some groceries by the time we returned the skillet was on our counter. The TV's which everyone seems to complain and dwell on are old but very functional. But for us we didn't come to Florida to sit in the hotel/resort to watch TV. We did see little black ants (at night) about 5 each time and every time in the bath tub seeming to be coming out of the drain. But our outlook was and is....its Florida and Ants happen. No other bugs and not an infectation, just Florida to me and hubby. The only thing that me and my Husband agree on was that the mattress at least in 1114 needs replaced...it was a little hard for our tastes and maybe that was just us but we did find that after a few nights it was getting to us. If you like a firm bed you will be satisfied though. All in all I suppose to wrap up the place has been let go a little you can see some shortcuts that have been taken. But our room was clean and nothing was horribly wrong. Every time we had a question it was answered by a pleasant and smiling employee. So for the Hall family....thank you Oak Plantaition and we will consider returning to your resort in the future......THANK YOU AGAIN FOR A WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY ON OUR 1ST ANNIVERSARY!!! OH, we did not get "hounded" by anyone trying to sell us a timeshare.Just sayin.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: sarahco2011
Reviews.Content: I have been watching the reviews for this place for along time and some of them did hold true. Overall, I was happy because the quality of this place did not ruin my vacation like I feared from the looks of alot of reviews. Had no bedbugs, cockroaches, or other insects lingering indoors so that was great (big fear)! There was alot of bugs dead and alive outside the door though because of the light which was gross. Main reason we chose this place was because I was travelling with my boyfriend and dad, so we needed space between each other. 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and washer and dryer was great. Yes, the appliances are outdated but thankfully they all worked (the toaster got so hot I'm sure its a fire/safety hazard). The place was clean looking but only if you didnt look too close. One of the couches was stained and gross looking so we tossed an extra sheet over it to sit on. I know it was very dusty because I would get allergy attacks like crazy. We stayed for 10 days, and only the last few days did they clean the bathroom floors and sink(I know because my hair was everywhere and i could see dust), Its true that you have to go to the front desk for towels, which the staff dont seem to want to part with. if they take dirty ones, why cant they always replace them? They only started bringing them to us randomly the last few days there. I ended up washing a load of them and hiding them so i wouldnt have to go ask since the staff made it seem like you were bothering them when you did. They didnt pay good attention to when you needed more toilet paper/paper towels/ soap either. For those of you who have read many reviews, it is true that the mattress covers/pads are way to small for the mattress! they tied them to the mattress so they would stay put haha. But we did have complementary room service and free breakfast. the few times we did go for food we had no complaints. the pool area was nice. the nights are the best times to go, hardly anyone around! we had the pool to ourselves. Never got to try the hot tub though because there was always people in it. the man who works in the tiki bar is not very pleasant. it was like he didnt want to serve you, avoided him after that one visit. 2 of the lightbulbs blew the first day there, but was fixed by the time we returned. So overall nothing major was wrong and ovbiously dont stay here if you are looking for luxury, which we werent. Clean, functioning, and bug-free was my goal and for the most part, that was what we got.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: MGlaspy
Reviews.Content: Arrived the 24th of Sept and stayed through the 8th Oct. Great family place to stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are not looking for a five star location but rather a place to lay your head that is just around the corner from anything and everything that a family would ever need during a visit to Disney then this is the place. There is tons of things at Oak Plantation for the kids to do with the amenities and the activities that they offer. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: julie l
Reviews.Content: This place was really nice. Loved the pools and hot tubs. Lots of activities for children. Spacious rooms like being at home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Come With Low Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: LoriLou1
Reviews.Content: Ok...I'll confess...I usually roll my eyes as I read negative hotel reviews. I mean, who needs fancy pants rooms with luxurious linens when their on vacation? I travel to experience the sights, not stay in my room! That said, here goes. This "resort" is not a repeat. Frankly, it's disgusting. Dirty floors, disgusting mattresses and the worst towels! That is when you are actually given towels. Housekeeping took our soiled towels and failed to supply clean ones. We had to get them from the front desk. Every single day! What a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it seems”
Reviews.Author: dwbadvibe
Reviews.Content: First the good. Rooms are large, internet is free at reception, the grounds peaceful and full of wildlife, breakfast is copious (but not much variety), "dive-in" cinema on poolside screen is an interesting bonus, and staff are as helpful as they can be but there are some things to be aware of. The on-site "shop" is tiny (tho there is an enormous Walmart just down the 192); The Starbucks sometimes advertised on site doesn't exist anymore; It's actually a timeshare resort, not a motel, so none of the rooms are non-smoking. Allied to the above, not all guests take housekeeping service which probably explains lack of cleanliness. None of the linen would fit the larger beds and wasn't always clean. Still, no wife-strangler next door (had that before) and we'd take that over pristine carpets! It was late and we had just come from 5* New York to put it in context.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, but not without issues”
Reviews.Author: Paul-Maine
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that some of the units are very dirty like some of the previous reviews state. We stayed at the hotel part of this resort (property near the resort) several years back so we had an idea of the layout of this resort. We started out badly since I called several days before arriving to confirm my reservation, verify my reservation was for a non-smoking room, and made a request for a particular building which was not too far from the pool. The person I spoke to went over which buildings my type of unit were located in, and she said it would be no problem to get my 1 bedroom unit near the pool (I think in building #2). We arrived a the resort around 9:00 at night after a long day of traveling. The unit they directed us to was the building farthest away from the pool where the unit entrance was located behind the building. On top of that all of the outdoor lighting was not working which made my wife quite uncomfortable since we could barely find the way to our unit. To be honest with you this unit was fairly clean, but since my wife did not feel safe in this unit we went back to the office. To make a long story short the person behind the desk offered us several rooms to look at, and some of the rooms were not fit to live in because of the smell in the room, dirty carpets, and they were really in bad need of repairs. When we went back to let her know which room we decided to stay in she saw that we were really disgusted by the condition of some of the units. She was extremely nice and told us to select a unit for the night and the next morning there would be additional units closer to the pool that she could get us into for the rest of our stay. She actually turned what looked like a bad vacation into a very nice relaxing vacation. She set us up in a unit right by the pool, and she continued to make sure the rest of our stay was enjoyable. I have been to many hotels/resorts and I am not someone who demands 5 start accomodations, but some of the units in this resort really need a lot of updating. The resort itself is very nice with the pools, landscaping, internet cafe, and the exterior of the buildings that look great, but be selective on the unit you stay in. We ended up enjoying our stay and having a great time. Like anything else a vacation is what you make of it, and this resort is a nice place to relax. I would stay here again, but I hope they do some much needed updating to bring this place up to the standards they visioned for this place when they built it.

Reviews.Title: “Were here last year and loved it so returned this year”
Reviews.Author: linedancer088
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with a differece your rooms have full kitchens and a washing machine and tumble dryer(so no dirty washing when you get home bonus!!! for MUM) resort is clean and tidy could be doing with a lick of paint but the rooms are lovely beds are comfy veiws are beautifull 3 pools juccusi gym internet cafe games room for kids tiki bar for adults very peacefull away from the biz of international drive, you are a 10 minute walk 2 minute drive from ocella Mall(not to big but keeps you occupied) 15-20 minute walk 5 minute drive from wallmart 15-20 minute drive to disney.10-15 minute drive to kissimmee old town (great old car show at weekend) 25-30 min drive to international drive.loads of new malls popping up. would love to stay but have to go home tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your Money and I hope to return”
Reviews.Author: cajuncowboy64
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews I read before our trip had negative comments about this place, but my girlfriend and I found the place to be very nice and clean. It was very quiet and relaxing and a great value for the price I paid for the vacation package and will return on my next trip to the Orlando area. Bring your GPS and you will not have any problems with directions to any attraction or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time, even for the low price it's not worth it. Trust me.”
Reviews.Author: vwayage
Reviews.Content: OK, I stayed there for 5 nights with my husband and 3 children. When I arrived on Wed, checking in took forever because "rooms were being inspected". When I entered the room, I don't know who or what they were inspecting because the rooms were filthy with dirty carpets. OMG, you just wont believe how filthy this place is. Imagine living in a neighborhood with hoarders. The doors are dirty. Please do your kids a favor, don't go to this place. I ran to targer to get socks for my children because I would not let them put their feet on those dirty carpet. Now day one, kids went to the pool. Next day went to see friends early and later to Seaworld. Came back to room (I paid extra for housekeeping, don't want to have to do it myself on vacation), oops nothing done. Had pizza with family night before, pizza box still in room with all dishes. Called front desk to complain, clerk tells me "Let me check to see if you paid for housekeeping" Sh..t if I did not pay for it, I would not be complaining. No sorry, nothing. Next day, while doing children hair housekeeping comes in, very careless, a little here and there. Before she leaves the room, I tell her "Are you coming back with towels, answer Yes." We leave for fun, come back late night with tired sweaty children, no towels. Called front desk, ask for towels. Clerk tells me he will send towels, now 20 minutes later, My door was being pounded like it was a police, no, FBI doing a raid. Kids were asleep by then, all of them woke up asking what was that. It was late, husband took towel from housekeeping and just closed the door. Now next day, I go to the front desk and ask to speak to a manager, was given the name Sharon Burton, but oops, she can't speak to me because she is having a staff meeting. I was asked to leave my name she will get in touch with me. I'm home now, no call from Sharon Burton. Third day, They did the beds and that was it. Nothing else. All the dirty towels were left all over the bathrooms with no new towels. I swear I'm not making this sh..t up. I did not get upset because I was determined not to ruin my family vacation. Day 5, at around 10:30am housekeeping knocks at door, told lady I'm getting ready to leave to come back later. after disney saw parade, fire works happy mommy happy husband, happy children, walked in my fully paid room with housekeeping...... bed not done, towels from two days ago all over the bathroom. Washed children put them to bed. Called front desk to ask "What the ...." answer, nothing can be done now. Name of Sharon Burton given to me again with her extension. Next day checking out. Go to front desk and ask for Sharon Burton, and guess what my readers, Sharon Burton cannot come out because she is in a staff meeting. People this is the first ever review I have written on the internet. Please don't waste your money or time. The place is dirty, the staff is complacent. Oh I almost forgot the best part, day 4, at 8:00 am , call comes in, Mr + Mrs (name), We have a complementary gift for you, when can we bring it? Husband in about an hour. As husband is leaving room to go to car, he sees a middle aged man coming towards our door with two little baskets. Man ask husband, Are you enjoying yourself? Husband tells him, No because of poor service, no housekeeping blahblahblah. Man ask "Would you be interested in a timeshare on this property? Husband answers---NO. I swear man takes gifts and walks back with gifts and did not give it to us. I'm not mad. I'm just warning you. Don't go There. They are too cheap to take care of the place. The front desk is like a gallery where staff seat and chat. It is unbelievable. Don't Don't Don't book it. And trust me, I did not let them ruin my time, but the carelessness on the part of the staff will get to you. The kids like the pool, but the $1.00 hotdog in the cooler by the pool was cheesy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Al G
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" was not worth the trip. We wound up moving because of the insects in the rooms, the total disrepair of the rooms and the filth. Contrary to their advertisements, it is not close to much. When we walked to the "local" eating spots, the locals told us to beware of walking back in the dark. We found a lot nicer places for far less and closer to more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: EDITH F
Reviews.Content: This was the most uncomfortable vacation of my life, first of all the room was like a hand me down they used it for parts we had no coffee pot, no washer and dryer because they used the door for parts to fix another washer ,the bugs were all over, this was the worst trip of my life i will never go back there,finally i got a coffee pot ,but no waher and dryer,the first day i told them there was no door they should have chged us they waited til sat when we were leaving on sunday we arrived wed and nothing til sat.by that time what was the point.the tv was not working right,it was just horrible, but i looked in some of the other little apts and they had all the ammenities and they were clean.NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better.”
Reviews.Author: dml226
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get one of the updated rooms but would not go back. The staff was really nice, but they have very little to work with. This place could be really great if they finish updating the rest of the units and bought some new pillows, blankets and pool towels ( they were rags) we had to go to walmart and buy our own.

Reviews.Title: “A nice step up from the ordinary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: canewbee
Reviews.Content: No this isn't Disney or a high end resort, however it is nice. You can get it at a good price, which makes it all good! The grounds are very nice, with the palm trees and plenty of oak trees, gave me a feeling of home. The pool is nice. This is a good place if you are going to be gone most of the time but want a few laid back days. There isn't a whole lot to do on the grounds besides the pool. The game room is small, playground was hot ...but not their fault. They could have more activities. However since we only stayed by 2 days out of the whole week (rest was seeing the parks) this was much better than a hotel. good location to all. Stayed here 3 times..one time our room needed up dated, but it was clean. The other two times the rooms were nice. for the price it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “There's "Good" & There's "Not So Good"”
Reviews.Author: SandSunDancer
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Saturday and stayed at Oak Plantation Resort for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom villa with family. Upon arrival my first impression was not favorable. The housekeeping staff who were obviously just getting off from their shift were sitting on the front porch of the main reception building waiting for their rides - some were asleep in the rocking chairs as if they were hotel guests...not a good look. Inside, Lobby area is airy but furniture has seen better days. Front desk staff was very friendly but checkin process was slow due to minimal staffing. Property - The property is fairly large and grounds are well maintained. Peacocks walk freely around and are pleasant to watch. A nice lake with ducks is also on the grounds. Lodging - Door to 1st villa was in need of paint and inside a musty smell, dirty floors and old furniture. Voiced my concerns and was offered the last available villa. This villa also suffered from worn-out furniture and dirty floors but it wasn't as bad. Next day had ants everywhere and sadly it took 2 days for someone to come and spray. Pool - The pool was the best feature at this resort. Clean, large, and centrally located. Hottub was nice too but was not restricted to adults. Movies at poolside was a nice treat. Other Activities - Game Room is small feature with limited games. Basketball courts are nice feature and are lit at night. Internet cafe is also available if you have your laptop but limited hours of operation. Location - convenient to major roads, shopping center and dining options by car. Overall - Front desk staff are very nice and try to please. Housekeeping was terrible. This property has much potential but is in serious need of updating..

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Awk74
Reviews.Content: The space of the rooms was nice. The pool was nice. Appliances worked as they were supposed to. The grounds were just ok. The rooms themselves were not well maintained. Unless it's pretty bad, I typically don't notice if a room is unclean. I noticed these rooms (not at first glance, but after being there a couple hours). My wife is much more sensitive to these types of things so we picked up some cleaner and detergent. All the sheets and towels got washed and everything at least in the bathrooms and kitchen got cleaned. It's a good thing these rooms come with a washer/dryer. There were numerous holes in the walls that were unpatched and other obvious damage to the floors and walls. The bolt lock on the door was missing. It looked like it had been broken off. Each night I pushed a small couch in front of the door just in case our 3-year-old woke up before we did and decided to get adventurous. It was absolutely filthy where that couch had been. There was supposed to be a large garbage collection container nearby where we could bring our garbage, but we never found one anywhere close to our condo. The kids enjoyed the pool and seeing the fish in the pond and the peacock on the grounds. However overall, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most AWFUL hotel ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: pharrahlyn
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this place was that it had a roof, and AC! Let's begin, we arrived later on in the evening so we wanted to get the kids to bed, we noticed the couch was a pull out, Great! No, not so great!!! My nephew opened it up and pulled out what he believed was a dirty black sock, if only it were so. Unfortunatly it was a disgusting woman's underware!!! He just about puked! Second, the mattress, looked as if it came straight from the dump! Blood stains, urine stains, and who else knows what kind of stains, I think I know, but I would rather forget. We drove to a walmart to buy a plastic covering for ALL the mattresses. We notified the people in the front office about the lack of hygenic care for the all round room, nothing, not a sorry, a comp, or even a lame excuse was given!, We also asked for a "crib" and high chair. I don't think even goodwill would accept the items that were given to us. They were filthy, and covered in food, crap, and nuggets of I have no idea!!! The toilet was not connected to the floor, there was only 1 pan in the kitchen to cook in. Overall, I would spend more money on a quality place where I wouldn't have to question if they even wash the sheets. I spoke to a housekeeper doing the laundry to ask for more towels, I noticed dirty laundry everywhere and something missing, bleach, detergent, and softner. Nothing, nowhere, where they seen and I watched her do a load, just plain water and nothing added. So back to walmart to buy detergent and softner! Thank GOD for walmart!!! Overall, the service was medeocre, and the standard for clean in this "resort" was absolutly disgusting! I'd give this place 1/2 a star for the A.C.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: McTav1sh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here summer 2010. Nice apartment, large, well equipped and comfortable. Good pool area and beautiful gardens and lake. Only real minus for us was the housekeeping service. It was erratic and just not worth it. Would stay there again as a bas for Disney etc. - but a car is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay Here - All the reviews on line are true!”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wice123
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I left and was very scared. Upon arriving I was shocked. The registration area is nice, however we were not allowed to check in until 6:30pm. We arrived at 4:15pm. The rooms were not clean! After we checked in we went to the pools. The pools were ok clean, the grounds were disgraceful! Weeds and bugs everywhere. Our hotel room was dirty. Our feet from the carpets were black. The kitchen was missing 1/2 of what it should of had in it. Our fridge dripped water inside and ruined a bunch of our food. The toilet didn't flush properly. There were bugs in our room! Two huge ones and a ton of what I thought were like fruit flies. The problem is that we didn't have any fruit or food out on the counter area's. We had to call for towels, linens and after they delivered them had to call back because we had no pillow cases. Those never showed so I used my husbands t-shirts as pillow cases. I'm not sure what to say about this place but managment needs to wake up and smell the coffee! With some TLC this could be a very nice resort. It's too bad it's so run down and DIRTY.

Reviews.Title: “bad place please read”
Reviews.Author: richard24usmc
Reviews.Content: fist night celing leaked in room one room 2 no ac and washer did not work room 3 ac worked but that was it could not get another room that night it was all booked so in the last room we get we woke up with a cockroch on us and the ac broke that could not be fixed never had towles just a bad place to stay they need to spend some money to fix the place looks good on the outside and that is about it

Reviews.Title: “I will never return”
Reviews.Author: Ezekiel2
Reviews.Content: Oak Plantation Resort has big cockroaches running around in their unit, along with baby roaches. the kitchen has clear looking bugs crawling around the kitchen. food, dirt, and dust under the beds and pullout beds. looks good on the out side, but nasty !

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: lina978
Reviews.Content: stayed here last year with my boyfriend on a 10 day vacation.. the aretings weren't that great when we booked but were surpised to find there really wasnt anythign wrong with the resort. theres a lot of families that stay here so if you're lookinf for a party hotel look elsewhere. the scenery was really nice once you dribe into the resort. there are so many different birds i'd never seem !the villa we stayed in was pretty clean but not necessarily up to date. but pretty spaciousd overall. I'd definately go back.. super great deals if you book through Expedia!!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before going. It is nasty!”
Reviews.Author: Net13
Reviews.Content: We had 2 units and had reservations about staying from the reviews but went anyway. What a big mistake. The units had lots of ants. We asked to have the units sprayed and they did with a couple of squirts of bug killer. We ended up complaining again with another round of squirts. We had to purchase our own. The units were nasty and they sent someone to do a thourgh cleaning. What a joke that was. We bought our cleaner also. What sheets we had were stained. There wasn't a bottom sheet. Again waiting on someone to bring them until 10 pm. The ladies took our wash clothes and hand towels and it took 2 days to get some more. Thankfully we had 2 so we kept washing them. The fridge in 1 unit leaked water and kept flooding the floor. Yes we tried to move and they of course didn't have anything. The people at the front desk didn't seem to care about our problems. We wanted to get pool towels and they didn't want to give us any without a pool card. They didn't bother to give us any when we checked in but it was treated as if we had the problem. A lady behind us was having the same problems.

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated and misunderstood.”
Reviews.Author: joro218
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 nights at oak plantation after reading many negative reviews and I'm thoroughly pleased with the staff, location, room, and most of all the peace and quiet. I had the option to decline maid service up front so no one bothered me at 9a.m. every day. I was close to everything I needed. Wallgreens, nighttime, Disney, etc. Will be back with my family again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is in need of a Make Over, ASAP! Very Disappointed..”
Reviews.Author: TDRDTJ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had traveled to this place 11 years ago and boy has nothing changed! No, let me re-fraise it, a lot has changed! Everything on line looks great but when you are there it's a different story. It's runed down. The people at the front desk were great and tried their best to do the right thing but when you don't have much to work with it makes it really hard. Where to start, the carpets were filthy, the tub didn't drain well so the water would back up to your ankles. The unit has a door for the generator cooling system and it didn't have the cover and it was never cleaned. The smoke detector was hanging off the wall. It seems that the way of cleaning is just sweeping everything into the closet and hope no one looks in it. Didn't even bother with the kitchen & washer and dryer after hearing the same horrible stories from practically everyone we met. Oh, and they have a safe in the closet that doesn't work in any unit, the reason being, that they lost the contract with that vendor!! what does that mean, is that the only company that can provide this service?? So don't expect to put anything in a safe. I know that you can't please everyone and I'm usually a fare person with reviews but this place needs to put money into it's facility. The place has potential but if things don't change it's going down hill from here. On the other hand if you are the kind of traveler that doesn't mind these living conditions or if you are just using this place just to sleep, then this is the place for you.. Minutes away from everything! One thing that we were pleased with was the great people we met while staying there. It's the beginning of some great long lasting friendships.. other than that we'll never stay here again. Oh and don't expect to use your laptop in unit, you have to be around the pool area to get internet..mean while other $19 a night rooms offer wifi free! you figure that one out..

Reviews.Title: “no way”
Reviews.Author: CarOlyn54_11
Reviews.Content: To begin with I just got home from here. Most of the place was nice, but...I saw 4 roaches in our room and told them this morning about it when I left. They didn't seem concerned. My Grandson and I had to change rooms the first night. Our TV was not up to date, the washer didn't work and the refrigerater didn't get very cold. The bartenders at the Tiki Bar could use some help in showing customers a good time and the pool had tiles off of it. Now I am not one to complain but...I don't live with roaches period and alot of people were complaining. I will not go back here again

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Staten_Island_Mike
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start this review by saying the Staff at this resort is great. They really seem to care about the guests, and often go above an beyond. If it weren't for the staff, I would definately give this resort zero or one stars. I wanted to make that point before continuing with my review. Our Scenario: We own 2 weeks in the Sheraton Vistana, but not this week. We booked this through RCI as a "last minute vacation" and our intention was to stay the week and look at real estate propertiies since we are looking to relocate down to Florida. We are on a tight budget, and decided to drive down from NYC to save on air and car rental, and the price for this resort was just right ($300 for the week through RCI). I was hesitant to book based on the mixed reviews, but since my wife and I are not very picky, we decided to take a chance. Accomodations: Check-in was fast and simple, and not one sales person approached us (this is a timeshare). We were given room 512 which was towards the back of the resort. Upon entering the room, we immediately noticed the stains on the carpet, cracked tiles, broken drawers and no sign of any cookware (I like to cook). Normally, I would suck it up and make the best of it. Well, after a 18 hour drive, it didn't take much for us to pick up the phone and complain to the front desk. They must get this response a lot, because they immediately said, "come to the front desk, and we will let you check out another room." We took them up on their offer and ended up in room 1204. This was a 2 story 1 bedroom unit with probably twice as much room as the first unit. This makes me wonder if they just stick the low paying RCI members in their worst units and hope they don't complain. This new unit did not have much cookware either. We called the desk, and within minutes, a guy showed up with a couple of beat up frying pans. It was good enough to cook up some eggs in the morning. This unit was also "dated" but functional. The dishwasher would get "stuck" midway through the cycle, and would keep running until you advanced the dial a bit. The Washer and dryer was adequate, although we needed to run the dryer twice to get clothes dry. Our biggest issue was the ant problem. These little guys were all over the counters. DO NOT LEAVE ANY FOOD OUT ON THE COUNTERS. We only had 1 remote control, and the batteries were dead, which we had to replace ourselves. The engineering guy never showed up to fix it. The deck outside the bedroom was unusable because there was some major Bird-poop all over (see photo). Also, there is no mid-week exchange of linen or towels as most timeshares have. Grounds and Ammenities: The welcoming Peacocks are wonderful. There was one with 3 little babies in tow. The gounds need some serious work. I did not see one gardner the whole trip. Everything seems brown and unkept. The pool area was nice, but there are many borken pool tiles with sharp edges which are a serious hazard to children and adults. The gym is a joke. I like to keep my workout routine even while on vacation. The machines were antiques, and the AC didn't work. It felt like it was an unsafe 112 degrees in the room. We ended up finding a Planet Fitness right accross the street. It cost us $120 for the week, but at least we are still alive to talk about it. The Wi-Fi is non-existant in the rooms.
