You will need own transport as shuttle service only runs a few times a day. Driving to parks and other attractions very easy from here. Excellent selection of restaurants and stores in the immediate area. We did not come across any time share reps at all. We would recommend this resort to anybody and we have stayed on Disney resorts in the past. This resort is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ok but definately not 4 V rating that we expected from Virgins rating”
Reviews.Author: x2kmp
Reviews.Content: We too booked this hotel as a package through Virgin Holidays. Before depature we noticed an increasing number of negative reviews had been posted and were worried about what we might find. What we did find was a slightly tired Floridian style apartment generally clean but the pull out sofa bed had quite a few holes on the underside which we commented on but was not changed. The pool area was nice and quiet and the kids greatly enjoyed this although the pool temperature was occassionally very warm. The fitness suite was very dated and equipment a bit tempramental. TVs in the room were old style and picture quality poor. Location good just a bit away from all the hustle and bustle. Some people have commented about no towels etc. and we we did get home on several occassions to find no towels and bedding which was sorted with a phone call to reception however something you could really do without on several occassions when returning homes with young kids shattered after a busy day . The apartment was cleaned everyday to a reasonable standard. However we came home one day to find the maid had left the door unlocked all day. Luckily no harm was done but the staffs relaxed attitude over the incident wasn't that reassuring. Overall the accomodation was ok but definately did not live up to virgings 4 V rating that we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not as bad as the reviews make it out to be... Nice place”
Reviews.Author: littlekky
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week there, yes we are owners and I was very leary about going after reading so many negative reviews. Our room was great, not dirty like the comments we did have a shortage of towels for our family upon arrival but with a phone call it was solved quickly the first call. The resort I think is going down hill but not nearly as bad as people make it out to be, Jusy needs some TLC. I would not hesitate to go back next year. The satff is very friendly and helpfull and the pools are great... My Kids loved it and did not want to leave...

Reviews.Title: “Be very wary of choosing this complex - its the worst we've seen!”
Reviews.Author: palmcat
Reviews.Content: We are "Frequent Virgins" and booked our holiday through Virgin Holidays and it is the worst accomodation we have experienced with Virgin!!!! The accomodation was not very clean and were greeted withn an infestation of ants crawling all over the bathroom basin and countertops!!!! When we first arrived there was no bedding for the sofa bed and when we asked for bedding only two sheets arrived - we had to ask again to get pillows and blankets!!!! We constantly had to request for more towels and over a 48 hour period had to share ONE towel between 2 adults and 2 teenagers!!!! The staff are very friendly, but dont act on our requests... I agree with the Canadian who suggested the whole place be torn down and rebuilt... The location is nice and quiet and yes, there are peacocks and squirrils and ducks running free which is nice for the kids, however, its a shame about the accomodation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: annmckay84
Reviews.Content: The place was beautiful and staff were so friendly and helpfull, The rooms were large and clean and we always had plenty of towels etc never had to ask for anything. We certainly hope to come back again with our family ages from 4 to 58 great holiday had by all. I would certainly recomend Oak Plantation Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, charming, great value.”
Reviews.Author: kimik00
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package through Virgin Holidays. After booking we noticed a few negative reviews had been posted and were worried about what we might find. What we did find was a lovely, quiet, large apartment with all the amenities you would want. If you are into modern style this isn't for you but it was nicely decorated in typical Floridian style and it was clean, it was a little tired in some places but nothing that caused any problems with he stay. I am told that some apartments are better than others. The pool area was nice and quiet and the free wireless was great to use whilst relaxing in the sun. The accommodation is a way out from the main attractions but that's why we chose it, you have to drive everywhere in Florida so it was nice to drive back to a quiet relaxing place like Oak Plantation. Some people have commented about no towels etc. we did get home on a couple of night to find no towels but with a quick phone call to reception new towels arrived within minutes, no matter how late we called. The apartment was cleaned everyday to a high standard. The best bit for us was the laundry room in the apartment which meant every night we chucked our clothes straight in the washing machine and just went home with a suitcase full of clean clothes, no piles of dirty laundry to go home to.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: readinessnco
Reviews.Content: This resort is misleading. It is not a gated resort, it has a gate but no one tends it. The rooms smell like smoke and mold and have a very dirty feel to them. When we checked in several guests were at the front desk complaining that they had no toliet paper or bath towels. All the rooms are smoking rooms. The location is no where close to the theme parks as advertised. We checked in saw our room and checked right back out. Would not recommend this resort to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: VMBASmith
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude, the rooms smelled like mold! The placed looks like a dump and itsw so far away from the theme parks!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandbrit2004
Reviews.Content: It has been an absolute horror story of room switches, mold, cat pee smells, broken promisses, poor customer service, broken AC in the middle of summer, and over all headaches. Please spare you family the vacation of their nightmares, as I wish I had, and stay at a much classier Econo Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: EdMomof3
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this resort. The initial apartment they placed us in was at the back of the resort. The room was filthy! The carpet was disgusting and the bed was unmade. I immediately called the front desk and was given "a nice room" and although the room was nicer it still was not clean. Nothing in the room worked properly...not the dishwasher or the washer and dryer. I had two young children and felt that I had to hold them the entire time we were there to keep them off of the carpet. It is conveniently locate but so are so many other resorts and hotels. Many of the activities they advertise were cancelled. The free internet service they promise is only during certain hours and you can only access it from the pool area or internet cafe'. I strongly suggest that you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at cleaner campgrounds....!!!”
Reviews.Author: 53Five
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible!! Like I stated....I've stayed at campgrounds that were better than this place. It was dirty, old and run down. There were stray cats and raccoons, garbage and cigarette butts all over the place. It doesn't look like anyone has kept this place up at all. I seen lots of staff.....who knows what they were doing?? The carpets were gross and the furniture old. I felt uncomfortable laying in the bed. The bathrooms had mold and mildew and the air filters were all clogged with dust. There was duct tape on the microwave oven to hold the trim on it. Someone dropped a container of butter in one of the walkways and it was there for 3 days....pathetic. The pools were ok and were the best part of the place, but over by the tiki bar, there were old mops and buckets leaning against the building, all in plain sight. Just gross. And the tool of a bartender had music going way too loud for the place. The Kissimmee Airport is a stones throw away, so all day and night planes are landing and taking off and it is incredibly noisy. You feel you could jump and touch some that are landing cause they are so low. The resort is in a rougher part of the town, you could just tell from the adjacent run down motels and the type of riff raff walking around the area. Police sirens could be heard all hours of the night. I would not recommend staying here, avoid it if you can. There are much better places I've stayed at a few resorts in the area: Orbit One which was better....also stayed at Whyndym Cypress Palms, which is incredible, and at Summer Bay, also very nice. Pics to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom adjoining kitchen”
Reviews.Author: kenji98
Reviews.Content: It would be a great deal if I didn't have a place with a bathroom that opens into the kitchen area--it was clean but I have stayed at better lay outbut it will do if you are family and need to be on the go with the kids---quiet....the supermarket is just outside and it is a savings while visiting orlando----the premise is clean---we did go to the pool but for a short time--clean---make sre your room doesnt have a bathroom that connects to the kitchen---that's the only drawback

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Bar should have limes, celery and bloody mary mix or go out and buy it!”
Reviews.Author: jersey7467
Reviews.Content: Bartender was more concerned about his laptop computer then playing music for the guests. Never had limes the whole week. . What kind of bar doesnt have limes, lemons or celery? REALLY!!!! Turn off the computer and have someone go to the store to pick up supplies or better yet order the supplies on your laptop !

Reviews.Title: “horrible resort”
Reviews.Author: GLASSMAN520
Reviews.Content: We are owners of a time share at this resort, since we bought back in 1999 the place was beautiful, this is the first time we have been back and it it will be the last time. We pay fees every year for maintanice but there is nothing being done at hte resort , the buildings are rundown on the outside and the units are so run down its a joke. We checked in on 05/15 and they had to move to 3 different un its because of leaks, broken air conditioners and mold in the units. The furniture and appliances and carpets look like their at last 20 years old, it was so run down and shabby looking. They management does not seem to care about how the place looks. We had conversations with other guests staying there and they had the same problems, one them they tried to put them in a unit with the bathroom floor caving in. DO NOT EVERCONSIDER AT THIS RESORT IT WOULD BE YOUR WORST VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bigleap
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews that people left, i was a bit dubious but then i was pleasantly surprised. The resort was lovely and the grounds etc well maintained. The accomodation was spacious and bright, and situated across the lake, with turtles, fish, ducks and their ducklings. There was just and array of wildlife (no alligators) including peacocks and armidillos. The ammenities were great and free to use. The free internet room was great with free soda too. The swimming pools were clean and well presented. it was great to come back from a day in the parks and have a refreshing swim. The resort is very well situated just off of highway 192 which has an array of shops, entertainment, restaurants. In fact we preferred the 192 to International drive. It is really easy to find disney from the resort. Turn right onto th e192 and keep driving a few k and then disney is sign posted. No problems at all. We can honestly say it was a great stay there, and we met so many interesting American people. It was nice to stay somewhere that was not home from home which many of these resorts tend to be. The only thing i will grumble about, but which got sorted very quickly was that on our arrival at 1 am, we were rather shattered and had not bedlinen, most annoying, but solved quickly enough. And some days we got towels and others not. But none of that distracted us from the delight of the resort. Well done Oak Plantation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't panic if you've booked this - it's not at all bad”
Reviews.Author: George555Oxford
Reviews.Content: We read really bad reviews just before we travelled here bur don't panic....... Good: Really helpful staff - were very kind to us when we were stranded due to the Volcano Close to Disney - Go straight down 192 and you're there Quiet Secure Good facilities - Free wifi and internet cafe were a godsend when our trip was Volcanoed 3 pools (heated and unheated) Kids activites (eg Movie nights with pop corn and drinks) Spacious apartments with dishwasher, washing machine and tumble drier Bad: Past it's best now and looking a little tired Wrong end of US 192 Close to the fire station so noisy if they get a "shout" in the middle of the night None of the apartments had their full quota of utensils

Reviews.Title: “This place is nasty...unless you are going for the pool area”
Reviews.Author: ilovemykids17
Reviews.Content: This place gave me the shakes.Our room was so nasty. There were little bugs every place that you looked. The carpet was filthy. The rooms are so out dated unless you have a time share...I saw a nice building by the pool. The pool area was great and clean. The lobby and the place that you eat breakfast were nice. The rooms are super nasty. Our fridge was screwy and the pull out matress was broke. We had to ask 3 different times for a new one. If you get a one bedroom, the matress or shall i say mat are worst than prisoners I would imagine. We had to ask for a roll away and the store them in a broken garage. the door is half open. The house keepers are terrible! the only thing this place has going for it is tge activities and pool area. I would not recomend this to my worst enemy...room wise! Ask to see your room before you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What A Shame”
Reviews.Author: vac25
Reviews.Content: This resort has become exponentially run down since our last stay there two years ago. We saw three of the units this time, because we had friends with kids stay there with us based on our advice. All three units had water damaged ceilings, spot painted/patched areas on the walls, bumps throughout the carpets as well as stains. Surprisingly, the pool area still seemed kept up. However, the outside of the buildings looked dingy. Two years ago, we came away from our vacation at Oak Plantation Resort thinking we stayed in a beautifully designed condo village. It was visually very appealing, pristine and so close to many attractions. It was an excellent value. It was a bustling place which was not the case this time. What happened?

Reviews.Title: “Far from Disney, poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: pascal482
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oak Plantation Resort in March 2010, and while we had high hopes, the place has fallen into disrepair. That is not likely to change as they are "understaffed", which was a comment made to my father-in-law by a staff member in the welcome office. The staff that are there are skilled at driving golf carts, but not much else. A few observations: The main pool was closed when we arrived, with yellow plastic "caution" tape circling it. The pump had failed and the water was no longer being filtered. It was quite green and dirty looking. This was repaired on Thursday, four days after we arrived and three days before we departed. Perhaps there are few pool maintenance companies in Florida. The other, smaller pool, was working but the heater had failed so the water was quite cold. As for the baby pool, the water coming out of the "fountain" was less than clear. Also, the fountain was constructed from metal pipes that were rusting and not very safe. At the pool, the bar and social area was pretty rundown, with dirty green plastic grass carpet on the deck. The drinks dispensed were pretty weak, and the pina coladas weren't mixed properly. At night there was music blaring out of old beat up speakers. Not a very relaxing scenario. The tennis court was relatively new but the net had no tape so it was about 5 inches too high. And one of the gates had a broken latch so you couldn't close the gate. Disappointing as we do enjoy playing tennis every day. The unit where we stayed was relatively clean, but had its issues as well. No door stop, so the front door would bang against the wall. The clothes dryer didn't vent to the outside because the pipe was clogged. Basically a fire hazard. The stove had only one element/burner working, and it had two settings: off and high and hot. No medium or low heat. You could hear people walking around upstairs which was a minor nuisance. The playground for kids was operational but getting tired. Just not maintained at all. We stayed there because the time share our in-laws had was full, so this was the only place with available space. We now know why. Keep in mind, the place is attractive when you walk through, it's just poorly maintained and calling the staff is useless. Day after day when we went to the office, there were vacationers complaining about one thing or another to the staff, who just weren't equipped to help. My guess is the turnover rate is very high. Location About a 25 minute drive from Disney. Too far for our taste so we only went once and stayed the whole day. It's near many strip malls and chain restaurants. Not an attractive area, and the failing economy is very evident. Many closed restaurants, and boarded up businesses. I would guess this place will go under and the owners will try to sell. Good luck, it will be hardly livable by then. The only reason I would stay here again is if it was $50 per night and I couldn't find a place any closer to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute shamble.”
Reviews.Author: surprized
Reviews.Content: I'll break this down room by room, but let me start by telling you that you'll be charged for your full length stay before you even arrive. We booked in late February for an April vacation. Our "villa" was the two bedroom, 2 bath with kitchen. It boasted 3 T.V.'s and a safe. Mind you I read some reviews and became very concerened so I called two weeks in advance to ask why they had such bad reviews. The woman I spoke to assured me that all these problems had been resolved that they had new staff that addressed housekeeping and mechanicals. Keep in mind check out is 10am and check in is 4pm. Upon arrival between 4pm and 4:30 it took 50 min. to check in. My husband noticed others were having issues with checking in but primarily that rooms were not ready. Upon entering our "villa" we noticed what looked like the door had been kicked in at one time and a LARGE dead bolt was in it's place. It smelled musty and smokey. At first glance it seemed OK however as we walked around we found the following: **Kitchen** Broken glass in the sink, oven was warm inside and heating elements were dangling but it was shut off. Floor was absolutely filthy with dirt and food. **Bathrooms** Smelled of urine because there was urine on the toilet seat and all around. Hair in the tub and sink. Shower walls had a layer of soap scum. Safe in master room was missing and it appeared it had been literally torn out of the wall with drywall hanging. **Bedrooms** All 3 beds in the "villa" needed a change of linens eventhough the beds were made I felt the need to check the sheets and to my dismay they had dirt, crumbs, lots of hair and stains on them including the pillows . A few of the pillows didn't even have casses on them. All three T.V. remotes were either missing batteries or they were dead. The carpet and all flooring was filthy with old dust and dirt in the corners. Most of the windows were unlocked (1st floor) and when my husband tried to call for housekeeping to request clean sheets, towels (because there were none) and batteries he realized the phone wasn't working. We used my cell phone to call. The phone was replaced fairly quickly by a nice gentlemen, however by then we still didn't have towels or sheets. Oh yes did I mention there wasn't any toilet paper either?! Anyway, after 4 hours of waiting and having called for housekeeping 3 times our final call was to inform them that we were leaving and finding someplace else to stay. Wouldn't you know it miraculously the manager (a man) and a woman who claimed she inspected the room herself knocked on our "villa" door. I at this time had already shut the master bedroom door to make phone calles using the yellow pages for an availble hotel with pretty much the same ammenaties. By this time it was 8:30pm. I was VERY fortunate to have a man on the other end of the line that was patient, understanding and accomodating to the point that he googled directions and in detail explained how to get to the hotel from our present location. In the meantime my husband tried explaining and showing all the discrepencies. I won't bore you with anymore details but I assure you they did not see it our way nore did they see the need for us to leave however the manager offered to clean it himself but that we should return the next day to complete our stay at the "villa". My husband very nicely declined the offer and explained that were were leaving and that we expected a full refund. In summary, we checked out and arrived at our beautiful, CLEAN hotel at 10:00pm where we enjoyed the rest of the week without worry. Housekeeping was prompt, friendly and when we requested extra towels or blankets they were ther within a few short minutes. Not to mention a complimentary breakfast and open bar and dinner each night for 1.5 hours (also complimentary). That's what I call service and it was only $50/day more. In a nut shell - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: hiepoole
Reviews.Content: We book this resort last spring before having a look in the Trip advisor. So as you would we were a bit worried what it would be like and whether it would effect our holiday. I have to say it did not – in fact it was a nice surprise. We booked a two bedroom apartment 1102 which was on the 1st floor. The room was situated in the far right corner of the resort. The rooms were large and clean; the kitchen equipped with cups plates and everything we needed for a night in when we decided to have taken away as cooking is strictly off limit on holidays. We had house keeping every day, making the beds, wash and put away any crockery left in sink, empty bins and clean the bathrooms. The only thing I would say is to keep your bath towels as they are only replaced in seven day intervals. The resort was clean and relaxing. We used the pool a few times during our stay, the water was warm enough for children to swim in and we met a lot of nice people. The location could not been better for the theme parks and places to eat in. We hired a car and been flexible to do as we please. As for the value it was excellent. There are peacocks in the resort and you can hear then, sometimes early in the morning which my not be pleasant for some. Service all in all was good, could not fault. Would recommend this place and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: prowler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oak in April 2010, we checked in late and were given a filthy room, it looked like someone pucked on the carpet in living room, the next day they moved us to another room this was a little better so we thought ,but there was no house keeping done unless multiplyle requests, also cockroches in the bathroom.We stayed at the oak last year and thought it was decent, this place has hit rock it not worth $30 a nite.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Awesome, great, friendly service and staff, unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: JuhiOberoi23
Reviews.Content: This hotel, was initially judged poor by the reviews given before, but as we saw the pictures etc, we fell in love with this place. First we thought it was a big mistake choosing this place, but as we reached the resort, we just LOVED it. The room is fantastic with comfortable beds and a kitchenette and stuff. There was a convient little shop right next to our room inside the resort which was nice. The interiors are beautiful! With Oaks spread all over and beautiful pond with a lovely fountain in the middle. We could enjoy its view by sitting in this cute little gazebo thing. The pool and stuff was enjoyable and every weekend or something they had this movie and popcorn on the poolside which was really fun! The coffee and cookies in the lobby was homely and welcoming with the pleasant staff. The best part was with the free pizza and coke, at the Bingo afternoon every Tuesday.The kids had loads of fun playing the Video Game and Playground area. Along with this we were given a free shuttle to the parks(DisneyWorld, Universal, SeaWorld) which was OK and later we had to switch to cabs. But overall the entertainment, beauty and comfort was truly remarkable. You should surely visit if you are with a young family whos looking for some relaxation and fun!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend staying at the resort”
Reviews.Author: NeedAnotherVacation4
Reviews.Content: Oak Plantation Resort in Kissimmee, FL. hope you are not sending people there to be disappointed. I stayed there last week and the place is going to the dogs. I know it changed hands a two of years ago, but the up keep is a disaster in the room. The rooms are not as cleaned and the furniture was broken, toilet not cleaned, cob webs on the ceiling and walls. Gutters are not cleaned which cause the rain to over flow at the doorway entrance. The pillows were flat, so we request 4 extra pillows. The bedspread was wore and stained; They send someone over with another bedspread. There's VHS player in the suite to only find out that they have DVD only for rent. I took pictures because its hard to believe I am paying a mortgage for this dump. I had a meeting scheduled with the resort manager and she backed out and didn't bother to call to inform me that she was unable to make our appointment, but sent someone else in her place. They send a supervisor () to take a look at my complaint and he found the place the same way as I described. Busted security lock, they changed the lock. They changed the dresser and cleaned the cobb webs, gave me a new 4 cup coffee pot because the 8 cup coffee maker in the condo was scorched and burned at the bottom, replaced the broom because the one in the condo have no handle. The ceiling fan over the dining table maked a loud noise when turned on. For my satisfaction they gave me 2 child ticket to Universal Studios, my children was happy, but that didn't satisfy my answers as to why this place look the way it do. I hope that upper management gets hope to this letter and decide to clean up the property. All of these issue should have been done before occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, relaxing, lots to do and safe for families!”
Reviews.Author: crdandsta
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our spring break at the Oak Plantation Resort and as always had a wonderful time. Kids stayed so busy they spent and entire day resting when we arrived back home. We enjoyed swimming in the pool (1 was heated and 1 was not) plus there was a large water kiddy play area for toddlers. The Jacuzzi was working great so on the chilly nights kids would go from one to the other. The grounds are peaceful, no noisey busses shuffling guests around. We spent our mornings walking the loop around the pond, kids saw turtles, birds, ducks, fish and had fun with the peacocks. My friend used the pond as a scenic place for her family photo. Last year when we were there they chased around baby peacocks so it was fun to see how big they have gotten. The time, we stayed in the loft which had plenty of room for us. We had extra pillows and blankets stored in the closets for the fold -out -couch. Things were simple, not elaborate but clean and that is important! We did notice a few changes in the resort one being the towel pool service, you now have to check them out as the front desk, but that's not a bad thing as in previous stays there was wasted towels scattered all over the pool deck that a paid employee had to gather up. The other being the children's activities they were not scheduled as in previous stays but to be honest I think my kids were the only ones participating at times. The sandcastle contest and pool games were often empty so while we enjoyed them in past stays I can understand why they may not have them all the time due to lack of participation. When we stayed this past week there were so many activities that we could not possible do everything, the kids played basketball (again, checked out the ball at desk), the tennis courts were active, the workout room also had several people in there doing cardio machines, they had Bingo night with FREE pizza and prizes for $ at the tiki bar or general store, comedy night by the pool (couldn't tear the kids away to have dinner), big screen TV movie night by the pool, a childrens playground and sandcastle area, there is a game room at the resort but we walked across the street to the mall and kids played in the larger one. One night we walked across to Friendlys and ordered ice cream to go, not have to load kids up in the car was great! We brought games out to the pool, other families were playing cards, scrabble, catch with the football, etc. I even caught a few making up there own pool games! They have a wonderful Tiki bar, the bartender played some fun music and cooked up some yummy Cubans, cheeseburgers, chicken fingers and fries. I heard a few comments from other resort guests that they missed the children activities (specifically the tie die shirts), but as I recall you had to pay for those so not like it was a very popular craft. Of course the few that made comments were also enjoying the 2 for 1 happy hour at the tiki bar! The staff was extremely friendly, I was greeted at the front desk with smiles, I was even allowed to get in the room early to let the kids change into bathing suits. While I waited on the children to change I noticed to ladies cleaning my room, one in the kitchen who emptied the ice bin and rinsed it out, she also wiped down all the shelves in the refrig. The location is very convenient to many restaurants, parks and other fun activities. They have free internet access around the pool so many were on the computer, there is also an internet cafe which has free sodas and snacks and free coffee in the lobby.. You can choose to cook breakfast or eat at the all you can eat buffet for only $5.95, kids got to make there own waffles and top with fruit and whipped cream. Eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, coffee, juice, yogurt, oatmeal and more.. unlimited! Now that's a relaxing vacation, I can't wait to return and stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation with nieces 2”
Reviews.Author: sugarindiana
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place to my worse enemy. The service was horrible. I paid for cleaning sevice and never recieved the service. I even paid the staff under the table to please clean the room which was never done. Had to pick up clean towels at the front desk. Ask for a frying pan and was given a dirty one (rotten eggs) with dish detergent to wash my self. What I pay for 4 nights I sure there are other places in the Orlando area that are more customer focuse then Oak Plantation. Please don't stay there. I personally talked with the Human Resources Sharon and was even a pity story. HOW SAD. I made the best of my vacation outside on OAK PLANTATION RESORT

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort - a run down dump”
Reviews.Author: lololaaaaaa
Reviews.Content: We had to change rooms because the first one was so run down. Of course the defects weren't apparent until after the groceries done and put away and luggage unpacked--so at 10 o'clock at night we're changing rooms with no help from the staff. Waited 4 hours for maintenance to appear after complaining about kitchen sink water draining directly onto the floor, fridge not cold although freezer is noisily making ice. Shower head squirting out water horizontally right through the bathroom door into the kitchen. Husband took apart shower head nozzle and re-attached it and then the water came out in one jet stream. Made for a painful shower.So when maintenance man finally appears in casual clothes and sports jacket-doesn't even know how to adjust pliers. He's got the dishwasher pulled out from under sink to get at piping--shower head apart and wants to send a repairman out tomorrow to fix everything. Maintenance guy said freezer parts were missing that deflects cold air into the fridge so he leaves and comes back with plastic parts in his hand which he stripped from another fridge. Go figure. So we're expected to spend our vacation sitting in the room watching a repairman work. I think not. We demanded another room tonight. Of course we checked it out first before moving.Naturally it's the last thing we wanted to be doing after travelling since 430 in the morning , we were exhausted and just wanted to go to sleep. Other deficiencies from first room #912 included: 1.--lacking kitchen supplies-no towels. Had mini coffee maker. Scant on cookware- no frying pan.no dish soap provided. Any other timeshare supplies kitchen dish soaps, dishwasher soap and at least one laundry detergent. 2.-- Had to call for towels--Only enough towels for one person. Shouldn't have to call for towels for a unit that is ready to accommodate 4 people. Should have enough towels for 4 people to start with. The same thing happened again after exchanging rooms. 3.--Ice tray from freezer had mold in it. Second room #512- inconsistencies.--No extra blanket or pillows or bedding for pull out couch. In room safe broken. Again had to call for towels. No kitchen towels or soaps.AT least normal size coffee maker. Also only one pool in service but not heated as advertised. Pretty lame fitness center--no hand weights even. I suggest you check your room first before unpacking and filling the fridge.First and last time at this run down dump. Thank goodness we only had 3 days inconvenience to endure before going to our next location. RCI should remove this resort from their timeshare brochure. I encourage all timeshare owners to complain directly to your timeshare network.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill...they've hit ROCK BOTTOM!”
Reviews.Author: daknights
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! The rooms are disgustingly dirty. The floors are crinkled and stained. The bathroom tiles were all ungrouted and you had to wear shoes so that you didn't get your foot cut. There was no shower curtain in the bathroom and it took them hours to bring one. The towels were thin, well worn and frayed. The one bedroom had 2 lights and neither worked, the dust bunnies and goo behind and under the beds were so big I thought they would carry our kids off! We also found old food behind the head board. The lights and the safe in the closet didn't work. The kitchen was also a disaster! The toaster didn't work. There was no pans or frying pans. The stove elements didn't work. Luckily our fridge did work, but what's the point if you can't cook anything??? It didn't have any washing up liquid or tea towels. The coffee maker didn't work. The pool was also broken and no one was allowed in. It was fixed the last day of our stay. But I see from other peoples comments, this appears to be an ongoing problem as we were after them! As for the staff..... they were over worked, unable to speak English, slow, incompetent etc, etc. They also drive around on gas powered golf carts which are extremely noisy, old and smelly...pumpin out blue smoke. They also drive them all hours of the night. We actually thought that a few of the employees were dealing drugs under the condo we were staying in as they were coming and going at all hours of the night. When we complained about the noise, we were told that the employees go home at 5pm??? One to three o'clock in the morning was their busy time underneath us??!!! You tell me what they are doing down there?? We had to change rooms 3 times and believe it or not, these complaints were from the stay in the "acceptable" room. Our complaints from the other two rooms were much worse. I would never stay here again and that is sad because we have stayed here 2 times before. I'm not sure that a manager even exists at the place as we asked to speak to him/her and they never got back to us in the week we were there! The whole place is falling apart. The gutters off the roofs are falling off. The wood exterior is rotting. The security locks had been busted off. There are no activities for the children. The list of complaints just goes on and on.............PLEASE don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating but is convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: berryhyundai
Reviews.Content: If you can get past the creepy time share sales guy at the front desk (they hold your parking pass hostage until you talk to this creep) the place is quiet, convenient to the airport, Disney theme parks and shopping. The rooms are spacious and the kitchen/laundry is super convenient. Our kitchen was missing some key cooking utensils and bakeware. The blankets had holes in them, the towels thin and old. We wound up buying a cookie sheet, paper plates, cups and plastic ware and that seemed to help. Also we brought our own towels from home which was a huge help. The pool area is nice, the grounds are nice, and the resident peacocks are sweet. The location is in the ghetto of Kissimmee but has a security gate at the entrance, which makes you feel a bit better. Its too bad, because you can tell that it used to be a nice area, but has gone down hill in the last 5 years. I would not walk alone outside the complex at night! The other customers there were friendly, family oriented, fun people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly, good value”
Reviews.Author: sonicscreech
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time a this hotel, don't get me wrong. We would consider staying again, as the unit itself was very clean (cleaned every day by staff) fully furnished and quite large for a 1 bedroom. Good value for the money!!! They only minor criticisms (and this is what potential customers want to hear about) we have was that the bed that my 2 kids were to sleep on (which was the pull out couch converted) had a very poor mattress, felt the springs way to much. So we had them bring up a separate cot, which did the job. The cleaning lady kept taking our 4 bath towels in the morning and leaving us with only 2 , so we had to call back almost everyday to get extra towels sent up. And the service was a bit slow, not because the staff wasn't friendly, but i believe just because they did not have enough people working the front desk. Lastly the safe in our room was broken, but they let us use one at the front desk for our stay, which was fine by us.

Reviews.Title: “They don't care about your vacation”
Reviews.Author: nickelknife
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 6 night spring break vacation with the kids. We stayed here because of the 2 large heated pools. At $108/night we thought it was worth the extra expense because my kids love to swim. Most hotels/ suites in the area are about $29.99-79.99/ night, but yet again the pools make the resort and worth the extra expense. When we arrived Sunday night the pools were closed because of a pump issue. (I really can not fatham any pool problem that could take more than a day to fix??? I work in the construction business...filter, pump, heater) On Thursday afternoon the repair people were working on the pump and the pool was open Thursday night. However they would not heat the pool and the pool remain barely usable because the water was cold. We had one day of unheated pool use for our week stay. I made daily trecks to the office to complain to the manager and to adjust our bill to compensate for the closed pool but was always told he/she was too busy, try latter. I left my cell number and room number but they never contacted me. The week that we were there the weather was very cold...I can just imagine how much money they saved by having the pool closed with no heat. I also contacted expedia whom we booked this vacation thru and I was very supprised by their responce, we were on our own. They said they can't contact the resort and make a complaint....even though the money goes thru them? I won't be using Expedia and won't be staying at Oak Plantation again!

Reviews.Title: “Resort requires attention”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSteven49
Reviews.Content: 1. Check in - We arrived tired after a lengthy travel. Upon check in at the front desk our name could not be found although we had booked 6 months earlier. In order to obtain our parking pass for the resort parking we were sent to another desk – of course they were trying to sell us a timeshare. 2. Room – was nice, however the bathroom was clogged. The sink did not flow. There were 3 of us in the family. Only 2 towels were provided. Towels were as thin as paper. 3. Appliances - The dryer did not work. We requested a fix on the dryer and also the clogged bathroom. When the dryer ran it was not hooked up to blow outside, instead it heated and the steam went nowhere. After about an hour we’d have to take our towels out and hang on the furniture to dry. 4. Pool – only one pool was open but unusable. The other was not opened. There was a yellow caution tape all around (as though someone dies in the pool). The unusable pool was at least 60 degrees and for the duration of our week stay and so we were unable to use the pool. We were told they were awaiting a spare part. I guess they were flying it in from Alaska. Surprisingly the hot tub worked. All kids were in the hot tub. Take your own pool towels. They do provide towels except you have to walk to the front desk and sign for the towels...if you lose them they are $10 each. 5. Grounds – needed maintenance. Looked lame and needed cleaning. 6. Room supplies – take your own toilet paper; bath soap and shampoo. Also, if you do want to wash dishes and laundry take your supply. These are luxuries and although you’ve paid for the week – appear not to be a part of your rental. 7. Breakfast – thanks to Expedia – we were able to save on our breakfast. The Resort has a decent breakfast and the people there are friendly and welcoming. If you pay – its$5.99 adult of $3.99 kids. 8. Check out – our bill was of course incorrect – we were being charged incorrectly for breakfast we did not have. It took a few hours to have our bill fixed. Be sure to check your bill a day before you are ready to checkout. 9. We’ve been to this resort in Mar 2007 and also 2008 and loved our stay. Both times we did not have any complaints and actually loved it and therefore the reason for our return visit this March 2010. In the future, we’ll be looking elsewhere whenever we plan another vacation. Definitely not our standards, although the price was reasonable. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: dat14
Reviews.Content: We checked into our two bedroom "villa" on March 6th around 7:30PM. Much to our surprise there were no pillows or towels (seems to be a chronic problem); the fan in the master bedroom was so loud you couldn't use it, there was no coffee maker and there were no remote controls for the TV's--although there were three TV's. I called the desk and asked for the pillows, towels, etc. and was told it would be taken care of. My husband and I then took our daughter out to celebrate her birthday. The celebration was wonderful but imagine our surprise returning three hours later to find no pillows, towels, etc. I called the desk and was given an excuse--we learned fairly quickly the staff has excuses for whatever problem they are confronted with--however, this was I think rather original--there were no more pillows!! So...tough! After a sleepless night we tried to make the best of the next day, however, there was no coffee maker to start the day off as we normally would. After a visit to the front desk, yet again, I met with the manager on duty for Sunday--he was wonderful and actually managed to correct and fix all of our complaints. We went grocery shopping--the purpose of having a "villa" was to save money not buying every single meal out. We returned, put our groceries away and went out to our other daughter's softball tournament. We returned to find the refrigerator wasn't terribly cold; it made noise but didn't work well. This problem was never remedied; we all got sick eating eggs that were not properly refrigerated and the ice in the freezer melted. We ended up throwing away all the food we had purchased. The carpets were dirty, the pool was fixed the last day we were there and the staff with two exceptions were not helpful at all--clearly didn't even care about our comfort. We will never go there again--nor would we ever, every recommend this awful place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Resort has gone down hill signifcantly in the last two years”
Reviews.Author: mi_traveler_10
Reviews.Content: We were here two years ago and were impressed with the resort. However, the resort has deteriorated significantly since then. They no longer have an activities person, so there are no planned events for children. In our unit the stove door did not shut, the burners did not work and it had to be turned on and off with the circuit breakers. The only heated pool broke down on Sunday and FOUR days later it is still not repaired. The staff has no idea of when it will be repaired. The comment from the staff is "it is up to the pool company". If the resort truely compared about its guests, the pool would have been repaired in a day or two -- there certainly is not a shortage of pool companies in FL. Also, in the public laundry area, 3 of the 4 dryers are not functional. If you have a family, I'd suggest another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was great”
Reviews.Author: JennyLynn1982
Reviews.Content: Yeah, okay there is a time share guy that tries to sell you stuff, but we got free Typhoon laggon tickets for just going to the 1 hour free breakfast talk about time share. It was a little boring but worth it because we saved over 60 bucks. Was awesome! The rooms are actually little condos. (If you are dissabled, ask for a ground floor unit, no elevators) Only thing that was bad was the cheap utensils. Has full kitchen that comes ready with pans and plates and silverware and its all great except the can openers are really really chinsy. I tried to use it and it broke in my hand. I took it up to let them know and they didn't even blink. They even told me that, that happens all the time. LOL Other than that, you can't go wrong. Clean and roomy. No bad smells. Over all pretty great.

Reviews.Title: “poorly managed - not the cleanest, dont go if you like to shower,”
Reviews.Author: onvacationardrossan
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky person, Our family went January 22-29th our first ever family vacation. These were the problems....The bath tub was plugged we spent a week there it was plugged for 6 days. We could not use it. We showered in cold water outside by the outside pool. There was no safe it was broken, the hide a bed my kids slept in was broken, coffee pot didn't work, there's a kitchenette but there were no pots or pans or fry pan to cook in. Light on the coffee pot was broken so you had to unplug it so you would know it's off. complained and went to front office and advised we actually shower in canada daily. They finally fixed it on our last night of seven there. 2 days of seven our rooms weren't touched they left towels outside the door. I cleaned the room my self. Key cards zapped constantly and had to get them unzapped non stop to get into the room. we arrived at 12:30 a.m. and had to wait almost an hour to check in. The only good thing was the pool looked clean and the hot tub was nice and warm. Two TV's only one worked. Would visit florida again but would "not" stay there. The biggest problem POORLY MANAGED AND UNKEPT. FYI ....Met many people in the hot tub with similiar concerns and these were time share customers....they were not happy at all, same issues broken safe, no dishes or pots pans, no customer service the list goes on and on. "it looks great from the outside but dont let looks deceive you. , Edmonton Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep on the ground ... It would be cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: Gnaw71
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and firmly believe that grumpy people get grumpy people. Old furnishings doesn’t always mean a bad hotel and some people when it comes to cleanliness are a little too picky. I’ll try to provide the good points first, but this is proving to be a challenge. The location was close to SeaWorld and Disney. The lobby was nicely decorated for the season with a Christmas tree, a Menorah and 6 foot tall nutcrackers. The grounds, from what I saw of them at my 11:30 pm check in, where well maintained with a nice looking pool area and I looked forward to using the free car wash facilities. This is where the good ended and the bad began. The check in was slow and I was surprised at the number of times the phone rang at the front desk. There was a disgruntled guest at the front desk looking for towels. I just figured he had a long day and was a little grumpy…..boy was I wrong and I now understand why. Once Jeffrey at the front desk appeased his concerns by having security grab some towels, the guest left and I can only guess went back to his room. During this time the phone continued to ring incessantly. From what I could ascertain everyone needed towels. Once checked in, our horror story began. Upon entering the room I didn’t see the tell tale vacuum marks on the carpet but I chalked this up to just being an older carpet. I knew that the rooms looked a little dated by the photos and most of the reviews that I had read. I didn’t care I just needed a place for a week that was clean and was reasonably priced. About $1100 US with the bulk of the time in off season seemed reasonable for a place that rated 75% on TripAdvisor and came referred by CAA. After all, we weren’t spending our days in the room only eating suppers and sleeping there. We folded out the hide-a-bed and low and behold, no bedding. At this point I opened a bi-fold door thinking it was a closet, only to discover the furnace/air conditioner. The air filter had obviously never been replaced. It was dirt ladened and had holes throughout. There were dust balls in this little cubby the size of cats. I thought I’ll deal with this in the AM we can leave the window open…. Darn wouldn’t you know it - no screen…. Seeing this dirt, led me to check the cleanliness of the rest of the room. The dust behind the fridge was thick from the coils to the wall. There were dust webs and filth behind the stove, and a few lady bugs on the floor (the bugs, to me, were no big deal after all they were dead and in a corner and we were in Florida). The dishes were put away dirty and there were M&M’s loose in one of the cupboard shelves. The only thing that I felt was really clean was the tub, toilet and bathroom sink. At least they sparkled. At this point I made sure there were no bugs along the King size bed edge, and THANK GOD there weren’t. I proceeded up to the front desk to complain and to get some bedding for the kids. Jeffrey seemed genuine in his apology and gave me a blanket from the office and asked the security officer to get the rest of the bedding for me. He tried to find me another room but apparently the 3 rooms available still were not cleaned from the previous day. This was a Tuesday December 29th check in and they still hadn’t cleaned the room by 12:15 am on the Wednesday!!!! When I returned to the room, I met another couple from Ontario who advised me not to leave any food out and to keep it in the fridge. “The ants are bad,” I was told and “Oh by the way don’t ask for towels you won’t get any” When I returned to my room, my kids told me that there was no way they could sleep in the hide-a-bed. My daughter of less than 70 lbs sank into it like it was and inner-tube. Upon inspection, the underside of the mattress was virtually missing with cuts and tears throughout. Thank God for the King bed because that is where we slept for the night. Several minutes later, the security officer arrived with a sheet and 1 pillow case. This was all there was. I invited him in to ask his opinion of the room. We found more dirt! There was dust hanging out of the bathroom fan and dried spit along on the wall that had run down and clumped just shy of the baseboardll! It was obvious that the paint in the washroom had been done straight over dirty walls. He agreed with me that the room was deplorable and that he wouldn’t stay there in these conditions. Unfortunately, at this time of the night there were no other options. The night sleeping four in one bed was not the last straw. I decided that perhaps I was a victim of unfortunate circumstances. In the morning things would look better… They didn’t. I figured a shower and a coffee would change my mind. To my chagrin and the very last thing that put this whole experience over the top was one of the two towels we had was full of holes. We packed up and went up to the front to leave. Dawn (the supervisor) was pleasant and understanding and quickly processed my request to leave. I asked to speak to the manager (Christina Lopez) to advise her of the condition of the room and to at least give a little kudos to the staff that all tried, be it failed, to make my stay pleasant. Dawn, Jeffery and the Security Officer (whom I think I’d rather keep nameless) were as pleasant as possible and appeared to be genuinely apologetic, but it seemed to me that they felt their hands were tied by the circumstances. Christina also apologetic tried to make excuses for the whole event. New cleaning manager, new towel service, can we put you in one of the owner rooms with new TV’s etc. etc. etc. It wasn’t the furniture or the appliances, it was the cleanliness that led to my decision to leave!!! My biggest regret is that I didn’t take pictures. With the dirt of the place we didn’t bring anything in but a suitcase and the cameras were buried in the trunk. In conclusion, DIRTY!!! DIRTY!!! DIRTY!!! DIRTY!!! DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! CONSIDER OTHER PLACES!!!! To add insult to injury as of Feb 02 2010 they still had not processed the credit for the room. There was a beautiful charge of about $950 but surely no credit. This has been turned over to MasterCard at this point. Phone calls to Christina Lopez with several voicemails were never returned. Just prior to posting this I finally reached Christina…You guessed it more excuses. I was off sick… etc. etc. etc. It appears that this has finally been rectified but I will need to confirm with M/C.

Reviews.Title: “Bad< Bad< Bad!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emeraudeCapeCod
Reviews.Content: AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL!!!!! dON'T GO THERE dIRTY It's gone downhill badly I complained so much they gave me my week back thank god!! Ha Ha LOL

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: soccermom0821
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in April 08 with 3 other friends. The condo was very clean & well kept. There are 2 pools , but one was closed due to a chemical issue. The other one was great. I don't like cold water, so I was happy to find it quite warm. The pool area was clean, as were the grounds. We were able to purchase attraction tickets at a small office on grounds. Very convenient. I was very surprised to read some of the bad reviews. Maybe there's new owners.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you don't speak spanish”
Reviews.Author: sadie077
Reviews.Content: Dirty furniture, Dirty carpet, Dirty floors, staff not helpful at all. Just a bad area to stay in we looked them up and the website looked good until we got there. Don't let the photo's fool you. I will never stay there again and I suggest to anyone who would like to stay there DON'T...Pay the extra money to stay somewhere clean and the staff is helpful.. VERY UNHAPPY ABOUT THE STAY...Money out the window....

Reviews.Title: “This Leopard needs to change its customers "SPOTS"”
Reviews.Author: tommoCornwall
Reviews.Content: Never go near this place!!! We booked into this place and were given an apartment no 813 after unpacking we found the door had been broken on the safe and the electric wires to the safe were exposed.We went to the office to see if they had another room and after much sucking in of deep breaths were given one on the second floor being told that was all that was available.Bearing in mind my wife suffers with M/S not very helpful.So we packed our four cases and went to room 806 we unpacked again and went exhausted to bed.On waking in the morning we found we had been bitten to bits by FLEAS.We went again to the front desk and gave them the information and also told them the inventory we did on arrival,which was different to what should have been there. We thought we would do some washing and discovered the washer/dryer did not dry so we had to take the washing to the communal washroom in another building.This was also reported.We went to Walgreens where the pharmacist gave us some cream for the bites and a spray for the room to be sprayed on floorcoverings and bedlinen.When we did this we found massive sticky stain in the bedroom on the floor(carpet) and the bedcover was holed all over with what looked like moth holes.All in all a dire example of bad housekeeping and to the owners of these timeshare places they should be aware they are paying for a maintenance service but not receiving it.I would not even recommend it to an enemy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty furniture, filthy carpet, uninformed staff”
Reviews.Author: slackerlova
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed in the lack of knowledge the staff had. they kept insisted Magic kingdom closed at 6pm on Sunday, even after we saw it on the website that it was till 8 they argued. You can ask one person a question and ask another and get 3 different answers (About anything). Staff was rude. There was a water boil in effect and they didn't notify us until AFTER the water boil was over. Kitty pool is not heated, bartender was rather short and not friendly. Food at Tiki bar was awful. On the up side it was nice to buy groceries and make breakfast b4 heading to the parks. The location ws pretty good for restuarant choices. That's the only good things I have to say other than the price was cheap but you get what you pay for people! I wouldn't let my kids walk on the carpet unless their shoes were on. They were disgusting with stains everywhere (and large stains). Ask for an upstairs unit or you will hear every noise the unpstairs tenants make. You also have to request towels and they only give you 2.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidation and Crud”
Reviews.Author: monalisasnarl
Reviews.Content: Imagine staying at a friend’s apartment; say a friend who doesn’t clean very well. That is what I had to imagine in order to feel comfortable staying there. Aside from stray hairs and visible crud (dirt and food residue) in every crevice, we dealt with outdated appliances and stained towels. The cooking utensils were in disrepair among other things. The clothes washer (which was in the kitchen) leaked water all over the floor and the stove smelled like burning plastic. Fortunately I did not see any insects. The “fitness center” was a complete and utter joke. It was the size of garage with four things in it (the pictures are misleading). All in all, it’s very budget and probably okay for families who need the room and have low expectations. I wouldn’t call it a “resort” in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: dairyscott
Reviews.Content: We did a time share swap to stay here on a week long vacation. The pictures on the internet are misleading. Our unit was obviously heavily used and probably hadn't been updated since the building of the resort. We got a unit with dishwasher and laundry, as we were going to be there a while. The units were there, but didn't work. Laundry leaked all over the floor, dishwasher soap dispenser was broken. They don't provide soap, by the way. Fuzzy TV isn't too annoying as we were gone most of the day as it was. Fitness facility? If you count two old pieces of cardio equipment and a bench with a bar as a fitness facility. In general, they really need to do some restorations and soon. Wi Fi was impossible to get, we had to go to coffee shops. The breakfast buffet really sucked, awful.. Wish we had upgraded before making the reservation. A positive thing is that they keep the grounds nice...

Reviews.Title: “Check out is 10 AM !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bedgar2705
Reviews.Content: We arrivced hoping to let the kids play in the game room. Just passing thrugh but plane didnt leave un til afternoon. I thought I could get a late check out (say 2pm) and relax until we needed to go to the airport. That wasnt the case!! We had to be packed up and out of there by 1oam with no exceptions! Didn't encounter housekeeping but we didnt stay but one night. Got my $95 room rate through Hotwire, which I usually love where they put us but it was not worth it. Room ok but not what we were looking for!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MelC87
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned from reading previous reviews.. i was expecting a bug infested motel style kinda of place. As soon as I arrive, the staff greeted and quickly check us in. They were great. They offered us a room by the pool, which we were ify about because it was on the second floor, but luckily the check in lady talked us into it.. cause we got a WI-FI signal - it's called "thepool" .. signal drops here and there, but for the most part works perfectly fine, otherwise you have to go to their internet cafe, which i hear is pretty good.. free drinks and good service. The room it's self is pretty outdated, but for what you pay what can you say.? it has a cottage type of feel, it's not the cleanest but it's decent. The only prob I had here was when we called the front desk for liquid dish soap, a frying pan, and some more towels. Their first attempt, they brought a cot, which we ended up using anyways. We called again to remind then of what we needed, and they got everything to us in a good hour. If you have high standards and you are high maintenance then this place isn't fit for you.. if your more down to earth and can adjust to something that is a little lower budget, then it's a great buy! Just keep in mind this isn't a Hilton Hotel. The pool area is great, they have a large pool, a smaller pool a jacuzzi a bar, and water sprinklers for the kids. many lawn chairs for tanning too, and it's not really busy, at least this time of year. you can also order food outside by the pool along with your alcoholic drinks. FYI i havent found any bugs in here... just one misquote.. prob flew in when we open the door. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLady2010
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! If you are looking to have a bad experience, then you will get one here. There is nothing "enchanting" about this place. This "resort" is pretty much what all of the negative reviews say that it is. The service is HORRIBLE and the room leaves a lot to be desired as it has not been updated probably since the early 80's. The room smelled of bug spray when we first got there. There was a lot of dust which indicates that the room had not been thoroughly cleaned in a very long time. My kids found a dead frog and dead insects in their room. Some of the windows did not lock, which created a safety issue especially with having kids in the condo. My husband located a stick from outside to wedge in the window to keep it from being opened from the outside. We had 6 people (2 adults, 4 kids) which the "resort" was very aware of. Requesting towels for 6 people was a chore every single day, as we had to call 2-3 times for anyone to respond. When we did receive the towels it was a grounds worker or security guard who delivered them. We even gave the first worker a substantial tip, and still did not receive towels without arguing with the staff. There are so many complaints. PLEASE EXPECT YOUR ROOM NOT BE CLEANED DURING YOUR STAY!!! The staff attempted to make 2 of the beds one day, and 1 bed another. We had a 2 bedroom condo, which has a total of 3 beds. The sheets on the king size bed did not fit, so we had to figure out a way to keep the sheets on the mattress so that we would not directly touch it during the night. The dirty towels were not removed from the room except for 1 day when we happened to be there when a housekeeper came in, and we requested that she take them. They did leave some extra sheets. I guess they expected us to wash the towels and change the sheets. After the first two nights in these conditions we tried to get out of this "resort". It took so much of our time. Instead of enjoying the parks we were on the phone dealing with the staff. We even contacted AAA who we booked the "resort" through and they were even unsuccessful in getting this resolved. Unfortunately, the "resort" had already taken our money for the week, so getting another hotel to accommodate 6 people (2 adults, 4 kids) was impossible because of the busy Disney season. My husband also argued with the staff in trying to get another room, only to find that the condo they were going to move us to was in worse condition than the one we had. The "resort" staff became frustrated knowing that they could not accommodate our requests nor most of the other guests requests, and even admitted this to us. They also admitted to the hotel being "poorly managed" by the owner. We talked to everyone that we possibly could at this "resort" including management, with no resolve. They offered us free breakfast, but based on the condition of everything else, it turned my stomach to even think that they would even serve food, so we did not take them up on this offer. OVERALL, THIS WAS A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE AND WE WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS RESORT AGAIN!! FOR THE MONEY YOU SPEND AT THIS RESORT, THERE ARE MUCH BETTER OPTIONS OUT THERE. PLEASE TAKE MY ADVICE, IT IS NOT WORTH STAYING HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “SPEND A LITTLE MORE AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!”
Reviews.Author: koolcanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Dec 26 2009 - Jan 3 -2009. basically there were alot of bugs in the room including cockroaches the staff was nice in they said they could spray for the bugs and reemburse us for replacing any food the bugs got into( which was everything in the cupboard.) After that we just put all food in the fridge. If you need towels don't bother asking for them because you will never get them. We just went to the pool and grabbed clean pool towels everyday. Our sink in the kitchen backed up and for 4 days we kept asking if they would fix it nobody ever came so i feel sorry for whoever gets suite 1209. we had our own car so we didn't need the shuttle service which is a good thing because some people were upset that it was completely booked for the whole time of their stay, so they were advised to take a taxi if they wanted to go somewhere at there own expense. I had read all of the reviews before i left and found that the mass majority were good and only a few bad reviews i thought those people at the time with the bad reviews were just picky but after staying there i found they were just being honest. On a positive note the ground and pool area are very nice. But that isn't enough for me to want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: manc66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 20th December through to 3rd Jan 2010 with wife and daughter. The reception staff were very nice as were security and the Utd fan at the poolside bar. After a few days (after disappointing the timeshare reps - coincidence - maybe?) the towels stopped and the cleaning of the room ceased. After a few requests towels tended to appear usually after 8-9 hours and the room was cleaned after every 3-4 days. One night at 2am a knock on the door woke us up and a guy dodgy as hell asked if his friend was there - I'm sure he was carrying! Anyway security arrived quickly thankfully but we never slept all night. Rooms smell musty but this tends to be a trend in motels and the bathroom was relatively clean. We all developed itches, whether that was due to hygiene or just general bugs we don't know. Breakfast was basic - bagels, cereal, coffee/tea, juice and waffles. We ended up buying a loaf from Walmart and had toast in the mornings. The hot tub and pool facilities were excellent as well as poolside internet - it is possible to get wifi from the adjoining motel depending where on your room is located. On the whole the place was fine and we met a lot of nice people there especially Americans on vacation - beatsbumping into the British lads and laddettes on I-Drive. It's a great location on 192 and all shops malls and parks are nearby. Just remember this is not the Burj Dubai nor is it the Bates Motel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been updated!”
Reviews.Author: AmyChicago_illinois
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel through the hotwire website thinking it would be 3 stars but the quality and service was a 2 star. This place is extremely old and needs updating. The location was okay 20 minutes to the parks but that's about it. There were tiny bugs everywhere. When I called to complain at the front desk the lady said, "Honey these bugs are everywhere". I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed in staff/housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: jobeis
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this Resort. Our first 2-bedroom was not even made up/no towels, pillowcases or anything. We asked to switch when we found the bathtubs didn't hold water, dryer didn't work, no lightbulbs. . . Requested a tidy-up 2 days in a row and received nothing. Requested new towels and received them a day later after 3 phone calls. No one could help us, it seemed. Staff did not often answer the front desk lines or housekeeping. We did not expect celeb service but all our requests were ignored or lost. Resort does have wear and tear issues in many rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Maid service terrible”
Reviews.Author: dreitz
Reviews.Content: No Kleenex, no soap after 1st day, no hand towels or washcloths after 1st day, dishes "cleaned" but put away dirty. After we asked each night for towels, they started leaving a bag of towels outside our door after 4 days. Never even made our bed the last 2 days. Large dead cockroach in living rm day 5. What you get at most hotels as complimentary breakfast cost $5:95 here. Larry, the weekday shuttle driver was great; but the weekend driver was unreliable-had to wait 45min twice in 1 day, made the passengers nervous just having her behind the wheel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: bobert24
Reviews.Content: We ended up paying $19/night for this hotel after combining a great sale and a coupon. For that price, it was an absolute steal. At full price (~$100)/night, you can do better. The place was, as expected, a little older. The rooms are apartment-style - a bedroom and attached bath, with a separate living room/kitchen area. This allowed for a lot more privacy than the standard bed, table, and TV hotel room. There were also 2 TVs - one in the bedroom, one in the living room. The kitchen had an oven, stove, microwave, full-size fridge, dishwasher, washer/dryer combo, and a decent selection of dishes and cookware. All were somewhat dated, and were obviously not top of the line when they were new, but they got the job done without any problems. Breakfast was available every morning for $5.95/person. It was good and filling, if a bit repetitive (same food every morning, but enough selection to not have to eat the same meal every day). The area was good enough - several restaurants (Red Lobster, Ponderosa, etc.) were within walking distance, as well as a grocery store and Walgreens. It didn't seem to be a very sketchy part of town. Of course, the main reason we stayed here was the free shuttle to the parks. While we were disappointed that they didn't offer an airport shuttle (round-trip cab fare is ~$100, Mears shuttles will run you ~$40/person round trip), the shuttles to the theme parks were very convenient. They go to the Disney Transportation and Ticket Center 3 times in the morning (as early as 7:00), and pick up from there 3 times as night (as late as 10). They also go to Universal and Sea World twice a day (First trip out at 8:30, last return around 8:00). We had 2 shuttle drivers while we were there, and they were exact opposites. Larry was great - he was pleasant, courteous, and willing to share lots of tips about making the most of the parks, if you asked. He kept the radio off while driving, and was always on time. Angie was terrible. She played the radio loudly while driving, causing parts of the van shake and buzz, often ran late (as much as 30 minutes), and was often insincere in her pleasantries. Although Angie was the only one to hang a tip cup in the van when she drove, Larry was the only one to receive a tip. Thankfully, Larry is the regular driver, and Angie is just the stand-in when he's not there. One final note - in our room, we managed to get an internet signal, if just barely, from the poolside internet connection. It was available 24 hours a day, unlike the internet cafe. You could try asking for a room in the 200 or 400 building if you're in need of wireless in your room - otherwise, you're out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “has its pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: dramaqueen
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to the orlando area. we chose the oak plantation because friends had stayed here earlier this year and said it was an okay place to stay. there are pros and cons, as follows: pros: free shuttle to parks, drivers were very very nice. we had requested a two bedroom villa with king size bed in the master bedroom and two singles in the second bedroom, which we were given and the room was ready upon arrival at about 3 pm. each bedroom has its own bathroom and tv, which was very convenient, with a third tv in the main living area. they are not flat screened, but that is hardly an issue. the rooms are a little tired, but comfortable. the Tiki bar is fun and the pool area was wonderful. we ordered lunch once from the Tiki bar and the portions were quite large. peacocks and other birds wander the grounds freely and we were quite amazed by them. the resort is within walking distance of several restaurants and stores. the cons: the room as i said was comfortable but smelled very musty. the staff was not overly friendly. I did not care for the guest services employee one bit, who immediately tried to book us a "free breakfast" upon our arrival, which was of course in actuality a time share presentation. the time share people were a pain in the butt, waking me up not once but twice with phone calls wanting to schedule us in for a presentation, which they professed to be only one hour but of course, as we heard from other guests, was more like two or more hours. we chose not to rent a car and when I asked guest services to call us a cab she called an unlicensed driver who charged us $20 round trip to go to Walmart which we discovered too late was only a few blocks away. A few days later I asked the lady behind the reception desk to call a Checker cab specifically, she called the same person who had overcharged us before. I was NOT impressed. she said she didn't have the number for checker cabs (the largest cab company in Orlando). I went back to our room and looked up the number in the phone book and called them myself. The shuttle drivers were very pleasant but there is a lack of communication between the Front desk and the drivers. Twice we confirmed our seats on the shuttle with Front desk but were not on the list when it came time to board the shuttle. one of these times was at 9 pm from the Magical Kingdom, luckily there was room available or we would have been stuck paying a taxi to get back to the hotel (probably a $40 cab ride). Internet is available at the cafe between 1 pm and 9 pm, but has a 1/2 hour time limit and is dreadfully slow. my IPOD Touch was useable in the pool area. overall our experience was okay, and knowing what we know now (ie. we would rent a car and tell the time share people quite forcefully to take a hike) we would stay at the Oak Plantation again, but only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: Robinsonfamily01
Reviews.Content: Overall a good place to stay. We had some negatives when we arrived, it took a further 2 hours for our room to be ready when we had arrived 1 hour after our check in ( this was because they were prioritising getting rooms ready for the time share owners, after a trip of 20 hours and your tired it was not ideal), we also arrived back on the halfwaypiont of our holiday to find our electronic key was not working (it had timed out over a week), the air conditioning units were close to our front door and a bit noisey( but inside we either got used to them or the noise was mininal) they also push the time share option a bit, but but it wasn't too bad and if you were either interested or want a free gift for doing it, the gifts are good. The positives, the pool area is great, it also has a hot tub, the staff are friendly (even when very busy), the rooms are clean and spacious if a bit dated, the area apartment is in is quite (with the ecxection of air contioning units), clean and well presented area, with a suprising amount of wildlife about. A car is essential in my opinion, then nothing is more that about 30 mins away ( with exception of the Kennedy space centre about 80 mins away, but my favorite day). A Walmart is close by and you can buy your park tickets either at the reception or at places along the 192, and there are some great themed mini golf courses along the 192.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for us!”
Reviews.Author: Snapperrb
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks here and enjoyed break. Pool area was fantastic kids in pool every day. Usually stay in a villa, but decided to try resort for a change, as I got a good deal on apartment. After reading reviews prior to flying out, I had concerns, but upon arrival was able to change my opinion. Only concerns were the wife getting bitten frequently, as well as me! If your blood's sweet, you are going to be bitten!!! Don't forget repellent! On arrival the staff were great, and any problems or concerns were dealt with quickly. Make sure you take walk around complex especially the lake area. Entertainment staff tried to keep guests amused during day, but most were out at theme parks or other attractions most of time. Kids loved dive-in movie nights, especially the free popcorn! ls comedy nights. Gene behind Tiki Bar great work and excellent Blues Singer!!!! Furniture could do with updating, but is functional.
