Make sure you ask for a kettle! Only downside was one night when other guests above us were very noisy all night. We asked if we could be moved and staff were so helpful to move us. If you like to buy designer clothes at cost, Mall with Burlington Coat Factory, is literally across the road. Cheap food to right of lights on I192. Walmart at next set of lights as well. Target Extra superstore further down road is worth a visit. Shows worth catching (we think) are Capone's and Arabian Nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: pedroessex
Reviews.Content: We holidayed in the Oak plantation in October 2009, we booked it in Feb 2009. Our tour operator advertised it as 4 star (in their own Version of ratings) however the accomodation was anything other than 4 star. Our villa was dated & the kitchen was sparsley equiped. The cleanliness had a lot to be desired, the housekeeping service was very poor (this was paid for) on occasions our villa was not cleaned at all & we had to keep asking the front desk for the service to be completed, our tour operator also contacted the resort to demand a better service, but all to no avail. Another failing for this resort is their persistence in trying to get people to attend time share presentations, this became a very unwanted nuisance during our stay. Overall the Oak Plantation is sub standard, in desperate need of updating, & the staff in need of some customer service training. IT IS NOT 4 STAR, more like basic motel rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, bad location, and decade old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NathanPoff
Reviews.Content: My wife, child, and I stayed in a condo for 7 days. The staff was great and helped us in every way that they could. The concierge people were not pushy at all with us on doing timeshare things. They actually helped us get tickets, taxi's, and car rentals. The rooms were very out dated. The bathrooms had mold on the ceilings, in which wrecked havoc on my son and I's allergies. The showers were horrible and the bathroom would be so wet after a shower. (hence the mold) The pools were kept clean and were not over crowded. The location is horrible. Although you are not far at all from most attractions, the neighborhood around the place was very ran down. We got a really good deal on the rental of the condo from a co-worker. For the price we paid, we were satisfied. If we would have paid anymore for it, we would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I'M TOO HOT!”
Reviews.Author: rhinay
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel over 4th of July holiday. Air conditioning not working had to leave hotel could not sleep and or function in the heat. My kid got sick. Found waterpark hotel five miles away for a third of the price. I will never stay here again it is a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: znetguy
Reviews.Content: At first glance the resort looked okay. The people were very friendly, but the cleanliness of our condo was not acceptable. One of the worst things to find while vacationing is mold and mildew in the bathrooms, yuk! The washing machine agitator didn't work and they were unable to fix it while we were in residence. Why is wireless internet not available inside the rooms??? And, the internet cafe didn't open until 1:00pm in the afternoon. We went to the pool area a couple of times resulting in a fire ant bite on my foot and a really horable margarita from the TiKi bar. This was the only instance where an employee wasn't so nice, even scary. He didn't seem to like people at all and couldn't possibly have any real experience mixing a drink. The car care area was a joke. The free shuttle service was convenient, I just wish we could have caught a shuttle back to the resort after watching the fireworks at Magic Kingdom, but the last departure was at 10:00pm the same time that the fireworks started. This was a place to hang our hat and rest between activities, comfortable mattress, spacious closets, semi furnished kitchen supplies, but would I stay here again...not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: speedline65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days during a recent visit to Orlando Florida. Now before I begin my review I just want to say to those of you that are reading this, if you are happy to come back to a place of quiet, with a comfortable bed with all the amenities you could reasonably expect then you will love this place. If you are a person who gets down on your hands and knees with a magnifying glass looking for a mark or a bit of peeling paint, then you will be writing a scathing criticism and to you I would say stay away and get a hobby in your life. We went to Orlando to go to the theme parks, we didnt stay in our resort looking for problems. Yes the place is a bit dated looking, and yes the paint might be peeling here and there and yes its not immaculate on the inside, but at the end of a long day enjoying myself in the parks and beaches I was able to come home to a quiet oasis which was cleaned sufficiently to normal standards and it was comfortable and quiet. Just what the doctor ordered. We had two floors, 2 toilets, a walk in wardrobe, a huge bathroom, a dining room, a lounge, a kitchen with a cooker, a microwave, a fridge, a dishwasher, and an icemaker. A laundry room with a washing machine and a tumble dryer so we had no dirty clothes to deal with when we got home. 2 televisions and a video player. If there was the odd mark on a worksurface, I certainly wasnt going to let it ruin my holiday, lifes to short and as the old saying goes "People with immaculate houses, have empty minds". The other word of warning I would give is to avoid being roped into the themepark tickeets for $20 if you attend the "presentation", which is apparently a timeshare sales pitch. Just say no, politely.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: AnnalottaK
Reviews.Content: A really nice place away from the hustle, this was an oais for us returning from long days at SeaWorld or Epcot, or that drive to/from Daytona beach. In all, a very nice place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty setting, inexpensive, good family vacation”
Reviews.Author: kftoby
Reviews.Content: We got this place dirt cheap and it was very nice. No, the kitchen cabinets and TV are not top of the line but do you really need that? We don't. We had a 2 bedroom/2 Bathroom unit on the second floor. The living/dining/kitchen and laundry separated the bedrooms. Master bedrm had king bed, walk in closet and full bath. Guest bedrm had 2 queen beds, an open closet and the sink was outside the bathroom. We were steps from the pools. My son used the internet cafe and complained it was too slow but we used our laptop at the pool and connected just fine. We did not get to do any of the planned activities -- karaoke was cancelled due to weather and the splash party didn't appear. We were park hopping the rest of the time. The bartenders at the tiki bar would make better tips if they showed some personality -- we're on vacation after all! Website mentions free breakfast -- that's only 1 time if you do the timeshare seminar which we didn't. They do have a breakfast buffet that was pretty reasonable and convenient when heading out to a park. We did have a little trouble getting more towels from the front desk - there were only 2 bath towels for 5 of us but I stood my ground and waited for them. Also, when housekeeping came midweek, they didn't leave any extra toilet paper so we were rationing it bec we kept forgetting to buy some! It really is only 20 mins or so to all the parks. Not in the best area -- lots of closed restaurants and stores but close enough to other malls. Minutes from Medieval Times.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to come again!”
Reviews.Author: melanyjoy
Reviews.Content: I admit, after reading some of the previous reviews I was a bit anxious about our choice of resorts in the Disney area. However, once we arrived, I was pleasenty suprised throughout the entire week. First, we were indeed able to check in at 9:30 in the morning when we arrived, we flew in from Indiana, it was a very long night and morning with all the traveling, so being able to drop our bags off in our villa and head to the pool for a relaxing afternoon was greatly appreciated by all of us. The following morning we all headed down for a great affordable breakfast buffet, and off to the shuttle. And I must say, our shuttle drivers were awesome! They were prompt when picking our tired selves up at the end of the day from the various parks and prompt in the morning when we headed out with dreams of Disney in our heads. The Tikibar, was just that, an adorable little funky Tikibar, with just the right atmosphere at the end of a long day. We all enjoyed the bartender, especially my teenage son, (they talked computers one slow evening)! We all enjoyed the dive in drive in Thursday night. As for the Villa, we couldn't have been more pleased. It was very spacious, comfortable, and tidy. One of the pools was not in service when we were there, a broken pump or something, but we all still had pleanty of room in the other pool. I liked the internet cafe, I had to use it one night to work on homework, it was also spacious and tidy. We hope that we can come down again n the very near future!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra1313
Reviews.Content: Nice condos with great pools, activities and value. This is right in the heart of Kissimmee, FL and close to everything. The rooms are spacious, clean and equipped with everything you need in a kitchen. They have activities planned everyday and free shuttle to all parks. I have stayed here 3 times and already booked my next vacation there also.

Reviews.Title: “The place that could've been but never was”
Reviews.Author: followers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and at Orbit One Vacation Villas, each for a week. Based on the reviews, I expected Oak Plantation to be the nice of the two. We were sorely disappointed. Our accommodation was in the back of the building and all of the parking was in the back; we had to carry our luggage around the building: a minor but inconvenient point. Once inside, we found one wrong thing after another: a lack of dishes, cookware, utensils, no bake ware; a lack of towels, dish clothes, dish towels, toilet paper; a mildew-covered shower curtain; a refrigerator that froze food inside and outside of the freeze and leaked cups of water into the vegetable drawer; and cracked and loose floor tiles; broken light bulbs, a broken range burner. There was a lack of lighting in the main living room. Also disappointing was the fact that the computer room ("Internet Cafe") was only open from 1-9pm, the hours that most days we were away from the resort. The staff was friendly, but our condo clearly had not been attended to before our arrival or who knows how long. The nicest feature was that the pool was open until 1am, although (again) the hot tub had about a foot of water in it the first day. The resort is about 15-20 minutes away from Disney's World drive; not bad but Orbit One was about 3 minutes away. End the end, we were glad we didn't have this place for two week and were glad to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Not as clean”
Reviews.Author: turcos333
Reviews.Content: My husband,daughter and I booked for Universal Studios, and a representative at Orbitz had suggested this place. When we got there, the unit looked like it was cleaned a long time ago, and left there. The furniture like past reviews, is very outdated. We found a swarm of dead ants in the corner of our bedroom, dead ants in our bed sheets, dead ants and live ants on the bathroom countertop and floor. The following morning I complained at the front desk and they said they would send someone over. When we got back from our first day out, I went back to the unit, and nothing was done. I called the front desk, and they changed the unit for us. They didn't really explain, or feel concerned about it. This unit was clean-ER, but still had the smell of a motel room. We did not have housekeeping service, but as the other reviews said, they did not supply new towels- we had to ask for them. The arcade ate all our money, and when we complained about it, they just stared at us that we were asking for a dollar fifty back. The breakfast was not worth it at all. It was better to cross the street and walk to Ponderosa for breakfast instead. Guest services helped us rent a car which was nice, but tried to corner us into a "presentation", and awkwardly asked me my marital status- I guess to see if we were financially secure for maybe timeshares. When I told him no, he had to ask the reason why. I said that we saved up our money to go on vacation and didn't reserve any time for any presentation and purposely get up early to make use of our vacation time. (Can you believe I had to explain this?) On the positive side, they offer free shuttle to Universal Studios which is a good 20 minutes drive, there's a mall walking distance, and a couple of restaurants, so you don't really need a car. The pool was nice. All in all, I would have paid more for the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Really good, could've stayed in hotel everyday”
Reviews.Author: hazyrainbow
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed when I first walked in, as the apartment was a bit dated. But we had been travelling for a long time etc etc. After a day and getting into the groove (meaning all of catching up on sleep) realised it was actually really really good. Two bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms, were a really good size and loads of storage. TV's in both bedrooms and another in the lounge. Washer, dryer, ironing board and iron in the laundry room. Kitchen had the basics, I did request a baking tray, but it didn't show up but I used a oven crock for warming bread. There were enough place settings for everybody and glasses, mugs (very handy) coffee maker, microwave, freezer and fridge etc. I did take my own kettle which I used very often. We requested 2nd floor and quite room, which turned out to be a good idea, as they usually put us brits that are staying for 2 weeks in the best rooms which overlook the pool. Very nice, but activities around the pool can go on late (pool closes at 1am) and if you have early starts and small kids.... we were glad we could get them calmed and sleeping. It took 20 mins to get to disney which is a bit further out than International drive, but the traffic was not too bad and Walmart, Walgreens chemist and 7-11 were close by. The pools were all really warm, the jacuzzi was as warm as bath water. They have activites next to the pool bar but we never participated as the children just wanted to play in the pool. The two main pools were 3' to 6' deep. They had a comedy trio as entertainment one night it was quite funny and a "dive" movie with free popcorn on Saturday night. The children thought this was one of the highlights of the holiday!! Swimming in the dark and eating popcorn. We didn't engage at all with the concierge, who gives you the "free breakfast" tickets as she was trying to push timeshare BIG TIME!!! The free breakfast was for two adults only and we still had to pay for the children. TV was on in the dining area during breakfast and all crockery was polstyrene. We just bought cereal and ate in the room. You need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Realy nice, spacious and comfortable appartment.”
Reviews.Author: WolfieandBully
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was a little apprehensive about what i had booked us into. No worries, it was super. We took notice of the 'no kettle' report and took our own £5 tesco one. The pool was tremendous with the added bonus of plenty of available seats and beds, loads of towels and a poolside bar/snack shack. Free (if a little slow) internet access at the poolside was a bonus. As we booked with Virgin we had 2 free breakfasts every day, there a was good selection of food available but as it was the same every day it got a bit boring (although the waffle maker was fun). The setting is lovely but the interiors of the appartments could probably use a good makeover. Overall as a family base for a two week Orlando family holiday I would find it hard to fault and if we go to orlando again i would have no worries booking there.

Reviews.Title: “DONT even think about it...Just book it and go!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuLovesAmerica
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the negative reviews on this place! Firstly i've been going to florida for over 13 years and i have stayed in every imaginable accommodation from private villas to hotels on international drive, and none of these even comes close to Oak Plantation Villas. My boyfriend and I checked into Oak Plantation in June 09 for 21 nights not knowing what to expect, as a lot of the views were negative. However, we were so suprised and happy that these reviews weren't true! Check in was fast and the staff were very friendly...nothing was too much trouble. All we had to do was give in our names and let them take an imprint of our credit card, incase of any damaged to our room, and we were on our way! We drove up to our building which was building 3 room 314. It was situated at the back of the building but this was not a problem. There was a well lit foot path that took us to our amazing apartment. The room was very clean, big and decorated in the usual floridan bright colours and style. We had a living room with TV and VCR (you can rent up to date films from the reception), full kitchen with every utensil you could think of...even a blender! A washer and dryer, iron and iorning board, a downstairs bathroom and a dining area that seated 6. Upstairs was even better! We had a huge king size bed - which was really comfy- no complaints of a hard nights sleep here! We had another TV and VCR in our bedroom and a lovely bathroom with shower and tub (also had a free in room safe). The room was one of the best i've ever seen in florida. The same could be said for the resort itself, its very lush and has a lot of greenery and shrubery around its grounds-its a hidden gem a nice little get away from the hustle and bustle of busy orlando. and there is a lot of nature to be seen, we had armadilos living just outside our room, they were so cute! The pool area was a great place to relax after a long day at the parks (disney was 10-15 minute drive and Universal and seaworld etc about 20-25 minute drive) as it was open until 1am. They also play movies besides the pool every thursday and saturday (i think) with free popcorn. How great is that?!? The staff at this resort are out of this world, nothing was too much trouble! The reception staff always had a smile and a 'have a great day' and the bar staff at the tiki bar by the pool were just as friendly. The housekeeping staff always left our room clean and tidy, making our beds everyday, hoovering every other day, replacing our towels and even putting our dish washer on! We never had any problems with this resort. The only negative comment i would have to make is that if you get a call asking you do you want to attend a free breakfast/lunch say no!! Its a scam...time share meeting for over an hour on the plus side we did recieve $200 pre paid visa card for attending. My boyfriend and I are returning back to florida in June 2010 and we are going to try to return back to Oak Plantations and it will be a definate contender for our future visits to florida. DON'T even think about it...just book it and go see for your self!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: CtMills
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our time share based on the pictures provided. It looked beautiful. I would definately not recommend this resort as an exchange for a timeshare. Very disapointed in the quality and service. 1. Reception was very slow. 2. Ordered rollaway that was delivered with no sheets or blankets. It took 3 days to get these. Towels were not easy to come by either. 3. Beds were awful and old, no springs left. Good thing I brought an air matress. 4. Shuttles to Disney pathetic. Only 14 seats and no guarantee you would get a seat. The times were also very bad. The last shuttle for the night left the park at 9pm. 5. Key Cards and gate never worked. We were locked out at 1am after a long day at Disney. 6. Shower was pathetic. 7. Time share demo unit was 100 times nicer than what we had. 8. Thank god this was not a trip where we wanted to spend a ton of time in the unit. 9. Pool was nice but over chlorinated and way to hot not refreshing at all.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamerLondon
Reviews.Content: after returning from the oak plantation only last week arrived back in uk on the 4th august am horrified to read the comments on the resort. We had a two bedroom condo which was lovely cannot fault it . We are a family of five and 4 of them children between the ages of 11 and 15. The condo was really spacious well laid out, full kitchen two bathrooms and the washer/dryer a bonus. We did not book housekeeping as did not require it only took us five minutes between us to tidy up as really when you go to orlando how much time to spend in your accomodation. The grounds were spotless the staff ever so helpful and obliging. The drivers that we had for shuttle to and from the theme park were brilliant, the only problem with the shuttle service is the returns are never late enough to stay to the end. We used local transport and taxis to get home and caught the shuttle one way. The pool was spacious well thought out and with the different depths split into two pools made it easier to keep an eye on the kids.It was clean and tidy the whole time, plenty of pool towels. Never to packed. I would definetly stay here again and recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - lousy reception”
Reviews.Author: chaclau
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay. Resort is nice and clean - nice pool. The reception is very slow and poor coordination with the shuttle and the guest services. Make sure you confirm everything with them, as they tend to screw up their schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK... nice pool but other problems.”
Reviews.Author: ss69-72
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at the Oak Plantation. The pictures online looked great and it was within our budget. We requested a condo with a balcony so the two adults could use it while our two children slept in the evening. We did read some negative reviews posted here and figured they were probably posted by picky people with too-high standards so we booked anyway. Upon arrival, we were told we had the balcony we requested and were staying in Villa #6. To our dismay, the condo was very far away from the pool (we actually had to walk through the parking lot to access it...remember, we had two small children in tow along with towels, etc). As well, our condo was on the back of the building (we had to walk along a dingy walkway to access it) and the amount of nature back there was unreal. I realize it's Florida, but the noise from creatures and shaking of bushes as we walked by was a little much. As well, there were cats everywhere. There was no view (unless you count a rusty fence) and it felt dark and dirty. We never used the balcony once since the wood was rotting and the chairs looked like something picked off the side of the road. It was really gross. The condo itself was ok (no stained carpet, a fully stocked kitchen and a washer/dryer unit that worked), but the physical location of it left a lot to be desired. We walked back to the registration building and asked for something closer to the pool but the lady at front did not want to move us. She said she could try to move us to another condo in a few days, but it wouldn't be as nice as the one we were currently in. After reading some of the reviews here, we figured it was better to stay put since the inside of the condo was in decent shape. We realized the next day that there was a wasp nest at the end of the railing (the cap was off and a nest was inside) and wasps constantly flew at us as we entered and left the condo everyday. We reported this but nothing was ever done. We basically crept along the stairs as our vacation went on. The pool, however, was really great. It was never crowded, it was clean and we enjoyed it (even though the water was very salty/too chlorinated). Half-way through our visit, the maid was supposed to come for a cleaning, but she never showed up. However, the last day of our stay, she knocked on our door at 10:10am and asked when we were leaving! The gate was another huge issue...our key never worked. We constantly had to honk to be let in. It was very frustrating. Overall, it was just ok: the pool was great, the inside of the condo acceptable, but the location of the condo very poor. As well, Oak Plantation is located in a seedier part of Kissimmee...it has a run-down feeling. We wouldn't come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Great Deal. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cheapinvite1
Reviews.Content: This place was great. It was convenient to shopping. After the first day using their free van to Disney, we decided to just park our rent a car there for $12 a day. It was way faster. Pools were nice. We especially liked the play pool for little kids. Room was great, although we had problems with our clothes dryer (which they came and fixed). We liked that the adults had a separate bedroom than the kids (for snuggling). It was like a really nice condo. The timeshare aspect was a non-issue. If I wouldn't have read that they sell timeshares on TripAdvisor, I would have never even known about it. Could not get internet from my room but it worked fine at the pool and breakfast room. Lots of peacocks walking around. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews shouldn't be ignored...”
Reviews.Author: EducateAll
Reviews.Content: First off, let me thank those who were truthful in their horrible descriptions of the resort. I have to concur. I tried to be optimistic but once I arrived, they let me down. Like another person who posted a review, we arrived early, pre-registered and requested a phone call once the room was ready. We're still waiting on that call. We stayed in an one bedroom on the back of one of the buildings that looked dark and wooded if you were returning late in the evening. We had to park around front and walk around to the back of the building.The unit was just a disappointment! It was very tiny (I was hoping to get a more spacious unit). I do have to admit that the bed was comfortable. The couch was so old that I was afraid to sit on it (eventually I did, but not before I sprayed it several times with Lysol). The refrigerator had actual rust spots on the front of it and on the floor around it. The carpet had stains in it that looked so old that it was imperative that we wore socks the entire time we were there. The shower was the real joke. I had to look around to see if I was getting punk'd once I turned it on! It was almost as if someone was just spraying me with a water hose without the sprayer on the end. They had a big wood chip sticking out of the wall (I assume to hold the shower head in place). One night I called for towels (because they only supply you with a set daily but you have to call and request it), I had to call three times before I got them. The bedroom television showed green spots on one entire side of the screen. The area isn't the greatest either, but the only upside to that is that you're about 15 minutes from Disney. And to think that they try to set you up to eat breakfast and hear the time share spill----No Thanks!!! We didn't use any of the amentities (pool, Internet cafe, etc). I got depressed daily when I thought about the return back there in the evening. For those who with no real expectations that are looking for an inexpensive place to crash with your family, this may be for you, but for couples or singles who desire a nice spot this definitely isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stusignals
Reviews.Content: Have visited this resort on numerous occasions both with family and my spouse. have found it amazing every time. Restaurants very close by and Disney within easy distance. Hotel very well maintained and pool and jacuzzi amazing especially after a long day out. Am seriously contemplating buying a property here.

Reviews.Title: “I'm delighted we decided to return there”
Reviews.Author: SuzyUK
Reviews.Content: Having been allotted the Resort eighteen months ago by Hotwire, my daughter & I decided to rebook it as we had liked our four day stay there so much. We returned there for a ten day stay this month and we were not disappointed. The pool area is clean and the grounds are well-maintained. The reception staff were helpful and pleasant. When we had a problem with our room keys suddenly not working, they quickly reissued us with new ones. The resort is also well located for the theme parks - it is an easy drive to them and to the I4 to reach the upper end of Orlando for Universal etc, plus local Walmarts, restaurants are a few minutes' drive away. The one-bedroom apartment was on two floors and was very spacious, with an emorous amount of storage space. The lounge furniture is a little dated however it wasn't threadbare. We had plenty of kitchen utensils to cook whilst there in the large oven, plus we had a blender, toaster, microwave. The TVs in the bedroom and lounge are older style but they worked very well for us when chilling out after our day in a theme park. We adored the peacocks and like another reviewer, I miss the sound of them now I'm home! We were fortunate enough to view the peahen with her babies in tow. Would I return for a third time to Oak Plantation? Most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended by my whole family !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tmossy
Reviews.Content: This resort is like a welcoming community, it is inside secured gates and you have to have your room card to enter electronically (impressed right there). The pool leisure area is absolutely beautiful with the 3 pools, lounge chairs all the towels you require for your swim and very clean, they shock (clean) the pool each morning before opening. The wildlife is amazing and I miss the sound of the Peacocks and the crossing of the turtles. We stayed in room 804 which was clean and the most comfortable bed ever slept in. We did not have housekeeping but the assistants were there each morning with new bathroom accessories and just placed them by our room door. We never had to call down tot he front office for anything. The grounds are beautiful. I noticed some of the other reviews and I am thinking that those families are the ones that should have checked in at the Raddison somewhere if they were not happy with the Oak Plantation Resort, they are looking for everything to be wrapped in Gold. Based on my family stay there I would reccomend it to anyone. My children loved it with the basketball court, the tennis court and especially the very clean pool area. Alos the buffet breakfast is very affordable and plenty to chose from my children 10 and 7 liked making their own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “my family enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: memeboyz
Reviews.Content: wehn we got there we was skeptical about it but the employees there was nice and me and the family enjoyed it.my kids loved it and we purchase our timeshare there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: agiordino
Reviews.Content: First of all, I chose Oak Plantation Resort after getting a great deal through Orbitz. After the discount and a $75 coupon, our stay was only $30 a night taxes included. All in, $120 for 4 nights. I checked the reviews on here and they seemed good enough, especially with the hotel being rated 18-22 out of 220 in Kissimmee. I was reluctant of course, because some people seem to have horror stories. Being that I typically never stay in 5 star places, I don't have aspirations of paradise on earth in the hotels I choose. A hotel for me is just a place to sleep. I don't plan my vacation to be spent at the hotel. We arrived Tuesday (5/22/09) around 7 p.m. and went to the registration building. I was dreading the time share pitch, and low and behold, none was given. Asha was very nice and got us sorted quickly. We stayed in building 3 which is just 3 buildings to the left past the entrance gate and on a bottom floor. The pool was just a 100 ft walk across our building. The room was clean and the kitchenette area was clean. We chose not to get the housekeeping as it was only two of us for 4 nights. Had I not looked at the actual customer photos from here on Trip Advisor, I would have been disappointed when I didn't see a flat panel tv, smooth top range, etc. There was a 25 inch tube tv in the living room/common area with a cheapo VCR on top and a 20 inch tube tv in the bedroom. The range was a typical cheap 4 burner one, the combo washer/dryer looked in working order, and the microwave was clean and in working order. The fridge was clean and worked and there was also a dishwasher. Our kitchenette area stocked with cups, plates, utensils, pots and pans, etc. The decor was a little outdated, but I'm not there to take pictures for a magazine, so that didn't bother me much. The bathroom was clean, but again, you could tell it was old. I'm sure had I gotten on the floor and looked closely I would have seen grime or dust bunnies like others did in the nooks and crannies, but I didn't bother looking. In the bedroom there was a walk in closet with a built in safe. There were extra sheets and blanket as well. That was a really nice aspect, having the walk in closet. The first evening we stopped at the internet cafe just before closing and that was nice enough. They had a soda fountain machine and chips. We went to the pool a few times. There were two separate pools side by side and a water works type area for kids next to that with water cascading out of pipes. Next to those was a whirlpool. The pool area in general was really nice. Plenty of lounge chairs and it wasn't overly crowded. We didn't get anything from the tiki bar. My only complaint about the pool was that they need to clean it more. There was plenty of debris and bugs floating around all 3 times we went. I would suggest they clean it with a skimmer more often than when they currently do. Overall, our stay was enjoyable. At no point did I feel I made a mistake staying at Oak Plantation Resort. We used the resort as a base of operations for a few days, so we were not using the resort as the vacation spot itself. The room size was very nice and was bigger than most hotels I have stayed at before. For $30 a night, you couldn't ask for more. Unless the rooms for timeshare owners are drastically different, I wouldn't buy a timeshare there if I was ever inclined to purchase one. For that price, I would definitely stay at Oak Plantation Resort again. Pros: Room price, lots of facilities (internet cafe, general store, pool), pleasant environment (you would never know you were just a block off of the seedier part of 192), kitchenette, walk-in closet Cons: Rooms were dated, old tvs (I'm not on vacation in Orlando to watch TV though), debris in pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: DisFamily
Reviews.Content: We had a very full week planned with Combination Disney World and SeaWorld. It rained every day. Luckily the kids loved the pool area so on an early day we could easily enjoy the Hot Tub, Wading Pool, and Swimming Pool. The Resort had daily events planned not the we had much time for those but it was nice none the less especially the movie from the pool. The rooms were clean and stocked. The resort staff were really friendly and helpful. Only eight miles from Disney World but plan 30 minutes for travel and another 30 to get into the park. It was a wonderful place to stay especially for the money. Internet Cafe open only until 9 P.M.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: atraveler05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oak Plantation a year ago, but truely enjoyed our stay. We were pleased to have a full kitchen and living room. We enjoyed our time spent at the pool. The rooms were clean. The location was close to all the area theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Clean.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaeGeorgia
Reviews.Content: 1) Staff was nice, but failed to call us back when our room was ready as promised. 2) BIGGEST ISSUE...room was not very clean. They tried to come clean it later the next day, but by then, I had already slept in my clothes and given the place a floor to ceiling cleaning myself (got Clorox wipes from local store!). Counters not wiped, floor not swept, small bugs, hairs in bathroom, etc.... After all this, I couldn't get past it. It was just not a good first impression. Wore socks the entire week. 3) Had timeshare day two, and the salesman was super nice, but I explained some about the room issues, and he understood. 4) No equipment worked in the fitness room. 5) Pool area was nice, the kids really enjoyed this part. Had outdoor movie, popcorn, etc.... 6) Grounds were fairly nice, with spanish moss trees, etc... 7) Late night smokers right outside the door were pretty disruptive. 8) Our room was MUCH smaller than those pictures make it seem. 9) I hate to write all this because the staff seemed really nice, and I think the place may have potential, but I couldn't get past the nasty room at check in.

Reviews.Title: “I can not wait to make my next reservation to this resort, it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: adlawan
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to this resort for my daughter's 16th birthday. At first, after reading some of the negative reviews I was kind hesitant, but once we arrived I don't know why anyone would make a negative comment of this resort. No one at anytime asked me about timeshare, although I was a little interested in getting a timeshare there. My kids enjoyed it. It was our first family trip and we can not wait to make another trip there. The staff was helpful and great service. I WILL BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, you get what you pay for...if you're lucky.”
Reviews.Author: bylandairandsea
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, slightly before 4 pm, I was told that I could pre-register, but check-in was not guaranteed at 4 and my room wasn't ready. They asked for my phone # and said that they would call me when the room was ready. I went back to the car where my husband and 3 y.o. sone were waiting. We had to figure out what to do until the room was ready. There isn't much in the area. Its a pretty run down neighborhood. We decided to go pick up a few things at the store. At 5 we still hadn't heard from the front desk so we decided to go back to see what was going on. The front desk clerk made a call and told us our room was now ready. I wonder when they would have called if I hadn't gone back to check on the status of the room. The room was spacious, but not well cleaned. Like others stated, the surface was clean, but it seemed nothing had ever been cleaned beyond the most outer surface. There is not daily housekeeping, which didn't bother my family. However, a towel exchange would have been nice. Don't plan on using the washer/dryer combo in your room for much. I did 2 loads. 1 load was 3 towels (room towels). It took at least 2 hours to dry the towels. The other was a few t-shirts. Probably took about 90 mins to dry the t-shirts. It's nice to be able to wash clothes in the room, but don't plan on washing more than a few items at a time. Fitness center was very outdated. Looked like it may have been decent in the 80's. The grounds were nice and the pool area was well kept. The peacocks were charming. Internet cafe was convenient. Overall, it wasn't impressive, but it wasn't awful. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: mugsly1985
Reviews.Content: I just visited The Oak Plantation from 4-30-2009 until 5-4-2009. I went to bed one night and woke up with bug bites all over my leg. I thought at first it was mosquito bites because they itched terrible, but seeing I was covered when we went out at night and I never felt any bugs biting me, my focus then became bed bugs. After three days home and the bites were not getting any better I went to my Doctor. I was told it was an infection probably from a poorly chlorinated hot tub. I have spent the last few days on antibiotics and miserable. The rash is finally clearing up and life is getting back to normal. Not exactly how I wanted to spend the last days of my vacation. So Please be aware of using the hot tub. I was not impressed with the cleanliness of the unit it could use some updates and cleaning. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AgeT
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Oak Plantations and very impressed. I think a lot of negative reviews on here are from Americans and to be honest us Europeans are a little less fussy in my opinion. The complex is a set in very nice grounds around a lake with some great wildlife all around (including a wild heron.) Pool area is very nice with great bar and planty of beds/chairs. Free internet cafe is a bonus - with free crisps and drinks for users! Apartments were spacious enough (although no kettle) and equipped well enough to be honest. Daily maid service was very good too. Timed journey to universal approx 20 minutes (traffic was busy) and Disney about 25 minutes althought he actual distance is very small. I would highly recommend this pleasant location - really can get away from the tourist and theme park bustle and relax.

Reviews.Title: “GO SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: CUSH85
Reviews.Content: Good Points: 1. Room was spacious with a decent layout. 2. landscaping was nice at entry to resort and near the registration building. 3. the heated pool near the bar was nice. 4. common areas were well kept, i.e internet cafe, pool area, registration building, fitness area 5.peacocks and other animal sitings around the resort was nice. Bad points: 1. room unclean - at a quick glance it looks OK but it quickly became obvious that the staff there do a quick cleaning between guests and never get to those harder to reach areas. For instance my three year old threw a monkey we got him at animal kingdom up on a high ledge. When i stood on the chair to retrieve it the amount of dust and debris there was disgusting. Under beds and behind furniture was the same. 2. Outdated - Furniture was old and the couch smelled bad, the appliances were all very old and the dishwasher did not work nor did the dryer which took three 60 min dry cycles to dry a very small load. We brought a DVD player for our child to watch cartoons but the TV there was so old it could not be connected to the DVD's audio visual connections. Each unit is not equipped with a BBQ. To BBQ you must line up to use the Charcoal BBQ. Forget about BBQ. It is easier to just go out to a restaurant for a steak. 3. Noisy - basketball courts just outside our unit. quiet hours were not enforced and the basket ball courts were used up until 1:00 am. The building was not very soundproof - background noise does not normally bother me, i have a three year old for gods sake, but the thunking of a basket ball until 1:00 am after a long day at the parks drove me crazy and then very early the next morning on a couple of occasions. You can hear everything in the attached units, people talking, snoring, etc. When my 3 year old awoke in the mornings he played as usual and was not abnormally loud yet the neighbor was so annoyed he banged his fist of the wall for what seemed like 5 minutes. I felt bad for him but what was i supposed to do. 4.Poor service - Internet cafe has only two computers and i had to wait for an hour to get access and the male staff there obviously hated his job and seemed so irritated when asked a question. When i called about the broken dishwasher they said they would repair it that day and to leave the dirty dishes in the sink for the cleaning staff. When i got back that evening the dirty dishes were not cleaned but stacked inside the broken dishwasher and no work was carried out. When i called again i spoke to the same staff and informed her that the dishwasher was not repaired. She said she thought i said i did not want it fixed. She is so full of BS! Anyway she apologized and said engineering would be over the next day. When i returned the same thing again dirty dishes piled up in the broken dishwasher. They never did come by during my visit and just ignored me. 5. I asked for a smoke free room and when i arrived the room stank with smoke and had obviously been smoked in several times. I am a smoker myself so for me to smell the smoke says to me that this room has been heavily and frequently smoked in. I heard other similar complaints from other guests as well. 6. The safe it too small to store your valuables. 7. the childrens pool was broken and the pool next to the main one was very dirty during our entire stay at the resort. 8. Resort is in an older more run down part of town. I know this can happen anywhere anytime but I went to the store just down the street shorty after dark and as i walked back to my vehicle a shady looking character quickly approached my vehicle and was wanting something i just locked my doors and left quickly but it gave me a very uneasy feeling. You don't feel as safe on this resort and in the general area as much as other resorts a little closer to the parks. 9. This resort is close to an airport because airplanes were flying very low and there landing approach was quite noisy. There is a fire station close by too because on a few different nights you could here the loud sirens. 10. There was no frying pan in the unit so i had to fry eggs in a pot and when my wife made salad we had to use the same pot since there was no salad bowel or bowl large enough for it. Bottom line is that this resort is NOT VERY NICE and is definitely not what it appears to be on the website. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. The pictures shown on the website are likely unit 10 the ONLY renovated one and not available unless you are a timeshare holder. There are too many better choices in the area to want to ever return here. NEWFOUNDLAND, CANADA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds/ spacious but dirty room :( we love the pool!!”
Reviews.Author: LORETTA80
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom ,2 bath room. The room was spacious but outdated but figured it would be ok because we would basically be sleeping there and spending our days outside. The first night we were there my sister and husband had the room with two twin beds. We decided to put the beds together to make more room for them to sleep. I about came out of my skin. We started to pull the beds away from the wall and there was about two inches of dust caked with old food, frech fries you name it. When you took a shower you were wading in 2inches of water. It took 2 hrs to dry clothes.Don't ask for towels unless you sign up for room service. Planes fly over the resort all day and a constant sound of sirens due to the firestation across the street. We spent days at the pool the food was awfful and the drinks expensive. Great pool area." We love Charlotte" waitress at the tiki bar. I looked at review and gave the resort the benefit of the doubt. Think twice

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: genias923
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week stay at Oak Plantation Resort and I must say it was quite nice. Upon arriving, the grounds were beautiful with peacocks roaming around. The staff was very friendly,helpful,and courteous. We were in a 1 bedroom and it was beautiful..Full kitchen, living room, king bed, nice bathroom..well worth the price which also I must say was not that expensive on cheap tickets.com... We chose a room without housekeeping added but when we needed more towels,toilet paper and even a plunger, the staff was more than willing to help us out. This place was quite and out of the way of the hussle and bussle...but still close enough to the parks...We thoroughly enjoyed this resort and will definately stay again..

Reviews.Title: “What happened to Oak Plantation????”
Reviews.Author: CentralMItraveler
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I have been an owner with Oak Plantation for over 10 years. I have made several trips and enjoyed every trip. Having said that, I can not deny the fact that the place needs to be updated. Oak Plantation has gone from one company to another. In 1998, it belonged to Hampton and the place was perfect. 10 years later, the place is run down and is in desperate of management who would take the time and effort to restore the resort to the way it was. Management needs to get into each room correct or update any and all problems that need to be addressed. My last stay our room was fine. The dryer was slow to dry and that indicates clogged dryer vents. Management should be on this problem as it is fire danger. TVs and video players need to be updated. We could not play DVDs for our children because of outdated TVs and video players. Each room should have a fully stocked kitchen. Our room was, but other reviews indicate that is not the fact. We pay a lot in dues for maintainance and I feel that this should be spent in upgrades. The biggest problem I have with this new managment is that fact that we were robbed by a staff member during this last stay. We specificaly requested NO HOUSEKEEPING upon check-in. On our last full day, while our family was at the pool, a staff member entered our room without us knowing. My wife and mother had money missing from their purses when we returned. There was no possible way that the money could have been misplaced since it was their before they went to the pool and was gone when we came back. I went to the front desk to see what could be done. They read the door lock system and told us it would take a few days to get the results. We contacted the police. The police officer was able to determine that a staff member did enter our room while we were at the pool. And because we were signed up for no housekeeping, the crime went from petty theft to a felony. It has only been a few days and I know these things take some time to resolve, but I am waiting on Oak Plantation to do the right thing and cover our losses. Even though we had this bad experience with being robbed, I will go back. I don't think I can recommed this place to a friend and have the same thing happen to them as that just happened to us. I will take futher steps to protect my belongings in during future stays. Having children who love swimming, Oak Plantation is a quiet place where kids have plenty to do. You can not spend everyday at a park and resting poolside is very nice. Timeshares are always trying to get people to take tours or upgrade. I don't know if these are good deals that they offer or not. Research before sitting in on a presentation. It is simple for me, I own and have no need to upgrade or buy another timeshare. I tell them thank you but no thank you and walk away. Besides, when I bought my timeshare we got two disney tickets and two sea world tickets for FREE. Now I think they offer discount tickets. Dicker with them for free tickets, the worst they will say is no. I hope this is helpful in making your decision on staying at Oak Plantation or not. You can get robbed anywhere. The important thing is what will Oak Plantation do about it. The tollways take you towards disney and are not nearly as congested as 192. Traffic is terrible but it is a vacation destination and should be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartment, beautifully landscaped resort”
Reviews.Author: Dutch45
Reviews.Content: A party of a peacock and his five pea hens welcomed us; it turned out that they quietly roosted every night in the tree next to the dining area in our apartment. Our accommodation was spacious for the two of us and freshly decorated in bright sunny Florida colors. Yes, it's in an older part of Kissimmee, but once inside the resort, we forgot the area outside and concentrated on the beautiful little lake and lovely free-form swimming pools. We quickly settled into a routine of using the exercise room, coffee and the newspaper just outside the resort store, then poolside or strolls around the shady resort till lunchtime, checking email and googling at the Internet Cafe (free WIFI also available poolside), drinks at the Tiki Bar poolside and dinner at nearby chain restaurants (Red Lobster, Steak and Shake, Ruby Tuesday's). Very low-key and relaxing, just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “This place is FANTASTIC !!! If you read all this you'll see why.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLover09
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews and can't believe what some people had to say about the place. I had to write my own review to tell everyone that this place is fantastic ! As for being bothered by people trying to sell cheap park tickets, you get that just by walking into a WalMart in that area....IT'S DISNEY FOR CRYING OUT LOUD ! I never had that trouble here though....we checked in and sat with a man who gave us detailed maps to everything that was around, including short cuts to get to the parks and tips on avoiding toll booths, he gave us all the information you could ever want about the parks and was quite content when we told him we didn't want to get the tickets there. This isn't something that is just at this resort, it's offered everywhere, and it's their job ! Everything was SO close and everyone was SO helpful. We had to take my son to the ER in the middle of the night and the lady on the desk came out to show us where to go....I mean...how much better can you get ??? The next day when we dropped into the lobby to grab a FREE Starbucks coffee before heading to Seaworld she came over and asked how everything went ! Our room was cleaned and beds changed every day while we were at the parks. It's absolutely beautiful walking around the grounds (and made many friends with the turtles and lizzards). The messages left on the phone were a little annoying at first, but once you meet the girl who leaves them and see how she is with the kids you quickly find the messages amusing...and there's only one a day so if you don't like it...get over it ! :) We will definately be back here EVERY time we go to Kissimmee and can't wait to see the peacock that stood on our lawn with it's feathers spread every morning thanks to the squirrels :) Go here....YOU'LL LOVE IT !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort And Will Return Often”
Reviews.Author: jojoKREAGER
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed 2 years ago did the time share presentation and we bought a time share here. We had no intentions of buying but after considering our future needs in wanting to come to Florida often we purchased and have had no regrets in doing this. Oak Plantation was great. The people were very friendly and the management staff were very accomodating. Both stays our rooms were spotless and the facility, pool and grounds were very well maintained. I have read many negative comments for this place on here and keep in mind that sometimes peoples expectations exceed their needs and exceed being reasonable. This is not an all inclusive, and you are not tipping the staff, I have found all staff helpful..i have asked for towels, anything we ask for we got serviced. The management have accomodated us when family has come down and our family members have been given a reduced rate.. The reduced rate for family members was $ 55.00 - $ 65.00- $75.00 depending on your room for stay. Since we had the time share this reduction in cost to our extended family proved fruitful and our extended family have greatly benefitted from this. Just keep in mind that some peoples expectations exceed the normal or they arent being reasonable.. My kids loved it..Furthermore the location of the resort is great access to Popular sites such as Disney and Universal..the main drag down Kissimmee their is a bevy of shopping and restaurants to choose from outside your front door to Oak Plantation. We will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "resort" we have stayed at in the area”
Reviews.Author: MGtravelALOT
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed with Oak Plantation Resort. We have stayed at several timeshare resorts in the Orlando area in the past few years and this is by far the most disappointing. I'll summarize in case you don't want to read the details: I expect a "resort" to be nicer than my home! Frankly, my apartment right out of high school 30+ years ago was not only nicer than our accomodations at Oak Plantation, but was more in line with today's decorating standards. A trend of most establishments is to prominently display their disclaimer that they are not responsible for theft of their guests' valuables. Oak Plantation is no exception. When I make it clear that I want no housekeeping of any kind and in fact, confirm that I want nobody to enter my unit, I expect them to stay out of my room! Now for the details: We are accustomed to the hard sell at check in to get you to the timeshare meeting. My husband said he had to get snarly but got the job done...not interested in a timeshare right now! If we were in the market, this would not be a consideration. Our upstairs unit is gloomy and depressing; the cheerful paint color didn't help, nor did the plastic flowers! Don't look forward to your garden tub or roomy walk-in shower, because you won't find them here. Don't bother bringing your DVD collection for down time, because they won't work with your VCR player! I will say that the family room is spacious. The problem is that the television is across the room and small (maybe 25"). In the world of flat screen and/or big screen, this was a disappointment. The television in the bedroom was just as small and several stations faded in and out. The carpet is dirty and has numerous places where it is bubbled and tripping hazards. On a more positive note, there is a full-size washer and dryer in the unit. But wait...five and half hours to dry a couple of pairs of jeans and tee shirts?! Looking behind the washer and dryer put the cleanliness question to rest. It has been a longgggg time since any cleaning was done there! There are even garments mixed in with the piles of lint. Because the dryer does heat up, there is obviously a clog somewhere. Therefore, on top of the inconvenience of the length of time to dry the clothes, the clog is clearly a fire hazard. Because of the record low temperatures, we were forced to turn on the heat. The furnace is located behind a door right next to the sofa. As luck would have it, the noise and rattling from the furnace was so loud, the only way we could hear the television was to either turn it up full volume or watch the one in the bedroom with the stations that fade in and out. Based on the weather, we left our unit and headed to southern Florida for a few days. Because we weren't provided with a "Do Not Disturb" tag (my usual method of keeping people out of our room), I left explicit instructions at the front desk that we wanted no cleaning, trash removal or towel replinishment. I confirmed that we, in fact, wanted nobody in our unit at all throughout our stay. I purposely failed to mention we were leaving town for a few days. When we returned, I noticed a bath mat folded accordian style on the edge of the tub. Clearly someone had been in our unit. The trash, however, had not been removed. That fact, coupled with some of the dresser drawers being not quite closed led me to wonder if some "snooping" had occurred. I make it a point to completely close all drawers and doors and strategically place certain items so that I can instantly tell if anyone has been in our room. Fortunately, we had taken all valuables with us so snooping is our only concern. I called the front desk and spoke to a woman who was very apologetic and advised they would investigate. She was aware of my earlier request for no housekeeping and went on to say she'd check to see if housekeeping had been in our room. When I mentioned that I couldn't imagine anyone else stopping by to fold a towel accordian style and placing it on the side of the tub, she was inclined to agree. With this particular establishment, not only do they not want to be held responsible for your valuables, they do not honor your request to stay out of your room. Add to that the fact that the safe provided is a mere 12"x8"x6"! That doesn't come close to holding our two iPods, two cell phones, digital camera, wallets, cash, credit cards, prescription medications, documents containing personal information, and laptop. The final straw was when I went into the bathroom this morning and a slithery bug scurried from beneath a towel laying on the countertop beside the sink! It has been too cold to enjoy the pool, but I seriously doubt that a positive experience there is going to make up for the negatives of this establishment or our stay here, nor would satisfactory rectification of our concerns change our minds about a return visit. Bottom line, I can hardly wait for Sunday morning to come to check out!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Disney, Didn't Like the Plantation”
Reviews.Author: elliebc
Reviews.Content: The Oak Plantation Resort looked good in the travel brochures and on the web and the price was right, however it is a sub standard property, the beds were lumpy, the carpets stained and we could hardly sleep one night because there were partyers above us, we repeatedly called the front desk and I believe security went over there once but nothing stopped them from keeping us up all night. Finally the front desk just stopped answering our calls. The breakfast buffet you have to pay $5.00 US for is free at all other hotels, and it is horrible. We were treated very rudely by the guy who wanted to book us into a timeshare presentation and when we refused (beware the parking notices left on your door, it's a scam to get you to the timeshare desk in the lobby) he was extremely rude. We won't be back, because while we were there we bought a Disney timeshare, much nicer. If you can afford it, go Disney all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: settlervic
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Oak Plantation was nothing short of wonderful. After reading all the reviews, we were hesitant but decided that it was too good a deal to pass. The checkin process was painless and they stored our bags as our room wasn't ready - which is what we expected as we checked in quite early. We were asked to speak to a lady to get our parking pass. Preparing myself for the big timeshare sell, we found that when we politely declined their offers she quickly gave us our parking pass and let us on our way. The one bedroom apartment was very clean and comfortable. It had it's own washer/dryer and full kitchen which were the main reasons we chose this place. The kitchen was fully equipped so not sure what happened to the previous reviewer. We found the dryer to be too small for the job but they have a full laundry room which is completely complimentary - which was excellent! We washed our clothes in the room and then took them to the laundry room to dry. Every day they had activities for kids and adults - but we didn't have time to enjoy them. They also offer free wireless access in the pool area and games room. We stayed close enough to one of these coverage areas and I was able to login from my room. The surrounds were very lovely and well kept. We felt very secure as there were security guards patrolling around in golf carts every so often. The staff were very helpful and friendly so overall we really enjoyed our stay here. All in all it was a very wonderful surprising experience and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: annemarieo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were really looking forward to our stay here. We are looking to eventually relocate to the Florida area and wanted to stay somewhere where we could visit the Disney area but also travel around and view different regions in Florida. We wanted to have a "villa" so that we could cook and have a bit more room than just a traditional hotel. I would NOT suggest this place to anyone. To be completely fair, it wasn't a horrible place to stay but it was generally run down and most of the staff didn't speak English and were not at all worried about trying to fix any problems for their customers. The villa was fairly small and smelled musty. It also had large areas of dust in it. My boyfriend cooked a really nice dinner one night and about forty minutes before eating we realized we had NO utensils. I called housekeeping and when I finished explaining what we needed (didn't understand the word "utensils"), they never showed up. A half hour later we called the front desk and still no silverware. We called one more time to the front desk and still no silverware. Finally, we ate with a spatula and slotted spoon for serving vegetables. After dinner we went to the manager apologized and did give us two free breakfast vouchers. The next morning we ate breakfast at the facility. Unfortunately, they had a beautiful breakfast in the sales building. Apparently breakfast is free if you listen to their two-hour sales pitch as this resort is a time share. But, with the poor facilities and service we received I can't imagine why anyone would buy anything here!! Anyway - breakfast at the other building is usually $5.99 but thank God we got it free because we would never pay for it! The coffee was the WORST I've ever tasted in my entire life and I've had some bad coffee in my day. It was that cheap liquid coffee that some institutions buy. The breakfast was processed eggs and sausage. They did have some cereal and yogurt and a few bagels but for that price, I expected something nicer. We went to their "Internet cafe" to print out some online tickets for Universal studios and the person running it (some guy who could care less about the customers. He was too busy talking on the phone with his friend about going out that night) was a jerk. He told us that we could use the Internet but that we were not allowed to print anything out. That was reserved only for managers. We explained that we needed to print out some online tickets. We wondered why in the world the printers were there (and filled with paper) if the customers were not allowed to use them? We finally went to the front desk and they said that even the workers at the front desk weren't allowed to use the printers. ??? We then had to drive to the local mall and find an internet place to print them out. My boyfriend asked someone at the hotel about it the next day and the girl at the front desk said "I don't know anything. I just work here." And that was pretty much the sentiment of everyone who worked here. When there were problems, no one cared to help you or to make them right (maybe take money off our stay). We received no fresh towels, dishwashing detergent or clothing detergent until the third night after which we'd already bought our own by then. They kept telling us they were too busy to bring fresh towels or to get our utensils to us but we would keep seeing staff driving around on their little golf carts and talking to eachother so this was incredibly upsetting to us. Anyway - I do not like to say anything negative about where I've stayed but my boyfriend and I don't have a lot of money and were really looking forward to this vacation and it upset me that we wasted our money on a place that was not only dirty and poorly managed, but that also did not care about their customers. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Much To Like”
Reviews.Author: MichiganPicks
Reviews.Content: The people in the front desk area to those working at the Tiki Bar are all friendly. We were asked politely if we wanted to take a tour of the grounds in favor of getting a good deal on tickets to a park or $75, I declined and that was it. One minute total. The pool facilities are excellent. The heated pool is actually heated; not always the case as we've too often found out. The grounds are really pretty and ammentities which include an internet cafe and small arcade are fun. It's best for families who probably have kids who are a little older and want to swim and sun. We had one issue and it started to become a bigger problem the longer we stayed. Our toilet had flushing issues. Yet everytime we called someone promptly showed up. It is a little down too far on the east portion of Kissimmee and though the grounds are gated and kept safe, the area itself is not one in which one should stroll around outside the Plantation complex itself. We paid $700 w/rental car during christmas vacation time. At that price, we feel like we got a very good deal and enjoyed a nice vacation thanks in part to Oak Plantation and the staff. Having stayed at other condos in a similar "level", I wouldn't pay more than that range or if so, look carefully for places farther west on 192.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Check In But Great Stay Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: TotalRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Check in was a major disaster and I thought it would be downhill from there, but everything was great after the check in fiasco. I couldn't remember what their website said about check in time, but since most places are 2 or 3 pm, I showed up at 3 pm. Mistake. About a dozen people were already milling about in the lobby, all waiting for their rooms, too. And it got worse. The first woman I talked to said check in was at 4, but maybe they could get me in, it would take about 20 minutes. So after 30 minutes I went to the desk and she had left for the day. Another woman promised to help, just give her 10-15 minutes, and that turned into 25 minutes. Third woman said to give her 5 minutes which was actually another 15. Finally got a room key after 4 pm. Went out to move my car and another person I had seen earlier said "were you waiting all that time? we went to eat. Wow!" This is some kind of either timeshare place or owners put their places into a rental program. Not sure which, but they are basically condo units. We had a downstairs 1 BR for $75 a night before taxes. There were no other fees, but I had a big blow up when the front desk wanted a $50 deposit for the room, this was after prepaying for the first night, with a 3 day cancellation policy. When I inquired what the deposit was for, the clerk said "in case you buy anything while you're here, like the bar or restaurant." I said I wouldn't have time for any of that, but she insisted the deposit was mandatory. Then a big group was trying to check in and they heard about the deposit, they had 22 rooms, so they were going ballistic. It was quite a scene. But as I say, after check in, all was ok. And they did void out the deposit and give me a reciept when I left. The unit itself was clean, fresh, modern, and in very good condition. There was an open kitchen/dining/living area with sleeper sofa. Lots of space there. Nice TV with cable and DVD player. Separate laundry area. Spacious master bath. Walk in closet in master BR. Another TV in master. Queen bed in master. Large closet in hallway. Kitchen was fully equiped with full size fridge & ice maker, dishwasher & soap, full size stove, microwave, coffee pot, toaster, plenty of dishes. Called for extra towels the first evening and housekeeping was there is a flash with more than we had asked for. We didn't have time to look around and see the pool or anything else. as this was a business trip and we were gone all day. If you want Internet, you have to go to their Internet cafe (open 2-10PM), as there is no connectivity in the condos themselves. Phone charges are outrageous, but are posted. Use your cell instead. The community is gated and your room card acts to access the gate, although I did see cars following other cars in a couple of times. Even so, I felt completely safe here and saw staff out and about on golf carts all the time. Great location. Close to all kinds of shopping and dining. I would definitely come here again. There were 3 of us and one commented that the unit was actually larger than her own apartment. Check out was a breeze. Front desk is open 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience... but too quite”
Reviews.Author: Harrinsue1980
Reviews.Content: We checked in at about 10:30 am.. our room was not ready but got the room at 1:30 pm.. who ever said you can"t get your room until 4:00 pm you are wrong... anyway we walked into a upstairs 1 bedroom in building 1... Very clean and nice... no problems at all -even with the dryers worked fine...We enjoy the pool and hot tub.. which we used every day.. the only down side was the blowing of the leaves... every morning at 8:00 am... but other than that the plane were not as bad as some of the other reviews had stated...They didn't hassle us about a tour either... the tiki bar was too too quite for us though they didn't talk to you .. and no one was ever there...We went to bingo one night and myself and my husband won... 2 tickets to gator land and 50.00 gift card to Pacino's... very good by the way.. I recommend the veal parmigiana.. check out was very fast.. Natale - Thank you....(guest service)

Reviews.Title: “We like Oak Plantation”
Reviews.Author: stonmart
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed her for a week for the Halloween week at Universal Studios. We arrived really late at night and had no problem checking in. we were in Building 3 in a 1 bedroom room. we had no problems with our room at all. of course like some other reviews stated when we used the dryer it didnt work very well but i just hung our clothes up to dry no biggie your on vacation people!!! the condo was approx. 16 miles from Universal. For the money we paid Oak was was worth the money. oh yeah we didnt get tramped by any timeshare people at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time as expected...”
Reviews.Author: andyb10s
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the resort, second as owners. One of my sons and I went to the pool every night. Their pools are awesome, best way to relax after a day at the parks. Oak Plantation is conveniently located to anything in the area. Can't wait to go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it at al cost”
Reviews.Author: bkoskey
Reviews.Content: Looks great in the catalog. Then you find out they do a wonderful job of creative writing. Not to mention what they don’t put in the descriptions. The resort resembles an apartment complex from the 1980’s. The mileage on the interiors and exteriors is very high. Someone has tried to keep up with the repairs but the quality is poor. Many things were mostly jerry rigged to keep the unit in operation. No Non Smoking rooms available (ever). We had to, and others we spoke too staying there, did as many outside activities as possible. We went through a large can of Lysol and have to wash everything when we came home. The rooms felt dirty because of the chain smoke residue you got from touching anything. We spent the first hour wiping down everything to find that our cleaning towel was black from dirt and smoke. They sent in housekeeping and maintenance to deodorize the room but you can’t remove what is imbedded in the walls, ceilings and fabrics. We had our infant son with us who could never be let to crawl on the floor and socks were worn by all when in the room The light switch in the bathroom was repaired by a handyman with the wrong part. It had to be jiggled to keep on and will be the source of an injury or fire one day. The same quality repair work is everywhere around the pool and in the common areas. Watch out for the open wires on the drinking water fountain by the pool too. The TV in the bedroom got every other channel unless you held the cable in the back. Don’t touch the dresser or you loose the picture. The wheel falls of the dishwasher rack every time you pull it out ant the freezer will eventually freeze in two days of you set it on high. The washer and dryer are nice to have. It takes a while for anything to dry and you still go home with the ashtray smell in anything you clean. Leaf blowing begins at 8 am daily followed by mowing. Once the yard work has you up, don’t plan on a nap as they don’t mention that the complex is split by the flight path of the executive airport. Mostly prop planes but a good 5 to 10 jets landing every hour until dusk. Once the runway slows down they run several gas powered golf cards every 30 min or so all night long. After saying something about the noise, they stopped running from midnight to about 6:30 Interactive children pool = old fountains with broken parts. Most were broke or welded to stay on permanently. I did get one control to work but it then filled the kiddy pool with a brown rusty sludge. Watch the sharp edges on either gate as you go to the pool. A DIY repair job has been done multiple times on them leaving it dirty and sharp to the touch. Climate controlled lagoon pools= two side by side pools in the shade of the trees. The kid did not mind the cool temperature of the pool but the adults avoided the one in the shade. The list goes on from mold on flooring to cabinets chewed on by house pet or designating from the many years of use. Holes in siding, rusted gutters, warped doors and mismatched repairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NCHusker
Reviews.Content: This place was "better than the brochure"! I was fortunate to get an amazingly good rate for a one bedroom condo with a full kitchen for my visit to Disney and Kennedy. I was nervous about what the place may "actually be like", but it's great! The condo was very nice and comfortable, clean and not noisy. We stayed in a ground-floor unit in Bldg.5, facing the ponds. The kitchen, though simply equiped, had everything I needed for meals. There is a WalMart about 2 blocks away, many other stores close by. The grounds are beautiful, the pools very nice and the hot-tub huge! It was 10 miles to the Epcot parking lot, about a 15-20 minute drive - not bad (I recommend taking the more northerly route [192 to 536], not 192 the whole way ). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing I had "trouble" with was drying laundry in the in-room machine (I thought it was cool they even had these!), but mine was probably faulty. My little boy loved Oak Plantation and asked if we could stay there again on our next trip, and we just might!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: mgworks
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got home from 2 nights at Oak Plantation. Bottom line: Our unrenovated room was a little outdated but really well maintained. I was impressed first by the price (40-something per night). Then the 1 bedroom was much larger than a hotel room with a full kitchen, laundry room, walk-in closet, dining area. I wasn't thrilled to open the front door and find stairs right away b/c I have small children, but it worked out fine. I thought the area driving up to it was a little shady looking, but its really in the middle of all the tourist area off of 192, with lots of big stores nearby. I found the staff very helpful and was never approached by anyone trying to sell me anything. I didn't get a chance to use the pool, which looked nice. There was also a playground, tennis, and basketball courts. There were lots of activities scheduled, but again, we were at Disney all day and didn't take advantage of those.
