There was plenty of room for my family and we will definitely stay again, as long as the price stays low.

Reviews.Title: “high pressure trap, if u want discounts, b ready to put up with crap!”
Reviews.Author: sundayseven
Reviews.Content: BEWARE OF EXTREMELY RUDE SALES PEOPLE AND HIGH PRESSURE SALES TRAP. Discount Tickets for disney were offered under false pretenses. They said as guests of the resort we were entitled to special discounts. We found out after having paid for the tickets in full, that they only offered them to those who stayed for the 2 hour "tour of the facilities". This turned out to be a timeshare trap!!. Sales people were beyond rude when they finally got the message we didnt want to buy. Mr. "tan/man-ring" (the manager by the way) actually got up and left without saying as much as good bye to us. Manners were out the window. To save time, i tried to get the tickets before the meeting was finished, and they wouldn't give them to me. I had paid the day prior, and they would not give them to me. Only after the meeting was finished was i able to go acquire our tickets. I was livid! The people at the pool at 23:00 at night were animals...screaming and yelling, just totally obnoxious. Good thing our villa was far from the pool (block 7). "The pool is open until 1:00 am, because people here are owners and respect one another and are quiet." said the rude sales girl. I never went in the pool. It was insane. I'm left with an overall bitter feeling of this place, at least the room was really nice and quiet. A step above the hotels we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, fantastic! Way better than a hotel room @ same price!!”
Reviews.Author: brn2brgn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were VERY surprised to find that we had a suite to stay in, rather than just a room! FABULOUS! Nice and clean, friendly helpful staff, great amenities and even planned activities. Great location to get to from the airport, and to get to all the attractions. Secure area, ample parking. We hope to stay here EVERY time we travel to FL!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and it was fabulous again!”
Reviews.Author: willy_wonk123
Reviews.Content: Alright so our first stay was in a 1 bedroom unit in May of 2006. This time we brought our friends with us and booked a 2 bedroom unit and a 1 bedroom unit. The front desk staff was very accommodating, we asked for rooms close to the pool, a crib and close to each other and we were accommodated nicely! Our room faced the parking lot so the only noise was the golf carts whizzing by! The rooms - Yes this is a time share property so what people need to realise is that each room will be a bit different - ours was typical Florida style and yes it could use some updating, however it was clean and inexpensive. You do get what you pay for. After reading some reviews I just don't understand as some of these people were here the same week as us and had a totally different expectation. Grounds - Good job on the groundskeeping and general maintenance. Pools were clean - only we problem we had was the fire ants in the middle of the pool deck. Not pleasant Amenities - What property can you go to for this price and have access to sooo many options. Basketball, two pools, a kiddie pool, a large hot tub, daily acitivities, onsite breakfast, movies, massages etc. I think many people are expecting more out of this 3 star resort . Our friends had a bit of problems with the shuttle service but that is nothing to do with the hotel and was addressed with the shuttle company directly. Ages of our travellers were 1.5, 8 , 29, 29, 30, 55, 55 and two of us are travel agents who have over 22 years of travel experience! We have already booked for next year!

Reviews.Title: “People make the difference”
Reviews.Author: retiredroamers1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this resort because I love this resort. The ground level, one bedroom unit we occupied was great for my disabled companions. Close to the parking, the pools, hot tub and tiki bar. The acitivities including Dive In Movies, a free bus trip to Cape Canaveral for a Stirling Casino Boat trip, and the Karoake at the Tiki Bar were really fun and entertaining. The staff aim to please and went above the call of duty. The staff even helped us out when our car was stuck in the shop with transmission problems beyond our booking period. We met many other guests at the TIki bar, facilitated by their friendly bartenders. Near all major attractions, shopping and restaurants. Free coffee and cookies at the reception area, free pop and chips in the internet building, wireless access at poolside. Small town feel with all the big city amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay again”
Reviews.Author: car0lineee
Reviews.Content: I was afraid when I first made my reservation through Orbitz since of the reviews of this place, but it was a cheap rate. We only needed one night because our flight was a day after the cruise ended. We checked-in really early that day and was told they would call us when the room would be ready. They called us a half hour before the regular check-in time! We arrived at our unit, and when I walked in the door, I was fascinated at how much we were getting for such a cheap rate. There was a kitchen, dining table, living room, dishwasher, refrigerator, washer/dryer, vacuum! Then I went to look out our window, and noticed a fly in the blinds. And then another, and another! These were INSIDE!! Then I noticed there were some dead ones laying on the floor. I walked around the place and found a few more in the bedroom, some dead, some alive. And another in the bathroom. Disgusted, I called the front desk to tell them our situation and hoped they would give us a new room. She questioned me asking what kind of flies they were as if I was some sort of fly expert. I told her they were fairly big ones. and she went on to tell me that there are no flies in Florida. Well I don't think I'm imagining them! She sent over Maintenance, who brought a can of Roach & Ant spray. He nonchalantly sprayed at the flies in the window and told us that they would slowly die. I was so disgusted afterward. We didn't even want to sleep under the sheets because of fear of bed bugs. The flies didn't reappear afterward, but we did notice some flies stuck between the window and the netting of the window on the outside. GROSS! It was good that it was only a one-night stay. The outside of the unit smelled of sewerage which I believe was from the wet soil. The area was decent, there's LOTS of trees, and they have lots of things like a general store, internet cafe, basketball court, tennis court, temperature controlled pool, hot tub, and kid's play area. There's a lake in the middle with a fountain and gazebo. The pool was nice. I guess if you get lucky with your unit it is a nice place to stay especially if you get a good deal! but I most likely would NOT stay here again based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place does not get enough credit!! It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCubbie
Reviews.Content: I will be the first to say I read all of the reviews which I came across only after I booked my 7 day stay at the resort, needless to say I was extremely worried and even tried to change my stay to another resort but could not. My worries were all for NOTHING. Our room was clean, up to date and the service was great, and I am NOT a resort and/or time share owner! I had a newly update room with a dishwasher, washer/dryer, flat screen TV, etc. etc. The place was great and we did not run across any problems! Based on the reviews you would think this place is a dump and honestly it’s not. The pool area was great! They have ton of activities for the kids and if you get a chance do the movie by the pool, it was really nice. I’m the biggest germ freak around and was prepared with my Clorox bleach prior to checking in as I was prepared for the worse! Besides disinfecting as you would normally do while staying in a place others share, the place over exceeded my expectations!! Give it a try! Request a newer room if possible perhaps that is why I did not run across any of the other problems noted in prior reviews!

Reviews.Title: “If you can the time share sales pitch......”
Reviews.Author: terrylynnc
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice! Very clean, with towels, and toiletries. Very nice, well equipped kitchen and washer and dryer. Decent furniture, nothing special. It was pleasant enough to stay there while visiting Disney. Holiday Inn quality furniture. I paid about 63 a night - so it was a real deal. Only dislikes- tacky white plastic pool furniture-yech and NO wireless internet access except in one building from 1 pm- 10 pm. That was a huge nuisance. Staff was polite, friendly and helpful. I would recommend it, just avoid the aggressive time share pitch.

Reviews.Title: “You can't pay me to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: vmbyoung
Reviews.Content: Before I came here I read the reviews on different sights. I must admit they are right. This resorts sucks!!! First, it is in a run down neighborhood and it looks a mess on the outside. Next, the units need to be updated, the carpets need to be cleaned and the outside of the building could use a good power wash. But what upset me the most was my husband and I went to a presentation and they showed us the units that had been renovated and they were gorgeous. The sales lady stated that he resort saves the "Newly "rennovated units for people that have time shares here. You would think that if they wanted you to purchase the time share they would have put us in a half way descent looking room. Needless to say I will never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mel026
Reviews.Content: Returned 26th June 2008 from 10 night stay at Oak Plantation. This was our second visit to Florida in as many years and our previous accomodation had been fanatastic but unavailable when we were booking the second trip. We chose Oak Plantation from the Virgin brochure and the write up looked good. On looking up the reviews on trip advisor we were a bit worried about the choice we had made. On arrival we quickly realised that all our worries were for nothing. The resort, although not perfect is extremely friendly and homely. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment which was spacious and had all required amenities. Location is perfect for shopping and theme parks. The swimming pool is gorgeous and stays open until 1am - just what you need after a long, hot day with Mickey and friends. My only complaint came on our final day. Check out time in the resort is 10am and our flight did not depart until 6pm. We asked at reception to see if there was any way we could keep our room for a couple of hours or even get a room in which to shower after a couple of hours at the pool. Unfortunately there was nothing they could do for us other than to tell us they would store our luggage and that there was a shower in the pool area (a cold, outdoor shower used to rinse off before entering the pool.) We accepted this but thought that they might be a bit lenient with the check out time as they had appeared to have an overall laid back attitude. The morning of departure came and the first phone call was at 9.40am to remind of the us check out time. This was closely followed by the arrival of one of the cleaners who then sat down outside the door waiting for us to leave. At 10.10am we got another phone call to remind us to check out. After the wonderful stay we had had we felt as if their attitude was that they had our money and now we could leave. All in all we had a fabulous time and would go back but my overall experience would have been excellent if it had not been for the way we were pushed out!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, nice room, not pushy!”
Reviews.Author: jlchwen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a stay at the Oak Plantation Resort in Kissimmee, FL. I thought our unit was very nice. One bedroom with king bed, bathroom which was large and clean, kitchen very nice (wish we had time to use it for more than for cereal), living room (same problem-not enough time). There were two televisions: living room area and bedroom. There was also a washer and dryer. Even a walk in closet in the bedroom! I was scared of other reviews but the staff was helpful and friendly, gave a list of directions for theme parks and other area attractions plus Walmart. The concierge lady was nice and said she did have to mention the time share meetings but not pushy at all. They called to tell us our room was ready earlier (we went before four, it wasn't done, we went to CityWalk, Oak Plantation called an hour later). They did put a $50 charge on our credit card that hopefully be refunded (in case of damages incurred during the stay). They seem to have lots of kid friendly activities and the pool area is nice and well maintained. My only problem besides the $50 charge to be refunded is that we had to get another set of key cards (charge card type for room and entry through gate). When we put it in the gate, it rarely worked and someone from the front desk had to press a button to let us through. Then at times we had a problem getting into the villa itself but not so much as I wouldn't stay there again. Maybe we were just tired of the 12 hour theme park days and were in a hurry with our room door. I really liked it. But anything having to do with Florida is A-okay with me!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kmu530
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oak Plantation Resort June 14, 2008 through June 21, 2008 in Unit # 1115. When we checked in (at 3;20pm) we were told that our unit would not be available until 4pm to 6pm. The Resort did call when the unit was ready but, it was AFTER 6pm. Despite the long wait to get in, our unit was not clean. There was hair, crumbs, and dirt on the floors. We did not have linens that fit our beds...the king size bed had a double size flat sheet and the sleeper sofa had a twin. Our stove top did not work. There were 2 settings....off and burn. Our kitchen faucet was slow and very squeaky. Ceiling fans were very squeaky and quite annoying. Shower curtains were somewhat moldy. And there were many stray cats throughout the property. I did not feel comfortable and relaxed and I didn't have a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jacnzak
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the resort posted are very deceiving. Everything around the pool area is really nice. The buildings, units, and landscaping, but once away from the pool area everything is old and rundown. When we made the reservations with RCI we indicated a handicapped person will be checking in with us. When we arrived and were sent to our unit we open the door and there was a steep set of stairs going up to our unit. We called and the staff was understanding and said they would switch us to another room, which took several hours to prepare. When we finally arrived at our new "Handicap Friendly" room we had to park in the front of the building with limited handicap spaces and walk all the way around to the back of the building, not an easy task for my handicapped mother. The room was so old! The furniture was shot, the toilet seat was broken, the towel bar was hanging off the wall, the toaster looked like it had a few fires in it, pretty much everything in the room was shabby. Something else I'd like to mention is that the resort is on US192, a short distance to all the parks, but this particular section of the strip was a bit "shady". It was kind of iffy to go to the local restaurants or stores at night because of the kind of people that hung around. A lot of the stores and restaurants in this part were either closed or rundown, and sprayed with grafitti. I would never recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at this resort”
Reviews.Author: 3dollar
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time during our stay at the resort., stayed at the inn but enjoyed all the ammenities at the resort. We bought a timeshare during our stay and really looking foreward to going back as members. Staff are very friendly and helpful, resort and inn are as clean as you would want your home to be. You must try this as a vacation site at least once. Thank you to the Oak Plantation family.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Pleased”
Reviews.Author: msrhoad
Reviews.Content: The first condo we were given smelled terribly of cigarette smoke (we're HUGE non-smokers) and the carpet was filthy. It wasn't more than a glorified hotel room - that's not at all what we had booked. When we cantacted the front desk, they switched the next day in to a "real" condo. It was beautiful. A one bedroom loft, 2 bathrooms. The property was great! The pools were great, the poolside bar, the kiddie pool, the playgrounds, a place to wash your car, tennis and basketball courts, a little store, discount area tickets, cyber cafe. Lots of family activities in the clubhouse and around the pool. Not right next door to Disney, but no more than 15-20 minutes away (at the longest!). It was a great experience once our room was changed!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: roxmysockz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort with friends, was a swap through RCI (which didnt work out well, from an RCI point of view) The resort externally is very well kept tidy & the wildlife roaming around is very nice. The first room we were in was very modern, granite looking work top new appliances, flat screen TV's etc (Block 3 i think?) however was only a 1 room place so we swapped to a 2 bed in.. Block 5 - was definately not as modern as the first tv's were old, so were kitchen appliances. However still very useable and as we were at the theme parks & only made breakfast there it didnt really matter. One of the plug sockets was hanging from the wall so, we called up and this was quickly fixed. One of the big downsides we found was the noise from the apartment above, although we think they couldnt help it as they were not large people we could hear every foot step they made. It was very noisey and would wake us up of a morning, so ask for a second floor apartment to avoid this! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort.”
Reviews.Author: Fl0rida_Fan
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort through Expedia for £24/night. Stayed in a one bedroom apartment in a refurbished block (10). The room was great - plenty of space. There was a full kitchen, living and dining area all on open plan with a separate bedroom and bathroom. Also a separate utility room with washer and dryer. Everything was in good condition (new LCD TVs in living room and bedroom and DVD player). The grounds were beautifully landscaped and well maintained. Location was good - just off Vine St (Highway 192) and within walking distance of several restaurants. The only negative was that the bar shut at 11pm!

Reviews.Title: “Building 12; Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: traveler08Chicago
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Oak Plantation Resort. The resort/timeshare was okay. We had request two months prior for second floor with balcony, but it was not a guarantee. When we checked in they had first floor away from pool room waiting for us. The front desk gave us attitude for asking to switch to an second floor and her response was they didn't have one bedroom with balcony. Since we were in the ground floor facing some forest it attracted bugs. Also our unit (12) had tiny ants in the kitchen, no matter how clean you kept it. The maintenance offer to spray down the kitchen and along the rooms and outside the door, but we didn't let him. The ants were in the blenders, they weren't properly cleaned. Didn't want to sleep with bug spray aroma in the room. The kitchen and bathroom were really grimmy, all of the fixtures need to be updated. It's about 30mins to Universal studios theme park and 15 mins to Disney Animal kingdom and 5mins to 24hour Wal-mart (theme park tickets are sold here). Tip do the 90mins timeshare tour for half off on Theme park tickets. The timeshare tour will show the "Owners Unit" which are newly renovated, however the whole resorts needs updating. They were persistent on mentioning that all of the rental units will be renovated in the "future", haha. If you plan on purchasing a timeshare there, I would suggest researching them on consumeraffairs.com. The pool (closes 1am) was heated and sauna, which should have a time limit. The tiki bar closes at 11pm, but bring your own drinks to the pool. Since we weren't there during the day couldn't tell you if the pool was busy. The internet hours were weird 1pm-10pm, bring your own laptop with wifi. We paid $299 for 5days. and there are free cookies at the reservations desk, woo hoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great,no complaints”
Reviews.Author: charl412
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay at the Inn at Oak Plantation for $99.00.I have to say by some of the reviews i had read that I was a bit skeptical.When I put the room key in the door I was afraid of what I was going to find,but,was very relieved when I looked in and walked in.I t was a studio which consisted of a couch ,very clean ,like knew,2 end tables ,a kitchen table and 2 chairs,then you walked into the sleeping area,which was a king size bed,with 2 night tables, a set of cabinets with a sink ,a microwave and a coffee maker,a hutch cabinet with a tv,then the outside bathroom sink,vanity,and a small bathroom,very clean ,everything was very clean,for 99$ we even got breakfast every morning which consist of homemade waffles,or bagels,cereal,yogurt ,coffee and juice ,what more do you need for free,and it was very good,the pool in the back was very clean ,and there was never anyone there because people all go to the resort and use the heated pools,where its crowded with people,that was also very nice ,you can walk through this little roadway that leads to the resort and use everything over there for your price of 99$,the staff at the inn was very nice ,I will definately stay there again,why pay resort prices when you can get all the amenities for 99 for 3 nights,Give it at least a try ,you wont be sorry..

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: michael1313
Reviews.Content: I was extremely satisfied with my stay at the Oak Plantation Resort. Overall it is a nice community with an extremely helpful staff. The positives - Affordable - Close to Disney - Close to restaurants - Incredible water pressure in the shower. It is like showering with a fire hose. - Charcoal Grills The Negatives - Slightly dated units (older bathroom, furniture and bed) - Limited Kitchen (no skillet) - Kind of noisy after about 8am (First Floor) but we were up before then anyways. - No dish soap in the kitchen or extra garbage bags though if we would have called up to the front that might have been taken care of. So overall we were happy with our stay there and would definately stay there again if we find ourselves in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: motorcity70
Reviews.Content: I booked this site via Travelworm.com and received a rate of $58/nt for April 14-15, 2008. Some of the reviews under the resort cover the Inn which, while affiliated is a separate property close by. The resort is lovely. It contains a large pool area and beautifully landscaped grounds. I had a one bedroon villa reserved. The room I received had a full kitchen, living room with TV and VCR (no DVD player), a dining area, half bath and full washer/dryer. A 2nd level included a bedroom with king bed, TV and bathroom with a very large soaking tub. The amount of storage available was immense. The room (really it's the size of a condo) was very clean and everything was in working order. The value received for the money was terrific. I highluy recommend this property for people with weeklong stays in the Orlando/Kissimmee area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good with a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: ScMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 14th to April 19th. Got a very good deal from Travelocity. Make sure you are staying at the RESORT, not the INN. If you have a studio, you are staying at the INN. We stayed in a 1br place. It is basically a a converted 1br apartment. PLENTY OF SPACE. Full kitchen was nice. Yes, they do try to get you to do a timeshare presentation, but if you are upfront about not being interested or not having time, they are not pushy. Overall, a nice stay. The facillities are nice with 2 pools. Internet cafe is only available from 1-10. That posed issues at times. Can't beat it for the price. Plenty of activites. Food and stroes very close by. Good location for Disney and Universal. Will need your own transportation. There were small things that disappointed. Our porch light was out, when we called to get it replaced, we were told we would have to call back the next morning. Batteries for TV remote were dead. Parking could potentially be an issue during busy times. Also, you could hear people walking above you if you are on a ground level floor, but it was never a big issue for us. Once again, do your homework! Make sure you are at the RESORT, not the INN. (It looked a little shabbier from the outside.) Pros: Location, Facilities, Price (thru Travelocity) Cons: Attention to small details, Parking

Reviews.Title: “Truly a nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: vquarrels
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip and first time visit to orlando. I booked through a website stayhereplayhere.com and was told I would have to attend a 90 minute presentation. I also was under the impression I would be staying in a resort not a INN! The price was great and I was told I would have a kitchen to cook. Once we arrived, excited about our 7 day stay in orlando, we were quickly saddened to find out we didnt have a kitchen in the studio room the representative had informed me of and the room had an odor. During our stay I had to call guest services almost everyday to ensure that my sheets and room was clean everyday. I was told they only change the sheet every 3 days due to environmental issues. I have never heard of this. After the 2nd night there, returning from a long day in the disney park, we arrived to the room looking just as we left it that morning. They moved us to another room and there my 6 year old daughter found 2 used bags of drugs under the bed. I was so upset, and I provided the property manager with the drugs we found. They in turn offered me to stay a few more nights for free and a VIP breakfast. i declined!! You would think after that experience they would have excused me from the 90 minute presentation. They didnt, and they actually thought I would buy their property and refer friends and family to their establishment. I would never refer anyone to that resort and I warn anyone who is thinking about staying here during their vacation. Certain housekeeping workers were rude and the front desk workers were nasty as well. I will be taking if a step further by reporting them to upper management. This place needs to be shut down!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: PennyLayne
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Oak Plantation. Last year we booked through a timeshare presentation package, this year we rented through an owner at the resort. We hoped booking an owner's room would result in a better room. We had a one bedroom Augusta. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The grounds are laid out very nice and the pool is great. The rooms are fairly clean and comfortable. When we checked in we were offered tickets or cash to sit through another presentation so we did. We got basically the same pitch we got in 2007. They showed us a really nice refurbished unit, the same one we saw the year before. Their pitch was that all the units were being renovated in this manner. During our week long stay we did not see one unit other than the models with the same plasma tv upgrade or pillow top mattresses despite it being a year since our last tour. The dishwasher and stove are very dated but functional. The TV remote was held together with duct tape. The biggest complaint is with the thin floors. We had a main floor unit and had two different families in the unit above us. Both had young children that ran about simulating sounds of a herd of elephants above us. Overall we enjoyed our stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Off Season a plus!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWill
Reviews.Content: Our grandfather made our accommodation through a RCI exchange for our Honeymoon. One thing I noticed prior to selecting this resort for our Honeymoon is the RCI travelers seem to have better experiences here, so keep in mind, your mileage may vary! Upon check-in and whenever we dealt with them the staff was friendly and not overly pushy with the timeshare meetings, although they definitely did extend every possible opportunity to attend them. Facilities themselves were nice and appeared well kept. The pools were kid friendly, and the hot tub was very welcoming to the adults. The bar down by the pool/hot tub area was a nice plus. All of them were not too busy, but that also could be the December time frame there too. If your visiting Orlando for Disney this is conveniently located, we found it easy and quick to get around to all the Disney parks. If your there for Universal or Sea world it may not be as convenient for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the setting!”
Reviews.Author: jb4951
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in Florida on business, so looked for an inexpensive package for my husband, son and his friend to join me for a few days at the end. Found the Oak Plantation Resort in an Expedia package, and chose it for the kitchen facilities (18 year old boys eat alot, and the kitchen was important for us!). I was worried by the negative reviews, but had to write to say the place was great! We got a 2nd floor unit, as suggested, so the noise wasn't bad. I recommend asking for a unit facing the "lake", not the parking lot, for a better ambience. Our unit may have been refurbished...it was clean and had what we needed to cook a few meals. We also took advantage of the outdoor bbqs. The sofabed had an uncomfortable mattress, but most do, so that was expected. The staff was great...all of them, all the time. What I liked best was the setting....even though you are just off the main road, it is like a little oasis. Lots of trees, a small lake, tennis court, bball court...you didn't feel like you were in the middle of all the hustle and bustle, but it was nearby if you wanted it. We were not asked to go to a timeshare pitch, and our rate was still excellent. It had everything we needed, in a tranquil setting with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: devillewomyn
Reviews.Content: We used our time share trade for this property and we were not disappointed! Very close and convenient to all the Parks and other attractions. Amazing staff, we were traveling with another party that also had a time share and the staff went above and beyond to put us as close together as possible. We had paid for an extra night and while we were at the park they had the housekeeping staff move all our stuff to our second room the next day. The 2 bedroom, 2 bath condos have a bath in each bedroom..way nice and pleasant. They are always doing activities all day and at night they do things like a movie on a big screen by the heated pool. They supply coffee and cookies in the lobby and check-in was so easy and quick. We will definately be using this property again. Also very close to a main road with lots of resturants and retail and grocery shopping. When ever we called for anything that we needed for our rooms it was there within a very short time. Staying at this resort made our stay in Florida much more pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BullfrogLover
Reviews.Content: We are a middle age couple and this was my first trip to Florida. The Oak Plantation resort interested us because we like having a kitchen in our room to cut the cost of eating out. We also are on restricted diets and find it easier to purchase our own food items. The idea of a washer and dryer in the room was also a plus because it meant we could pack less. But we were disappointed in the machine in our villa. It was a combination washer/dryer in one machine. It doesn't dry. We ended up taking the clothes to the free laundromat on site. That was okay by us. It was free and just as easy. We didn't know it was a time share resort until after we booked. Not a problem . When we checked in we were asked to take the tour we initially said yes but then a few days later changed our minds. We called and canceled without any grief. The resort wasn't that full and the weather was a little cool for us Northeners to go in the pool but we did enjoy sitting by it and enjoying a drink. The carpeting was a little worn and stained. But we would stay again and recommend it to friends and family. It was close enough to the attractions (we rented a car) but not near the hustle and bustle. Lots of activities all day to occupy people of all ages. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: ingetar
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative comments I was a bit worried when I arrived.No need! The place was lovely,friendly staff and a generous quiet (reconditioned) unit with eveything we needed except for a frying pan...I am already planning my next trip there and I cannot understand what happend to the other people that complaint so much.Maybe there is a problem with units that are not reconditioned, I dont know .Also we had absoltutely no problem with the timeshare pitch. I can only recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the timeshare but the hotel”
Reviews.Author: grammy1
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay online. The offer was 3 nights for $99 and no tour required. At the time I thought we were staying at the resort itself. It ended up we were in the adjoining hotel. But, that ended up being a bettter deal as we got free breakfast every morning. We had full use of the resort ammenities. We only used the pool area and the internet cafe. This is not a cafe. It is a room with 3 computers, free soft-drinks and free chips. The hours were bad. One pm until 10 pm. This was the worst thing. The room was clean and neat. It had a fridge and microwave and one cupboard. The sofa bed was lumpy and we put the mattress on the floor the second night. The king size bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to say but not going back!”
Reviews.Author: 1Travelgirl08
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Oak Plantation Resort. We have always advised all of our friends to stay here, as the experience has always been wonderful. We requested the same villa as last year as it is right next to the little store that they have on site. We were very pleased when they honored our request and we checked into the same villa. When we opened the door to the villa, we were struck with a very musty smell and very dirty looking carpeting. Upon reaching the upstairs to the unit the smell only got worse. When turning on lights through the villa, almost all the switches were dirty with finger smudges. The bathroom looked as if someone gave it a very quick once over, but there was hair behind the toilet and door. Prior to my family unpacking, we went down to Walmart and I bought bleach spray and cleaned the villa myself. I was very leery of letting my two girls walk around barefoot as the carpeting really was that bad. The girls slept on the pull out sleeper sofa and the bedding for it was torn. Note - If you stay here, make sure you wash all of the dishware prior to using it as it does not look like they are washed between guests, by the house keeping staff. There is no way to know if your version of washing dishes is the same as the guest before you. The grounds are very nice and we very much enjoy the location, but the resort is a sister property to an Oak Plantation Hotel which is located out front. There is a connection walkway between the two places where people staying at the Hotel can come to the Resort and enjoy the pools and grounds. There were many nights that the girls wanted to enjoy the pools at 10pm at night, but it was often busy with the people coming over from the Hotel. One of the attraction for us at the Oak Plantation has always been that it is a smaller property and you usually do not feel crowded. I would have to say that my opinion on this has now changed. We paid $50.00 a night through Expedia, which is a very good rate. Even though the price was great, I am very sure that this was our last stay at Oak Plantation. I am willing to pay more for a cleaner more secure place for my family and I. Jennifer - NY

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: dmacbeth42
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night promotional stay at Oak Plantation. Our 1-bedroom vila was quite nice. Nothing fancy, but okay for two or three people. A buffet breakfast and dinner was available on site for $5.95. The location is very nice. Tucked into a pleasant wooded, park-like setting. The promo wasn't horrible and the time-share buy-in price was much less than other places we visited. The Disney "Touch of Magic" ticket gifts lets you see one major theme park and one minor park for one day. If you need more, tickets are for sale on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: The check in was fast and easy. The staff were friendly. A good value for the price. Clean facilities and room. Everything in good condition. I loved the place. Charming reception area,excellent pool area, nice playground, and basketball court, also have a game room. Is a good place for families or couples searching privacy and tranquility.Location is not a problem because is near stores, restaurants and theme parks. I have no problem and would recommend it. I have a suggestion for you :request a second floor because I notice the floor was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: speedeetee
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Oak Plantation resort in Kissimmee, FL for a week in Dec.07. We booked online -Orbitz -and got a suite for $44 a day! When we checked in ,the one bedrooms were all booked so they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite for free. My kids got their own room and beds with a tv and their own bathroom and walk in closet. I got a king sized bed with a tv, walk in closet and my own bathroom. They have a full kitchen with a dishwasher,microwave, refrigerator,stove, and they even provide utensils, pots,pans,plates, and glasses. There was a washer and dryer also and a vacuum and iron, ironing board. The pools are big and heated and there is a tiki bar by one of the pools. There is also a hot tub, tennis court, internet cafe with free chips and pop and a work-out room with one working treadmill and a tv. There are alot of activities here for kids and they also have a buffet at resort (breakfast, dinner) for a reasonable price. We just went down the road to walmart and stocked up on food. There is also a 7 eleven within walking distance. The pool is open until 1 am so even when we got back late from Disneyworld it was still open. It is not very far from all the local attractions either, just a few minutes. The entrance is gated so only people that are staying there can get in with their room key. The pond @ the resort has a fountain and ducks and there were also peacocks running around and a few stray cats. Overall, I would definately recommend this resort. It has everything you need while away from home. It was like a condo, not like a hotel which we usually stay at. We did not get the housekeeping because we cleaned up after ourselves and washed our towels right in the room. If we ever come back to the area we will be staying here again. How can you beat $44 a night for all these amenities?

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: firefight479
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was not extremely difficult as long as you had printed directions. Upon our arrival, check-in was pleasant and rapid. I was aware of the sales pitch offer prior to my arrival, so I avoided that. It wasn't even offered because I had arrived at about 10pm. The staff even let me know that for a few hours not all services may be available. This was due to the company holiday party going on that night. Completely understandable! The grounds make it feel like you are in a secluded area. Lots of shade trees and pleasant look. The neighborhood is not as bad as some describe, but probably not the best. Never was I worried about this. Wal-Mart about a quarter of a mile away. Great for needed supplies! The outside of the building was in very good shape. (we reserved the two bedroom villa) When we entered, the first very obvious thing was a musty smell and filthy carpet!! We took our 2 year old's sandals off and that was a mistake. Her feet were black within 2 minutes...no exaggeration!! I wish we had taken before and after pictures of feet from walking on the carpet. The dishwasher was outdated and the bottom portion exterior was rusted and falling off. The bottom half of the fridge had rust spots covering it. A little touch up paint would have taken care of this ugly sight. The cabinets are outdated- original color was wood grain. Then they obviously tried to update it with new doors. However, white doors on a dark wood base looks very old and tacky. There were several unremoveable stains on the countertops. With the exception of the carpet, the overall condition was acceptable. I have seen the complaints about the flooring prior to staying there and they obviously have not corrected this issue. I would really hope that they would not rent this unit to anyone else before carpet replacement. It was that bad!! We would have asked for a new unit, but we arrived pretty late. The last thing we felt like doing was messing with that. The kids loved the place despite what we noticed. After unloading the truck, I took the kids to the pool. A big plus was that the pool was open until 1 a.m. and the Tiki Bar until 10:30 p.m. The kids had a great time at the pool. The whole area was very clean and had towels available even after hours. The jacuzzi is huge with powerful jets! One pool is heated and the other is not. (kids swam in both regardless) There is even a neat little kid's area that they enjoyed. When we returned from the pool it was very late and the kids were ready for bed. I pulled out the sofa bed to find that there were no sheets or pillows available for it. I would condider this a complaint if it weren't for the extremely helpful staff. Housekeeping was off for the night, but the maintenance person was just returning from the company party. He went to some extra trouble of finding bedding for us immediately. Very friendly!! (also any staff that was driving by our vehicle were constantly offering to lend a hand) We opted not to pay the extra $25/day for housekeeping, so cleaning was on us. If you plan on cooking, bring some non-stick pans. Their pans are not and the kitchen is not equipped with scrub sponges. I found myself a bit rushed to make the 10 a.m. check-out time. Even another hour would be nice. The check-out staff was very courteous and asked how the stay was. It was then that I told them about the carpet and dishwasher issue. He was very apologetic and ensured me it would be noted. Taking a look back as a whole, we would probably only stay here again if it were going to be for at least a week where we needed to use the kitchen and have the extra space. Next time for a couple days stay, we will just get 2 rooms somewhere else for the same price. Other rooms for a cheaper price have been in better shape. Keep in mind that I have listed mostly the negative points that we noticed. There were plenty of positives to go along with this experience. If you have lots of kids like we do, you will want the space!! There was no fine print with hidden cleaning charges or anything at this place! Still overall pleased with the property and would give it a recommendation if you are not looking for 4-star accomodations! Please review some photos that I will be posting.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement...”
Reviews.Author: JenWolgey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in a 2-bedroom. It was just OK. No sound-proofing in the villas-we could here EVERYTHING from next door and upstairs-very annoying when you are trying to relax on vacation and it sounds like there are elephants running above and beside you, and a domestic dispute next door. Saw 5 broken chaise lounges at the pool, and that was just in the area we were trying to sit in. Didn't look around at the rest of pool. The carpet in our villa was nasty. Wrinkled, stained and dirty. Cobwebs around the base of the bed. Would not walk around after dark in this neighborhood (off-site of the hotel). On the plus side, the grounds are pretty, there was lots of room in our villa, and the staff we came in contact with were very nice. This place just needs some updating and some serious cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lpphoto
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the negative remarks, this place is awesome! It is extremely clean, staff very friendly and helpful. We will be going back this coming year again...I was so impressed I ended up buying time share at Oak Plantation. Make sure when you book it is the Oak Plantation at Enchanted Oaks Cir. We were there 8 days and just left on Sunday Dec. 2nd.. Again, a great place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Not too Shabby at all”
Reviews.Author: hacksawCanada
Reviews.Content: Very good staff, Resort is older but nice and clean & fresh paint. Nicely lighted paths with music surrounding their pond with fountains and lots of wildlife. Rooms are clean and have everything you need except dvd & Internet in room. Internet cafe was nice with free pop and chips. Pool & hot tub are wonderful, clean warm and open till 1Am. Fitness centre needs work.Nautilus machine was good but carpet smelled like cat pee/wet and the two treadmills are old, one was out of order. All in all, good place, Yes I would stay again and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: jat32z
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week long stay at the Oak Plantation Resort. I was scared after I booked this and read some of the reviews. After our stay though, I would have to say that I would definately stay there again. Not sure if some of the negative reviews are posted under the wrong Oak Plantation - maybe the motel on 192?? They are in the process of upgrading all the units - we did not stay in one of the upgraded units, but it was nice. If you are looking for somewhere that is not in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the tourist area, but not far from the parks and the tourist "strip" down Route 192, close to I-4 - this is a great location. The unit we stayed in was a 2 bedroom (King sized bed in the master and 2 full beds in the 2nd bedroom and 2 bathrooms in the unit. It was very spacious and clean. The kitchen was not the greatest - a bit small, stove seemed to be old but worked. Anything we needed that was not in the unit, the front desk staff was more than accomodating and we received our requested items within minutes. Our unit had a laundry room with a full size washer and dryer which I absolutely loved and the master bedroom had a huge walk-in closet - very nice!! The landscaping on the property is beautiful - small pond with fountains right outside our unit - ducks, cranes, fish, turtles, etc. They also have music that plays around the pond - not loud enough for you to hear unless you were outside. Nice tennis courts - a few outside charcoal grills, small store. The pool and hot-tub area is very nice - a little bar that serves some food, bartender Carolyn - extremely nice!! We did the timeshare presentation to receive a discount on Epcot tickets - the salespeople have to try to sell the timeshare - that is their job and how they make a living. I have to say, this is the first time I have ever been to one of the presentations, but the salesperson that we had, did not pressure us one bit nor did the sales manager. The staff at this resort is top-notch - extremely nice, professional and worked hard to make sure we were satisfied. If you are looking for a five star location - this probably is not for you. If you are looking for somewhere to come back to after a day out at the parks, shopping, etc . and have a clean, safe place to stay - then I would recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gbeken
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. My husband and I came for our first "real" honeymoon and we both loved it. They had a conveniance store on the property where you can get salad or sandwiches and things to drink for your stay. The kitchen had everything you would need in case you wanted to cook. They also had a washer and dryer in the villa so I was able to leave with clean clothes. The staff was so friendly. We did get lost on the day we arrived, but that was because it was nightime. The location is close to restaurants and walgreens. it is also easy to get to the park attractions from here. We decided that whenever we visit Florida we will stay here from now on. We are already planning on taking our kids next year, which is good for them because they have a kiddie pool and playground. We honestly miss the place.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, well equiped and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kiwimiss
Reviews.Content: Apart from the rather tedious and annoying check-in procedure it was a very plesant place. At check-in you get your room key, etc then are told you must see the other rep for your parking permit... we waited near on 10mins while the rep dealt with the couple in ahead of us, trying to sell them everything and anything, but thinking it was a necessary process in order to park our car. He took one look at our face and knew we weren't interested in anything so just gave us the permit and we were off. In fact the permit didn't seem necessary at all and was just a pretence for getting a captive audience - your room card gets you through the barriers! The accommodation and area itself was lovely, with well equiped kitchen, nice clean rooms and very spacious. We had pleasant views of the pond / fountain. The gym was on the very small side (only one working treadmill and a couple of weight machines), and there were only a couple of computers in the internet cafe, but we were pleasantly impressed with the coffee / cookies / snacks on offer, although disappointed that in order to get a breakfast you had to endure their sales pitch. It didn't seem worth the time sacrifice so we forwent the torture and did our own thing (not a big deal with a fully equiped kitchen and shops nearby). All in all a very plesant place to say if you can avoid their sales pitch, or endure it.

Reviews.Title: “My children loved this place, it was great.”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Orlando and picked up my car, Virgin had given me directions to this place and after a 10 hour flight, 2 kids in tow and serious jet lag i attempted to find it. I did eventualy find it, but Virgin had given me directions that i can only compare to getting into a passenger seat through the drivers door. So, if your staying here do get directions yourself first. Check in was quick, a guy at reception sat me down and started giving me the hard sell about all the tickets they could provide etc..... my kids were running riot, i was knackered so i politely told him thanks but no thanks. Asked for a lower villa since my daughter was 2, was given a top floor villa. However, i did actually come to relise that i would much prefer a top floor villa for the light, views and noise. The villa itself is simply a one bedroom masionette. With an open plan kitchen/dining room it is not spectacular. But who goes to Orlando to sit in a room! It was more than we needed and absolutley fine. There is a walmart about 1/4 mile down the road so we stocked up on juice, cereals etc and used the frdige. Whilst there not a single item went missing, any problem i had was instantly sorted, the place was clean, tidy and generally a really pleasent place. The Spa is red hot but it is strategically placed so your kids can play in the childrens pool whilst you sit and relax. When i was there the pool bar kept giving me 2 drinks everytime i bought 1. I started to think she was trying to get me drunk so she could join me in the spa..... No, it was 2 for 1 until 9pm or something. Location is great if your driving, to be fair i would not stay here unless i had a car, but then i would not to go Orlando if i didnt have a car. Local amenities are great, everything is there and within walking distance. Driving time to Parks is minimal once you figured out which Highways to use. Oh, dont use the telephone, a 1 minute call to UK cost me $45, if it rings and they dont answer they will still skin you $20. Take a hoard of $1 bills. Orlando is like Toll city, you cant breathe without the highway charging you a dollar for the privilidge. To sum up - Stay here if you drive, there is everything you need nearby, its nice to get away from the action at night to relax, its a quiet pleasent yet friendly place, if you go expecting this you wont be dissapointed. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Oak Plantation Does Just Enough To get By”
Reviews.Author: OurGetaways
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Oak Plantation. We exchanged with RCI. Our first unit was a disaster. Blood stains were on the sheets. We had a fire in the oven - new coils needed to be replaced. The unit was filthy. The bathroom walls had brown dirt on them. We were moved to another unit that was much cleaner but was in need of a lot of updating but we were very glad that they changed us to a different place to stay in. The pool area is very nice. There are two lagoon style pools. One of the pools must have had a filter not working because there was hair and a good amount of misc. gunk floating init. It seemed to get worse every day. The other pool was clean and we enjoyed swimming in it. The lady who works at the Tiki Bar is very sweet. We didn't order anything from her but she was always so kind when we saw her. The grounds are very pretty. There is a free internet cafe that you can go to. The area that the resort is in however is not good. The department store next to the resort has metal shudders that roll down at night and some of the people that are walking around are questionable. Really, this resort could be a great one if they would sink some money into it and not just provide enough to get by with.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for the money”
Reviews.Author: peiscooter
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked the place for us. I figure we paid about $90 per nite, for a 1 bedroom. We like the option of the full kitchen when we travel. The Walmart is a few blocks away for groceries. The villa we had was "average", with no real issues. I signed up for the timeshare breakfast, which was as annoying as I had imagined. However, we did get a pretty darn good deal on Disney tickets for doing so. Getting there from the airport was a breeze. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. However, it is not a spot I'd stroll around in after dark (outside property boundaries). The pool area was great, tiki bar was great. I would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant stay here”
Reviews.Author: chanderson
Reviews.Content: First and most importantly you do get more for your money here. Place is clean and comfortable. Dont like the timeshare offers too much, but if you have an hour or so to spare and want free theme park tickets then it's for you. I've stayed here many times in the past and the place has not changed, meaning it is still a quiet out of the way place from the hussle of international drive. The place is well kept. Very clean and tidy on the inside too. Only one bad thing I experienced was when I reserved the one bedroom loft. Everything was fine until we went upstairs to a private balcony and found bird crap all over the chairs and balcony. Basically the balcony was in an un-useable condition. That's really it. Anyways, when we feel like taking a long weekend and not feeling like your in the middle of tourist heaven, we will definetly stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort”
Reviews.Author: meeplet
Reviews.Content: When we first went to Florida in October '05, we were staying in a crummy motel complete with cockroaches and mildew (can't remember the name.) On our first full day in the US, we went to Oak Plantations to hear a timeshare lecture. Admittedly, it was the promise of discount Universal Studios tickets after 90 minutes that we originally went for. However, the site won us over and we bought 2 weeks a year in one of the the bigger apartments. And as a gesture of goodwill, they moved us into their (then) just opened motel that very night, for the remainder of our holiday! The motel is fabulous, we got two double rooms, and they were huge. The beds are massive and the kitchenette provided everything we needed, including a fridge and microwave. The rooms each had a lounge area with fold up sofa beds. The bathrooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. In fact, the whole place is beautifully decorated, and the furniture is luxurious, none of the economy rubbish from our original motel! During our stay, we were welcome to use all of the resort's amenities. We came back for our first proper holiday as owners in July 07, this time in our beautiful first floor apartment. Which was enormous! Two plasma screen TVs with 40 channels, a full kitchen with breakfast bar, full size fridge/freezer, over, hob, and microwave, washing machine and tumble dryer (although there is an on site launderette), dining area, lounge area, walk in closet (with an electronically controlled safe) and full bathroom. Again, tastefully and luxuriously decorated in a modern style. There are two pools which we made full use of, an internet cafe which is free of charge (three computers, two unlimited, and one with a net nanny for children) and works on half hour slots. There is usually a 15 minute wait for a machine at most, and if it's a quiet period, you're free to stay on the net until someone comes in and require a machine. The room is also used for kid's activities and has a complimentary drinks machine and a large, well stocked basket of complimentary chips (crisps!!!) There are always activities on, every single day. Stand out ones during our stays were the poolside movie on a 17 foot screen (take mosquito repellant!) which was free, bingo with all-you-can-eat pizza (also free, and boy were they generous with the amounts of pizza, needless to say, we didn't go hungry that night!) and the Tiki bar luau. There is a convenience shop on site, and the afore mentioned laundrette. We were right opposite a walmart which helped immensely too! The staff are friendly and always willing to help, especially at reception (also where you can get complimentary hot drinks and cookies.) We've no regrets and will be back every year!

Reviews.Title: “- Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: sigma5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oak Plantation Resort for almost 3 weeks and loved it! We had a spacious two bed, 2 bath apartment. Our 2 teenage boys aged 19 & 15 happily shared the good sized 2nd bedroom without getting in each other's way. The staff were friendly and the housekeeping service was very good. Having a washer and dryer in the apartment also made life easier. We found it be a very comfortable resort, and can't understand the negative reviews at all. This was our first time at Oak Plantation, and we loved it so much we'll definitely be going back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best resort”
Reviews.Author: marisia1000
Reviews.Content: So i went to Oak Plantation for a week. The place inside is a little outdated. Their pool and hot tub were okay, but sometimes the pool got dirty. Our refrigerator broke, dryer was very very squeaky, and landscapers were trimming bushes at 8:00 in the morning. The internet cafe is awesome, however their arcade smelled very moldy. I played one game there and immediately got a headache. The room was not cleaned very well because we found leftover items from the previous occupants.They have free shuttles to disney but only one scheduled time for arrival and departure. Around the resort theres a small mall and Walgreens and thats basically it. And the general store was also nice to pick up some groceries for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price-- as long as they don't charge you twice!”
Reviews.Author: DrRoo
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire-- so for the price I was very happy. I was in Floriday for a convention--- so a one-bed condo for the week meet my needs. My room was clean and comfortable. The staff friendly. I didn't use the pool and other ammendities. I was happy with the acommodations. A gentlemen who worked in the internet cafe was very especially helpful. The room did not smell as noted by other reviews. I did have two problems. 1. I was wrongly charged twice for the stay on my credit card along with the $20.00 for incidentals (I had no incidentals). It has been two months-- and my card has not yet been credited. 2. I signed up for the " 90 minute tour'. I was to receive an extra night lodging or $100.00 for participating. The "tour event" ended up being over 2.5 hours! They wouldn't stop..... it went on and on and on.... even when I kept reminding them prior to the 90 minutes that their time was almost up.... I was stuck -- I had already stayed the night etc..... Even when I thought it was finally over-- there was another hoop to jump through. It was a total disregard for my time. They refused to compensate me any further. At this point, I just wanted out of the resort, never to return again!!!! I had planned on making a formal complaint to the Florida Department of Real Estate but have yet to take action.

Reviews.Title: “Could ask for no more attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: britsbest
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 days as a "private" rental and a week as a RCI exchange. We had to change apartments which was a breeze- they did all the work. The apartments were identical. The towels were large and fluffy. There are numerous restaurants on the 192 and our favourite for great steak was unbelievably TGI Fridays. We sat through a presentation and free breakfast, totally pressure free ( probably as we own more weeks than we need!) and received great discounts on Universal/Islands of Adventure tickets. I am at a loss to understand all the negative reports on here !

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY CLEAN and ACCOMADATING!! WOULD RETURN”
Reviews.Author: SheenaRN
Reviews.Content: I was scared to stay at this resort after reading all of these terrible reviews. It was not at all like we expected, it was MUCH BETTER. We stayed in a two bedroom villa and had plenty of room for our family vacation. We stayed in 800 something and was very nice. The rooms had no smell of anything but cleanliness. They always have something to do around the resort for adults and children. WEe really enjoyed the movie nite poolside. THey bring out a HUGE screen and you get free popcorn but the drinks were way too high, so we just took our own. THEY DO NOT CHARGE YOU FOR CLEAN TOWELS!! You do have the option of maid cleaning for a fee, but we would call for towels and THEY DELIVERED them to your room within MINUTES and it was completely free. And they would take our dirty towels with them. you do not have to wash them yourself. Our unit had a washer, dryer, dishwasher, all in great working order. My only complaint was that there wasn't enough dishes and utensils. We ate probably half of our meals there and had to go to Walmart to get somethings that weren't there. Perfect place if you plan to go to any Disney parks. They are only 15-20 minutes away if that depenidng on traffic, And the resort has FREE Shuttle service to some of the parks which we didn't realize until the end. ALL in ALL very nice and accomadating, NOTHING like some of these reviews say. THE place doesn't get enough cedit.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: bermudakid
Reviews.Content: We took a spontaneous vacation and got a great deal on Travelocity. We stayed in a one bedroom unit with our 2 year old and it started to get cramped by the end of the week. We requested a portacrib for our daughter and it was so unsafe (kept folding up and the bottom was not one solid unit) that we ended up putting her to sleep in our bed. There really wasn't room for the crib anyway as it was wedged so tightly between the bed and closet we had to climb on the bed to get her in and out. The washer/dryer unit (a one machine combo) was very noisy and we were unable to hear the tv when it was on. The room was very stale smelling but clean when we arrived. The grounds were well kept and the smallish playground worked fine for us. I think any kids over the age of 6 would be bored at the playground though. While the grounds were pretty and comfortable to walk around, the biggest problem we had was the noise. There is a fire station across the street which had trucks leaving frequently with sirens. Also, the resort is right under the flight path for the airport, so many times a day it is deafening with the big airplanes coming and going. We were spared the time share shpiel and overall the interior of the grounds was pretty quiet. It wasn't a horrible experience, but I would choose to stay somewhere else the next trip and I certainly would not buy a time share here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place Overall”
Reviews.Author: mommysport02
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place. we stayed 5 nights, and purchased it off ebay, where you get 2 free disney tickets for listening to a 90 presentation. WE were surprised at how nice it was! I read the other reviews and the people who write the neg. ones just sound grouchy! We have a 4yr and a 2 yr old and this was a nice place for them. When we first arrived in our 1 bedroom condo, it was clean overall and the bedroom was up stairs, our glass sliding door upstairs did not lock and i called the front desk late at night and they had someone there in 10 min and they fixed it right away! IT had a summer feel to it and very bright! THe pool area was great, my kids loved it. The tiki bar was great to grab a pizza and drinks by the pool. The activitys they had for the kids were great. Clean property, people were nice and did not pressure us to buy. it really is not a bad deal for the timeshare but just not the right time for us! I would stay here for sure again! if you dont want upstairs with little children request a 1 bedroom on the ground level. We got the the 2 floor away from the pool as it is open until 1am with music. hope i helped you out and have a blast as we did!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: keepitreal01
Reviews.Content: I overlooked the reviews on this resort simply because the pictures of the pool ares and buildings looked really nice and livable. BIG mistake. I was considered a renter since I dont own at this resort nor was I an exchanger. So in their own words I was roomed in what was left over............A smoky, smelly first floor apartment where you could see that the apartment was broken into before. I told them about the door the evening I checked in and I was schedule to stay 4 days 3 nights............NO ONE came to look or solve the problem the entire 4 days. That same evening I asked to be moved to an upstairs apartment and was told they had no more rooms available. The room was very dated. The sofa bed was an old green faded couch where the cushions didn't fit. One lousy plaid chair. A VCR not a DVD player. Green faded placemats with the same type napkins. The appliances were unbelievable.....VERY OLD oven with the oven heating coils hanging down.. and the stove top coils were crooked. The washer and dryer are dated and the dryer does not dry. The pillows.....FLAT. Each and every one of them. Both remotes for the TVs have no backs. Dishwasher is very dated. The filter to the vent was JUST FILTHY. Thick with dirt and dust. I could not stay there. I simply did not feel safe there. The apartment was in a corner of the resort and away from the pool area. The apartments in the pool area are nice but only for owners. There are two pools. One was constantly dirty with bugs, hair, sticks and leaves. The sprinklers in the kids area were not woking. The larger pool was clean and heated. We brought the kids over to use the clean pool since it was larger that the one at the place we decided to stay at the last minute. The pool area has a nice lay out. The tiki bar looked ok. The bartender Carlos was very pleasant. This resort is located near a small airport and every eight mins a loud noisy plane would pass over the pool area at low altitude. It was eight of us and six of us decided to move to another resort. My son and his girlfriend decided to stay since we had put the money out. He vowed never again. Of course the package required for me to attend a timeshare presentation . I was slapped in the face again when they showed me the rooms that are for the timeshare owners at this resort. BEAUTIFUL, marble counter tops, plasma tvs, modern furniture and appliances, jacuzzi tubs and master bedrooms. I asked why I was not offered a room like that so that I could be encouraged to buy and was told I was a renter and renters do not get that option to stay in those rooms. I even took the timeshare guy over to our apartment (1101) and showed him the place. His answer was he does not work for the resort he works for Interval International timeshare. I flat out refused to purchase at this resort or spend any night at this resort. So if you are a renter...BEWARE of vacationing at prime time. I think as an exchanger you might have a chance of a nice room in the off season. Renters BEWARE. The oak plantation resort and The inn at oak plantation are two different places. The inn at oak plantation is a road side motel that was probably bought by oak plantation resort, painted and remodeled with modern furniture and appliances. The resort is more like a villa setting. The motel is set off from the resort on a main street and requires for you to walk around the back through a path to the resort to use their pool. What a waste. Lucky for me I encountered a wyndham vaction kiosk at the mall and attended a timeshare presentation with them.............5 STAR ALL THE WAY.

Reviews.Title: “Not as clean or neat as portrayed. Smelly. Not going back”
Reviews.Author: cheejy
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I am writing review about any hotel. We have stayed in several hotels and resorts before. The pictures of this place, Oak Plantation are so glamorous, but the place is not well maintained. My wife almost checked out the same day we checked in. The room is smelly, the Internet Cafe is SMELLY, the High speed internet access (available only in the pool and Internet Cafe area) did not work, at least during the time we were there. We had to use dial-up. Something my wife was laughing at me for, as we had not used dial-up for so long. Feels so archaic. No, I will not recommended this place if you are used to five star hotels. However, for those only used to the smaller cheaper hotel, this might be heaven. Don't get me wrong. It is not the worst hotel , just over-rated

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Margie07
Reviews.Content: My husband and 9 yr.old daughter and I stayed at the Oak Plantation Resort in Kissimmee Florida April 22-29 2007. After we had booked the reservations; I started reading the reviews on this place. I was really leery of what we would find. I was pleasantly surprised. The place was super!! We really enjoyed the stay. We were at Disney World most of the time anyway. Our washer\dryer didnt work at all, but there is an on ground laundromat at the resort ( free of charge). Also, I think as long as you get an upper villa ( not ) the lower ones,,,, they are much cleaner ( for some reason) . I did talk to a couple of other guests who showed me their villas and that seemed to be the case. Our family will definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away-Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: gck93
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the The Oak Plantation Resort 27 March 2007, My husaband and I (late 30's) and our three children 13, 10 and 8. It was after 11 pm and had been a long day, (we travelled from the UK). As soon as we opened the door the smell hit us, it was a disgusting, filthy, dirty smell, my husband and I looked at each other, then our attention was turned to the carpets, filthy I don't just mean dirty I mean filthy, our feet were sticking to the carpets!!! The sofa was filthy and stained, the bed sheet's looked as if they hadn't even be changed from the previous guest 's! The Toilet had big stains in it and around the rim, it was awful. The Windows and blinds were broken and dirty, everything about this place was broken, filthy, I wouldn't let my dog stay there!!! We phoned Reception, they said they could not do anything until the morning when the manager came. We were supposed to have stayed 10 days, the next day we moved to another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy28
Reviews.Content: We purchased 3 nts. for $99 on ebay in an efficiency suite. Needless to say as the time neared we became more apprehensive about what we'd gotten ourselves into. But we were absolutely thrilled with the accommadations, the staff, the cleanliness etc. We had read some of the previous reviews at this site and were worried about what we might encounter but even our 19 year old daughter thought the place was great. We stayed in the hotel section but had full access to the resort. The pool area was awesome. We loved that it was open til 1AM and could have a drink by the pool. We hope to be able to go back at some point just to stay there for the week and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay.. for the most part”
Reviews.Author: ladybright28
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my children and husband for 8 days in March. It was by far not the best place we have stayed at but it was doable. When we arrived, the room smelled of strong mildew but we adjusted quickly to it and no longer smelled it the next day. The comforter was old and dirty so we put it away and just used the sheets and blankets. The sofa and chair had crunchy food spots on them and we covered them with sheets so the children could sit on them. The maid service was excellent even with them missing one day of service. The walls and cabinets were freshly painted and looked very nice but the carpet was really old and dirty. We just kept our eyes off of the carpet! The rooms and closets were very spacious. The thermostat had no numbers or words on it (old) so we had to have someone come up to show us how to work it. They did come very quickly. The appliances and cookware were newer. The washer and dryer are in one single appliance and it took 24 hours to dry anything. They first time we used it, It leaked all over the floor but it was fixed within an hour. We ended up going down to the laudry room which was very nice and convenient. The internet went out while I was in the Internet Cafe but the attendant had it fixed immediately. They offer a free drink and quality snack while using the Internet Cafe and the kids loved that. The pool area is nice and so are the drinks at the tiki bar. It was never crowded. One of the three pools was extremely dirty and it seemed to stay that way. Front desk service was friendly but the salesman was annoying. It is very close to the Parks and tons of restuarants. Although, I would turn right on the main street to dine out. When we dined on the left we had horrible dirty meals but always excellent meals on the right. I'm guessing it's because of the different types of areas. In my opinion it is not worth the price listed on their website but is worth the price listed on Orbitz. It had its problems but we did not let it ruin our vacation. It was doable and we wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Oak Plantation and we WILL go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Pitcherfam
Reviews.Content: We went to the Oak Plantation for a fun and relaxing March Break and that was exactly what we had. The pictures of the resort are completely accurate. We enjoyed the heated pool (didn't get into the non-heated pool) and my children (4 and 6) had a great time at the kids splash pad/pool. The villa (1 bedroom) was clean and wonderful. We used the internet cafe a few times and the wait was no more than about 10 minutes. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The only complaints that we had about the resort was that the general store didn't have much other than quick snacks and treats (not a small grocery store as I was expecting), the dryer in our unit worked, but not great, and the resort could really do with a restaurant (the Tiki bar did sell pizza, hotdogs, Cuban sandwiches and that sort of thing for lunch or a snack). Overall, the resort was fantastic and it felt like an oasis away from the Disney chaos (10-15 mins. from Disney World) that goes on outside the gates of the resort. We will go back to this resort again!!

Reviews.Title: “VEry beautiful”
Reviews.Author: bucklong
Reviews.Content: I went to Oak Plantation with family - I'm 42 and my Mom is 62 and we went with my sis and her family which consisted of sis and hubby and two kids - 8 and 14. This was an exchange for me involving Westgate Resorts with my timeshare deal through Interval International which I LOVE LOVE , LOVE. I LOVED Oak Plantation! It's a little farther from some of the attractions of Orlando than some of the other places - including my home resort which is a Westgate Property, but Oak Plantation is absoluty great. It's nestled in an "Oak Plantation" - no surprise there and when we went we had taken a "red-eye" from Seattle so we got there early and really had no expectations about checking in early. But the staff was VERY helpful and although they couldnt' get us in immediately they referred us to breakfast and got us in early anyway. The resort is very close to a great boulevard that has everything you could ever want from shopping to eateries to even entertainment. If you like Mexican food please please try out Frontera - it's SO GOOD. I've been there twice and the food is absolutely excellent. It's a great value and the pools and hot tubs etc. and location are all good. My only warnings on this one are that it DOES take a little figuring as far as how to get to Disney and Universal and stuff - but when we stayed there - the main freeway was under construction and I think that had alot to do with it. Orlando / Kissimee - I love it but I find it hard to get around. Oak Plantation is not a five star or anything .. it has no eateries etc. but there's no need for them because its all blocks away.
