If anyone want's to know my two biggest beefs about this place, and they are minor because in the grand scheme of things they did NOT impinge on the WONDERFUL time I had there but #1 if you get a two bedroom and you plan to have anyone sleeping on the fold out in the living room - they will not have a bathroom accessible in the night without going into one of the bedrooms. I slept in the living room on the fold out which was actually very comfortable but in the night if I had to "GO" I had to slink through someone's bedroom and the other thing ... this is SO MINOR to me ... but the ferrel cats were an issue for me. I am allergic and because of that I absolutely HATE CATS and I did not enjoy the fact that it smelled like cat pee outside our unit and there were ferrel cats roaming about. They need to get a grip on the cat issue.

Reviews.Title: “Tight accomodations, old unit.”
Reviews.Author: JnLPA
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the size of the unit that was supposed to sleep six, comfortably. We were very, very cramped. Ours was a timeshare exchange and they gave us the short end of the stick. They had newer and much nicer rooms but choose not to give us any of those. Then they tried to sell us a timeshare! The surroundings are nice and the pool is also, but if your going to exchange this resort for your own, avoid this place. There are much nicer places to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Relaxing - Had a great time!! Would definately return”
Reviews.Author: OntarioAbby
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 adults stayed at the Oak Plantation in Kissimmee over the first week of February. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and found we had plenty of space. The rooms were very clean and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The pools and hot tub were fairly large so there was lots of room. The tiki bar beside the pool was also very nice. Although we were not travelling with children, this would be a great place for a famiy with small children to visit. They had several activites for children every day...free. We were also pleased to have access to the internet cafe and fitness room. I would definately visit this resort again, and highly reccommend it to anyone. It is close to so many tourist attractions/shopping, but yet as soon as you go beyond the gates to the resort, it is very quite and relaxing, you forgot you're in the city. We also did go on the 90 minute tour (not mandatory) as this is a time share resort. After the presentation (which ended up being 2 hours) we decided buying in to the time share wasn't for us, but definately did have its benefits. We did not find the sales reps to be rude or pushy and as promised we did receive 6 free ticket to air boat rides (over $125 value). Overall we loved our stay, and look forward to returning. Clinton, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool Christmas day!”
Reviews.Author: Amherstburgians
Reviews.Content: We had read many reviews about the resort and were worried about the negative comments. We found our condo to be exactly as advertised, clean and comfortable. Front desk and cleaning staff were friendly and requests were quickly honoured. Wonderful weather, clean pools and such shopping! Even the "sales presentation" was ok, however it was really hard sell with an abrupt swich to complete distain when the answer was "no". You have to talk with several people with time left waiting for each to arrive. The whole thing actually took 3.5 hours, however they did make good on their promised $$ at the end. We were informed that the time shares are selling so well, that they will not allow anyone else to stay by next summer. A pity, as the rest of it was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Lunasea138
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative reviews about this place, but I had a great experiece at this hotel! I went with my boyfriend last January. He likes to rest while on vacation, while I like to sight-see. This hotel was the perfect place to do both. There are two large pools and a hot tub, all open until 1am. We stayed in a huge loft-style villa (try to get one of these). There was a full kitchen with bar, laundry room, two bathrooms, a dining room, and enough closet space for 10 people. To me, this was the perfect place to come back to after a long day out at the parks. They are far away (about 30 minutes or less) so you need a rental car. Go to expedia for cheap 5-day rentals (less than $150). The surrounding area is a bit commercial, but there are oulets and restaurants. I liked the drive to the parks, because you get to experience Florida as well as Universal and Disney. Also go to Ripley's Musem. The villa was a bit out-dated, but I was really happy with the entire stay. If you go to the tour where they try to sell you a time-share, just say no (after 1 hour) and you get free theme park tickets (no strings attached). I am going back in two months. Hope to see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surroundings for a relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: WendyH-M
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 2 week break at the Oak Plantation Resort, I would have no hesitation recommending it to visitors to the Orlando area. The surroundings of the lake and trees are delightful, complete with squirrels, herons, ducks and apparently an otter. The apartment was very well equipped, far exceeding any holiday apartment that I have previously visited, and was cleaned daily to a satisifactory standard. Although the parks are a 20 minute trip away, this quarantees that you can do the usual Disney/Universal experience, whilst returning to peace of the resort for a restful evening. The pools stay open to 1am, as previously mentioned; the spa is extemely warm, even in the cooler Autumnal evenings. The resort as only 1 mile from the local Walmart (on the I192) and so was ideal for self-catering. We weren't hassled at all to attend the timeshare pitch and so hope to return for a second visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: hellofromcanada
Reviews.Content: My 15 year-old son and I just spent a week at the Oak Plantation Resort and it was such a break from the crowds and hussle of the Orlando theme parks. It was the perfect refuge after a day of seeing the attractions in the area. Right off a main street in Kissimmee, once you were on the property, you had all the privacy and peace you could want. Units were clean and offered all the comforts of home (washer, dryer, dishwaster, microwave, even a blender!) along with sufficient space for a mom and teenager to each have some privacy. Only suggestion for improvement is that it would be great if they put DVD players in the units, rather than the VCRs they currently have. The pools and hot tubs were great and open until 1:00 AM to allow for a swim before bedtime. When I learned that the Oak Plantation was a timeshare property, I was concerned that we might be harrassed to attend a presentation. Not at all, after checking in we were given some information on the area and invited to a breakfast where they make their presentation. I indicated that I was not interested and that was the end of it. Our stay was very enjoyable and all staff were very pleasant and helpful. Definately would recommend this resort to anyone with a family staying in the Orlando area for more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..even with the timeshare presentation!”
Reviews.Author: tanik
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness & room amenities First of all, let me say that I have an obsessive compulsion against dirty things, mostly stained things, even if it's old and I know that it has been cleaned. Although I felt squeamish at first knowing we'd be staying in a time-share, I was pleasantly surprised. The kitchen, bathroom and living area was remarkably clean. There were a few things that seemed a bit out of date, but we were shown models of renovations that will be complete in '08 and we were satisfied. The 1-bedroom Savannah room can get small if you pull out the sleeper couch, but otherwise, things were nice. There was a quaint dining room table, plus all the amenities you would expect, small washer/dryer combo - one unit and it worked! nifty - dishwasher, blender, toaster, coffee maker, full fridge, etc. Service (including timeshare) I was really being picky about this...because I knew I would come back and write this in Tripadvisor, but everyone was very friendly. When we asked for towels, they were sent to us promptly. The front desk folks were quick to walk outside to see if we were having problems with the gate. I used their internet cafe, and the guy who mans it was chatty and directed us to some free stuff in the lobby. The cafe had great 54 mbps reception wirelessly through Linksys, plus a few other computers, a TV and several board games and snacks and fountain drinks. (The guy who runs it loves Cartoon Network!) You can even access the internet on the patio outside the internet cafe after hours. As expected, we were quickly ushered in after a light breakfast at the sales presentation center. Al was your typical salesman, but was quick to point out the benefits of staying in a timeshare. It did take an hour and a half, but surprisingly, we ended up getting a timeshare. Now my family and I both are EXTREMELY skeptical of these deals, but we were given a great offer and they paid for our trip for buying and encouraged us to stay again for free. The current condos only have a VCR and two regular TVs, albeit with ample closet space. However on the tour, we were shown brand new facilities, including flat screen TVs and DVD players. There's even a place to rent them. The pool area is nice and kid-friendly. We were offered discounts at the tiki bar. The nice thing about their pool is that it's open until 1 a.m. in case you come in from a late night of theme parks. They gave us a couple bottles of sparkling apple cider to celebrate. We ended up spending about 4 hours there to complete the sale. We were also given two tickets to Universal Studios in a separate activity center. There's always music playing in little speakers on the grounds which was a nice touch. The resort can be difficult to find in that it's along a major strip in Kissimmee. It takes about 15-30 minutes to get to Disney or Universal, depending on traffic. However, the parking garage and the main entrance to Universal is another 20 minute walk, so be prepared for that. The folks in Florida drive insane (sorry, but they do!) so please be warned as you are traveling in and around the resort. This isn't related to the resort but Georgia and Florida is being besieged currently by these little black bugs that are mating and fly around attached to each other. Thousands upon thousands of them. It was quite disturbing, so be aware of this while traveling. Overall, we are looking forward to spending more time there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: lllljo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in August. The villa was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The pools were so relaxing after long days at Disney, etc. Fully equipped kitchens made it easy to eat in. Conveniently located grills made for relaxing cook outs. Everything we needed was located close by and easy to find. We will definitely stay again. I've gone on many vacations, and this was the most relaxing place I've ever stayed, with a very accomodating, friendly staff .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JMSLMS
Reviews.Content: This facility is not friendly to timeshare exchanges. We had to book one bedroom, for five because they don't offer 2 bedrooms to RCA timeshare owners. Not only that, they would not upgrade us unless we paid a $50.00 per night fee. They had plenty of rooms. We found out from owners that the room they placed us in was the smallest 1 bedroom that you could have. It was REALLY small. So, if we came for the purpose of buying, they way we were treated was about as bad as you can get, business wise. Now, the rest of the staff was friendly, the place was nice. But the washer in our room leaked and had to be fixed. They have VCR MACHINES, not DVD!!! So watching movies in your room is out. I wouldn't come back.. Sorry,,,to many places to stay in Orlando to be treated this way. Sadly for them, we are really not a family that is hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Linoliverpool
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form Oak Plantation Villas. Before we went we did not know what to expect due to some of these reviews. However it is a fantastic accommodation. We had 2 one bedroom villas, they were in block 10 which had recently been renovated. The villas had an adjoining door between them, which we left open, giving us access to both villas. They were lovely. Both villas were spotlessly clean with great facilities, the kitchen had everything you would expect it to have. The whole villas were very comfortable. We had maid service and they even cleaned away our dishes. The sports facilties were great you just have to leave your passport with reception if you are wanting to have use of their rackets etc. The bbq's are scattered all over the resort and they are cleaned each evening. The swimming pool was fantastic, the kids loved the pools. The drinks were not too expensive and the bar also sells food. The dive in movie evening was great, started at about 8pm and was a great atmosphere. They also had other activities by the pool such as painting, DJ etc. The staff were very friendly and would do anything to help. Security were always going around the resort so you always felt safe. This was nicely situated with a wallmart within 1 mile. There were alot of restaurants near by - outback steak house, ponderosa to name a few. We have been to Orlando several times and have stayed in hotels and holiday homes. However we loved this accommodation and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: josesolismusic
Reviews.Content: This is a very peaceful resort, out of the hustle and bustle of the general touristic area. If you enjoy a relaxing atmosphere when you're not doing your hectic park runs this is for you. They also have lots of family activities, like family movies in a big screen which you can watch even while bathing in on of the two pools. It's by the Osceola Square Mall and you will be in Disney in 15 to 20 mins tops. If you're hungry, there's several places inside the resort, but also just on 192 there's tons of restaurants of all price ranges. My family is used to coming to the area, and this was one of the least stressful places we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but a little far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: MackW
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Oak Plantation (we stayed in June of '05). They are in the process of upgrading the rooms and the upgraded units are much nicer, but not many are completed yet (1 building of 15). We had some noise problems with upstairs neighbors and the property is currently having a bit of a bee problem in several outdoor areas. The staff was very nice, and the pool and pond area is very nice (ask for a view of the pond or pool!) but some of the rooms face a poorly maintained neighborhood over the fence of the property and is not a nice view. A fire station is just outside the gate so we heard sirens quite frequently. My main problem was the distance to Disney, Universal, and Sea World. Though it is short in miles it can take a LONG time if you use the most direct looking route (Hwy 192). Use the Oceola Parkway ($1.50 toll each way each time) and you save a LOT of time, but it adds up. All in all an OK place to stay but I'd rather be closer to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently visit Orlando and stayed at the Oak Plantation Resort in Kissimmee. The resort had some very good rates. At first I was a little reserved but when we got there I fell in love with the resort instantly. Beautiful time share properties, the staff members were very welcoming. Our kids loved the pool areas and the many activities in the play ground area. The Resort is only 15 minutes to Disney World and there are many attrations around the Resort. This is a family oriented resort and we have recommended Oak Plantation Resort in Kissimme to our friends and family. We look forward to next years visit. Our kids can't stop taking about the resort. Andrew, Haja, Hannan & Andrea Kamara.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant accomodatiuons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was poorly constructed. we were up all night 3 nights in a row with the people above us. we were told by staff that we couldn't be moved even though there were units available in the newly renovated section. the washer/dryer combo was too small and leaked onto the kitchen floor. no drawers in the kitchen. all silverware, pots, pans, etc...were stored in the tiny pantry or cabinets. mattresses were extremely uncomfortable. the overall presentation of the property was nice. the pools were nice and there was an abundance of activities for the kids. other than the accomodations the place was nice. i traded my week in aruba time share for this and was not impresased

Reviews.Title: “MY STAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the oak plantation from june 22 to june 25, 2006, we loved it there, the location was wonderful and the resort was well kept and very clean. We never had a problem using the hot tub or the pools, there was all ways plenty of room. If i am ever in orlando again, I plan to stay at oak plantation, we had pleanty of room we got a 2 bedroom and there were 4 adults and 2 kids in our party. also the theme parks were very close it only took about 10 to 12 min to get there. We loved the oak plantation and we will go again to stay if ever in orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay at Oak Plantation. I had a wonder time everyone was friendly and helpful. I had such a wonder time that I brought a time share there. I would recommend this resort to family and singles.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Maeva3
Reviews.Content: Just after booking this trip for my 4 yr old daughter, husband, parents and sister as a family gathering at Disney for my daughters birthday, I read some of the horrible reports about this place being dirty and in a very bad neighborhood. Needless to say my stomach was in knots the whole time before the vacation thinking I was taking my entire family to some fleabag hotel in a seedy part of town...boy was I ever surprised and delightfully so!!! :) This part of town was nice, VERY accessible to ALL attractions that interested us. The resort itself was clean, pretty and cheerful. I am sooooo glad we stood here; we had a wonderful room - a second floor - 2 bedroom with a full laundry & kitchen (room # 402 I think). We all fit quite comfortably and the room was SPOTLESS. Now, I must say that I am quite a stickler when it comes to room cleanliness and I was very satisfied with each room. Everything seemed very clean - rug, furniture, beds (and sofa bed), kitchen, bathrooms, cabinets, frig, microwave. I know this because I checked it all even the grout on the tile in the corner behind the bathroom door....dust and grime free. When we left the room to go to the parks we got to Disney, SeaWorld, Downtown Disney and Epcot in 20 minutes flat. No traffic, no hassles, the route was simple, very direct and well marked. Other trips we took were to the airport, Kennedy Space Center (awesome!) and Ft. Lauderdale and we found the major highways quite easily. The resort itself was very nice and so was the staff at the front desk. We did not do the tour thing and were only called once to participate. Once we said no the first day..."Aziz" did not interrupt our trip our hound us for anything. We hung around the resort for one day of "rest" and their pool/lake area was super nice. Nothing gigantic like some of the other places we've stayed at but it was perfectly arranged. There were plenty staff around to give us towels. There were lots of chairs and tables to hang out at. The Jacuzzi gazebo was large and relaxing. The restrooms were clean and well stocked around the pool area. They offer a lot of activities which we did not have time to participate in but it was nice to know you had plenty of alternatives to the big parks should you care to stay in the resort a couple of days. My husband and father went to the general store on the premises for coffee daily. Overall we had a wonderful time. We would not hesitate booking there again in the future. My only negative comment is that the shower heads in the baths create a terrible hard spray that was annoying. Each time I showered I felt like Meryl Streep being hosed down in 'Silkwood'...other than that it's a great place to stay with your family. (Note to elderly guests or families with small children...the stairs inside the second floor rooms were quite steep so opt for a first floor room or ask if they provide a child safety gate for the little ones.)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Flithy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I were completely dissatisfied with our stay at the Oak Plantation Resort. The suite was alot smaller than we thought it would be which was not that big of a deal but we did not ask for a room which was filthy. We would not dare to walk on the floor or even have a bath, we showered instead thats how dirty it was. There were remnants of bugs being squat into the wall. The sleeper sofa was so uncomfortable, my husband and I slpet on that, we would not dare give it to our 3 year old son. The sheets that were there for the sleeper sofa were worn with holes and stains and all of the furniture was worn. We did not feel like spending much time there at all so really it put a big damper on our vacation when we travelled from Canada and had invested alot of money in this trip. When we checked out they said they would refund us $50 but my husband told them he would deal with the travle agent and we had gotten 2 nights back but so much for our vacation, we cannot go back and do it over again. I sent holiday house a letter about our displeasure and they never did get back to us. We are so irritated!

Reviews.Title: “Twice the Fun!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Oak Plantation twice. I stayed in the 2 story town home and Both times were great. The accommodation was great for the prices and the staff is very helpful. I have read some of the bad reviews and my experience was not that way at all. They have lots of events that you can do if you just want to hang at the resort. You are closes to everything. (Medieval Times, Disney, Air Boats and more). When I was there they had a shuttle to Cocoa Beach. There is a mall and other shopping centers surrounding the resort. If you would like to see the aerial view of the resort you can download Google earth and type in the address to see how closes it is to everything. If you have AAA there is an office right down the street to get discount tickets from. While I was there I felt that they did a great job of creating a siren environment within the complex even though it is in a busy area. I think that the Oak Tree add to the experience. There is an airport near by but I didn’t have a problem with it while I was in the condo or sleeping. All in all I think that if you are looking to stay in a hotel for around $100 a night you definitely should look into staying at Oak plantation. The only thing that I think would be kind of bad would be the time share pitch. I would just look at it as a way to get free tickets to a theme park if you are not interested. Don’t let the bad reviews keep you from getting a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Newyorktravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Oak Plantation. We have two little girls ages 8 and 5 and this was the best year yet. Oak Plantation is now doing daily activities for the kids like sand art and ice cream socials. We stayed over Mother's Day, and the kids could make cards and picture frames. It was such a nice touch to have daily activities for the kids when you wanted to spend the day by the pool and get a break from the parks. They also have a movie night by the pool. My 8 year old loved being able to stay in the pool and watch a movie on a big movie screen. Each unit has a large washer and dryer which allows you to pack lightly, which is a big help for us. Also, with the full kitchen and Walmart being 2 minutes down the road, you can get your groceries and save a TON of money by not having to eat out. There is round the clock security at the resort, and we felt very, very safe. The staff is wonderful and helpful and the grounds are just beautiful. One thing to note, there is a HUGE difference between the Oak Plantation and the Inn at Oak Plantation. Do not confuse the two. The two properties are joined, but the Inn is like an economical hotel. If you want the villa's, make sure you book the Oak Plantation Resort. This is the perfect place to stay if you are want a wonderful, relaxing, family vacation. This is the only place we will stay when we travel to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “oak is the best for your buck”
Reviews.Author: cathycroucher
Reviews.Content: Our family of two 40 yr. old parents and our daughter, age 9 stayed at Oak for 10 nights in May 2006 and loved it. We were a party of three families in total. It was only 20 min. from the Orlando airport and Disney. It is surrounded by great outlets, flea markets and of course, a super Wal-mart. We all loved it from the free maid service, three pools, hottub, 1 a.m. pool closure, tiki bar, friendly staff and great accomaodations for the price of $79.00 U.S. per night. We will be going back next year and would reccommend it to all if you are looking for a kid and family friendly environment. Newfoundland couple

Reviews.Title: “Oak Plantation Is Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ph2009
Reviews.Content: My husband, one year old daughter and four year old son and I stayed at the resort May 7-14, 2006. I originally booked through American Airlines vacations, and got a great rate of $42/per adult a night. I was so excited, and then started reading some of the negative reviews posted here about Oak Plantation. My excitement soon turned into apprehension as our vacation date neared.... OAK PLANTATION IS GREAT!!!!!! The staff was so friendly at check in, although our room was not ready at 4pm (check in time) as promised so we went out to get a bite to eat and they called half an hour later to say that our room was ready. At check in, I told them that I had read some bad reviews, and did not want to deal with a dirty room or anything like that, and would prefer a full size washer and dryer, not a combo. I was immediately reassured and given a room way above my expectations!! It was like home away from home, clean, bright and airy! The room was actually a one bedroom loft villa, with a pull out sofa bed for the kids...just great!!1 Don't believe the hype about this place---it is great, and I would def go again and again. The only disappointments were that we did not get to spend enough time there after full days at Disney. The pool is great (children's pool and two adult pools), all heated, plus a jacuzzi. The grounds are just beautiful with a lake complete with ducks and fountain... They have activities every day (and some nights) for the children, including a poolside movie on a big screen Thursday nights!! Well I just can't say enough, and I could keep writing forever, but I won't---to all the "haters" out there who complain about this place and the pushy sales people (an outright exaggeration in my case--all you have to do is say no---they are not going to force you)---all I have to say is I feel sorry for you--miserable people write miserable reviews...We went with bad expectations because of you and were more than pleasantly surprised....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our much anticipated stay at a "lovely two-bedroom villa" was a big disappointment. The unit was DIRTY!! Kitchen light did not work and was falling off the ceiling, mold in the bathroom, carpets stained, bugs on the mattress (yes,bugs!), lock faling off the entrance door. I would not recommend Oak Plantation In fairness to the reception staff, I must compliment them on their friendlines, and efficiency on our check-in and their concern with our complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resrot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and our 9 year old son stayed in a one bedroom condo at this restort from Apr 22-May 6, 2006. After reading some recent, poor reviews on this site, I was somewhat apprehensive about our decision to stay at Oak Plantion. This resort had a great family atmosphere. The grounds were well maintained, two very clean clean pools, splash pool for toddlers and a great hot tub. There were lots activities by the pool for pre-teens, bingo night with free pizza, movie night by the pool with free popcorn, and also pool toys for the children. Our condo was fresh & clean, with a complete kitchen, including dishwasher & a clothes processor (washer & dryer combination). The bedroom had a king bed & there was a double sofa bed in the livingroom. The staff were very helpful & friendly. We were ask to attend the timeshare breakfast, we refused, and we were not bothered again. The location of this resort was a bonus. It was close to all attractions and eating establishments, but it was on a side street off of the 192 so you could get away from the hussle & bussle of the 192. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Oak Plantation Resort. We had a great time there. My boys loved the pools andI we all loved the hottub after walking around the parks all day. The two bedroom/two bathroom we had was great. Quite a big layout with full sized washer and dryer in a separate little room. We had nachos at the niki bar one night(a really big serving, the bartenders were really nice, in fact all the staff were very friendly. We didn't have a car, so we used the shuttle in the morning, and used the Lynx bus(#56) to get home at supper time. Only 1.50 fare!!. It picked you up at the transportation centre at Disneyworld and dropped us off at the Oscealo Mall across the road. The Super Walmart just a few minutes down the road(20 min walk) has everything you need, from grocerys to souveniers. We also had supper at the Ponderosa and Friendlys, they were pretty good. Hope you have fun, we sure did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It!”
Reviews.Author: CastleRock80108
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oak Plantation Resort for 5 days in February 2006, and we will definitely never return. The website pictures of the complex are many years old, and the place is not anywhere close to being the great resort you would expect from the pictures. Our condo was badly in need of cleaning and updating (old, rusty, barely functioning dishwasher, dented and dirty refrigerator, dirty and worn living room furniture, filthy carpet) and the maid service was sporadic at best. The resort is surrounded by old oak trees that have seen better days, and is located in the middle of a very questionable neighborhood. It's also right on the landing path of the Kissimmee municipal airport, and small planes and jets fly directly overhead day and night. There are many much nicer hotels and condos in the Kissimmee area for similar or more reasonable prices, and they don't require you to endure the repeated timeshare sales hassle we received every time we went into the lobby of the "resort." Avoid this one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!! would stay there again anytime, VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical when I saw a few negative reviews but went anyway. This place is bar none the breast accommodations I have stayed at in any price range. You get a small almost town home type condo. There is a internet cafe, movies, basketball court, tennis, movie rentals, huge pool with bar and lots of activities for the kids, and the list goes on. I think some people come here for a vacation away from Disney! They are located literally less than one mile from any restaurant you can imagine, 10 minutes from Disney and 3 miles from downtown Disney. The staff was courtesy, there was no high pressure sales pitch, etc. The only negative I can think of is since we booked online we were unaware that not choosing the maid service ($10 more a day) we would not get towels once the ones in our rooms were dirty. overall I would highly recommend this place and would stay there again anytime I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at this resort. I was very disappointed, I read all the reviews but still tried to keep an open mind since I couldn't cancel my trip and everything I read was true. It's an OK place but it's dirty! The carpets are stained and it smells. I saw roaches in my bathroom. I can't believe people actually pay timeshare to stay at this place. All in all we had a nice time. We spent all day in the parks it didn't really make a difference because we just came to the hotel to sleep. But I will never stay there again. I recommend you NOT stay there it's jus not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: jcMN
Reviews.Content: We tried to be open-mined about Oak Plantation after reading some reveiws. But, right from the start I knew it was going to be a bad experience. When we arrived, we went to a local gas station across the street, which was full of gang graffiti and "kids" hanging out...in the middle of the day. Not a good sign. We checked in and got to our "condo," which was tiny. The resort is supposed to be gated, but that's just a joke. The have a gate at the front entrance that opens only with your card, but if you go to the back side of the property, there is a huge gate that's left open all day and night (it leads to the main road). The appliances were terrible, the stove hardly worked, and the fridge was dirty. The air vents throughout the condo were filthy - covered in dust, and we found an old, nasty dirty shirt tucked into the couch, the carpet was disgusting. We did the best we could to be positive, but when we were kept awake all night long by police sirens and airplanes flying directly over-head, we had enough. When we contacted the front desk, they tried everything possible to get us to stay, and then after hearing my complaints, they told me that I should expect this if I'm going to stay in the Orlando area. I informed them that we had been to Orlando the last several years and had never experienced a "resort" like this! If you aren't comfortable in a more questionable area, don't stay at Oak Plantnation. It's just not worth it! We checked out 5 days early and paid a little extra to stay at Bahama Bay, which was a much more family friendly place! When we did go to check out, we weren't the only ones, two other families were doing the same!

Reviews.Title: “Give it maybe a 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her two children, 2 & 5, and I stayed there from March 26 to April 2. The grounds were very nice, so was the pool and the children's activities. However, the room was in need of an update. The kitchen, bathroom fixtures and the bed were clean. However, the carpet and the walls were dirty. There were no insects in the room but a strong smell of smoke. (We knew that there were no non-smoking rooms at this resort and they did change the filter in the air-conditioning unit, however it was still uncomfortable) We would stay there again if they would freshen up the rooms with paint and carpet cleaning. Also, maybe they should consider setting aside some rooms for non-smokers. I think it would add greatly to the quality of the resort. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and if you don't consider the above a problem I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oak Plantation for 6 nights total during March Break. We were scheduled to check in at 4pm on Sunday. Our son was very sick however, and I phoned and explained our situation, inquiring about the possibility of an early check in time. They were able to accomodate this and we checked in shortly after 2pm. Staff at check in were quite helpful. Of course, they send you to pick up your parking permit from the person who tries to get you to come to the Sales meeting for the time-shares. I declined and we were not bothered about this for the rest of our stay. Our room had an odor of cigarette smoke, which we were able to quickly get rid of by opening the windows and using some air freshener. Otherwise the room was GREAT and overlooked the pool area. We had a problem with our fridge freezing up on the first day, but within 25 minutes of notifying the front desk, a very friendly, knowledgeable gentleman from the engineering department came up and promptly repaired it. The pools were great. Lots of activities for the kids to do there. Tiki bar at pool was nice, slightly pricey for alcholic beverages, but no big deal. Lack of wireless internet in individual units, but made up for it with their internet cafe which included free soft drinks and snacks. Oak Plantation is about 15 minutes to Disney and 25 to Universal. We inquired near the end of the week about staying an extra night. Initially they said there were no rooms available, then we got a room at the Inn, however in the end we were able to stay in our original condo for the extra night. We appreciated the helpful nature of the staff and we will definately consider going back there again!!! For less than $90.00 a night, this was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have taken many vacations since this one. NONE have ever compared! Cant wait to get back there. We had purchased 5 day hopper passes for the parks "that our 5 children had never been to" after day 2-3 our kids just wanted to stay at the resort. The pool was great and the kids pool was amazing! Our room was a two bedroom with kitchen and dining area -laundry room. The kids played video games is our room and our couch folded out into a bed also ! SSSSSSuper Great for BIG families! We found the staff to be great! Everything was wonderful. We opted out of the Time share confference and weren't pressed. We also chose to rent a mini van for the week. You just can't go wrong with this place. We also visited Ripleys- ent to the Gladiators dinner and show. _ where they have prime rib or chicken your choice- and when the kids didn't want either they substited hot dogs and hamburger and fries for the kids. All places recomened by oak plantaion. Bravo! Can't wait to get back this year!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello I need to right a wrong here. I wrote a very complimentary review for this resort entitled "Very Pleased" back in October. For that visit we were very pleased. We went back this February and we were very disappointed. We took another couple with us and bragged about what a great value this resort was for the money. We were so embarrassed. This time we were put in the ten building. Unlike our beautiful room in the four building last year, this room was disgusting. I still can not believe it could be so different. We had two rooms, both were filthy. The carpets were very dirty and torn. The furniture was old. Both units had ants. The stoves and sinks were gummy and needed to be scrubed. Our room stunk so we bought a candle at Walmart to help. Our bedspread had several large cig. burns in it. It was gross. I would have preferred to sleep in a sleeping bag on the ground. The staff was still very friendly and the pool and hot tub are wonderful but I have to warn you it is the luck of the draw with the rooms. Good Luck!!! The Kellers San Antonio

Reviews.Title: “Three years in a row, and still really like this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I just completed our 3rd stay at Oak Plantation. Each year, I ask my son Jon (he's 16) where he would like to go during his school vacation. For the past 3 years he has not hesitated--he loves Florida--especially the Orlando area. As usual, I used tripadvisor again this year to research new places to stay. (there are tons!) I look for properties that offer more than just a standard rectangular hotel room as well as grounds, amenities and nearby attractions that make the stay fun. Three years in a row, after looking at everything out there, I keep coming to the same conclusion. For the money, it's hard to beat this place, it really is. It's not perfect for everyone, but it is for us. They will offer to sell you a timeshare--but they are not obnoxious about it. The rooms are not all completely pristine and newly furnished, but the three units we have rented have all been clean and completely acceptable. Unless there is another part of the resort I don't know about, they are all two level condos with full kitchens and at least one bedroom. I believe some units are actually two bedrooms. And with a fairly comfortable pull-out couch, the downstairs (with it's own T.V. and bathroom) can easily serve as a second bedroom. For a small family, especially if they want to save a little money by making some of their own meals, this set-up is perfect. The property is kept in wonderful shape. The people at the resort, including the groundskeepers have always been friendly and helpful. Everyone says "hello". The swimming pools, the hot tub, and the childens water play area are very nice. At night, my son and I play basketball (sometimes with other families) in the lighted court. We love to play tennis, which is also lit for nighttime play. All the sporting equipment is cheerfully available at the front desk. They also have a general store which is open long hours. It has most things you might need (including the morning paper and hot Starbucks coffee!!) and the prices are quite reasonable. They will even make you breakfast or lunch there. There are also outside bbq areas for each unit. I travel quite a bit for pleasure and always read the reviews here on tripadivsor before staying anywhere. When I read negative reviews about Oak Plantation, I am astounded. I can only scratch my head and wonder, "what were these people expecting?" This is a clean, well kept resort with lots of nice, family-friendly features, conveniently located at a reasonable price. Not once in three weeks of staying here has anyone ever been rude or unhelpful. Bottom line folks?? If you're looking for 5-star accomodations with a conscierge, gourmet restaurants and chocolate on your pillow every night, stay at the Ritz Carleton--or better yet, book a cruise. But if you're looking for a clean, family oriented, friendly and relaxing environment at a price most folks can easily afford, this place is all of that.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oak Plantation Resort for 6 days in February 2006. The hotel is in a very convienient area in Kissimme, close to restaurants, souvenier shops, Walmart, and our favorite the Nike Outlet. We booked this with a timeshare company offering a discounted rate of 200.00 for 6 days. Great price! We did the 90 minute sales tour the first day. Said no, and was never asked again. They provide child care during the tour and lunch. The one bedroom unit we had was nice, but smaller than I expected and the bathroom was downright tiny. The Queen sofa bed in the living room was totally worn out and extremly uncomfortable. We let the kid have the king bed in the living room. We picked this place because it had a fitness room. They have 2 treadmills, and some universal type weights. No elliptical, exercise bike or anything else. Only 1 of the treadmills worked during our stay. The other had a ripped belt and wasnt repaired. It is about 20 - 30 minutes from Disney, and a long way from Universal. The shuttle service is useless, as it leaves first thing in the morning, and doesnt return until around 10pm. You need a car if you stay here. Great pool. Didnt try anything from the tiki bar. The staff was totally clueless. I dont think we ever got an answer to any questions we asked. I don't want to be too hard on the place, because I didnt pay much too stay here, and since we spent most of our days in Disney, it was okay as a base, and as a cheap place to crash after the parks. They dont bill it as that type of place, but thats what it is. Very average.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: denmark0221
Reviews.Content: This place is not what it seems. Although the resort itself was nice.(rooms were smaller than I thought) The staff for the most part were rude and not willing to help. We booked here on the premise that they had a shuttle to Disney.. They do but twice a day ONLY... one at 745 and one at 10.. No pick up times before 950 at night!!.. We figured we would save a couple hundred dollars and not stay in Disney itself... BIG MISTAKE..( by the way its about 20 minutes from the parks).The rep from guest services named Craig was rude, sarcastic and very unhelpful.. We asked if there was any other option for public transportation... he exclaimed " yeah a taxi, but they are expensive, our shuttle is free" He only wanted to give us car rental quotes from one place.. would even get us the numbers for the other ones.. ( we found out they get a kickback for referals). Well it turns out there is a Lynx bus across the street that cost 3.00 roud trip and takes you to Disney..!! The pool was completely full..There was no restaurant onsite( the pool bar had burgers, hotdogs and nachos) To get answers from ANYONE was like pulling teeth.. Oh and of course the "sales pitch breaksfast" which we declined.. We told them we were leaving and going to stay at another resort.. and would not care to come back again. We checked out early.. and had great service at a resort in WDW

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family at this resort while on a trip to Disney. It was very nice and upon arrival you are greeted by lots of trees and plants, not at all like a hotel. The buildings looked more like condominiums. Our room looked out to the pond with fountain and pool area which was awesome, two big pools, huge hot tub and pool/activity area for the kids. We unfortunately only got to spend time at the pools the first two nights because it got too cold. We were greeted each morning by ducks who were right outside our front door. They also offer activities everyday for families and children but we were not there during the day to participate in any of those. Location is very close to many restaurants and stores. Walmart supercenter is very close by. I would recommend this resort to anyone who is traveling to Orlando. When you check in, they ask if you want to attend a breakfast on time shares in the resort and would give you free tickets if you attended, we opted not to and were not asked again during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: taraandray
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 children just returned from a Christmas trip to disney and universal. We stayed at Oak Plantation for 6 nights and we were all sorry to leave. This place is simply lovely. Everybody was very accomodating. We stayed in the one bedroom suite with the pull out sofa. Could have used a bit more room, but spent so little time inside that it was fine. Room was spotless. The grounds are beautiful and feel so far away from everything. It's like your own private oasis. Even with all the holiday traffic and crowds it never took more than 15-20 minutes to get to the parks. The pool area was gorgeous. All three pools were nicely heated and the jacuzzi was perfect. The 2 bartenders that I met, Dave and Charlotte were wonderful. They offer so many things to do each day and they have great nighttime activities by the pool. We were so busy that we didn't have time to enjoy many of them. It was great to get back from the parks late and still be able to use the pool and jacuzzi until 1:00 am. The surrounding area is a bit seedy, but you will find that in any city. Not everybody is there on vacation. Once you pull off the main drag and into Oak Plantation you are in your own private world. It is very quiet and family oriented. We had no problem with any kind of noise. I would tell anybody and everybody to stay here. I know I will stay again. Next time it will be just my husband and myself. You get so much more than you pay for. By the way they only asked one time at check in about the time share deal. I simply said I was not interested and that was the last I ever heard from anybody. No high pressure sales.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY STAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family really enjoyed our stay at OAK PLANTATION RESORT. IT was, seriously, more than we expected. We enjoyed the nice six rooms and the good distance from the main traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Ziegler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oak Plantation from Nov. 9 to Nov. 19, 2005. I was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews here, but we were completely satisfied with our accomodations. The check-in was the fastest and most effecient we have ever experienced. After check-in, we were asked to sit down with their "vacation specialist" to discuss our vacation plans, in case we needed any discount tickets or information (we already had all that) and he briefly touched on the issue of "the complementary breakfast that only lasted about an hour". We refused the offer, he tried one more time, and after our second refusal, we took our welcome packets and proceeded to our unit. We were in Room 1505, on the ground floor --a very nice location. We had requested a second-floor unit, because I had read that the first floor units were noisey. We were never bothered by noise from upstairs units or anywhere. (Granted, this is not a busy time of year to be there.)I had read that someone had a problem with ants in their unit, so I took a small can of ant spray, just in case. We never saw a "pest" of any kind during our stay. Our unit was immaculate. We were not supposed to have housecleaning, but we discovered that, somewhere in our reservations, that was included (at no extra charge.) If I had any "complaints", I would only say that the resort is obviously an older resort. The bathroom was a good example -- the older style tub with 4-inch white ceramic tile walls and a vinyl shower curtain. The water pressure was incredible, if that is important to anyone. (we appreciated it!) The in-room washer was a unique feature, in that it is a washer/dryer all-in-one, no bigger than a dish washer. We had to have it repaired while we were there. The service was quick, and the servicemen were very congenial. They also have a laundry facility with full-size washers and dryers that are complimentary to resort guests. My only other complaint could be overlooked if you have a sense of humor. We never knew from one day to the next whether we would have a full set of towels, or none at all. We always had 4 bath towels (but they were small -- I missed my BIG towels!!) But, some days, we might only get one clean wash cloth and 4 or 5 handtowels, or vice versa. Regardless, if we needed anything, it was only a phone call away. They did replenish the paper products, and gave us disposable dish cloths as well as automatic dishwashing soap packets. The unit was a nice size for the two of us. (my husband and myself). The kitchen area was small, and there were limited utensils, but, it's fine for a short period of time. They have a nice variety of "organized" things to do at the resort, especially if you have children and you choose to spend much of your time at the resort. Most of the activities or crafts are free or very low-cost. The only activity we participated in was the Friday night luau. Usually, we avoid "uncertain events" such as this, but, even though there was no extra charge, we figured we had paid for it (as part of our resort cost)so we decided to check it out. They had a nice assortment of food -- wings, meatballs, cocktail sausages, ham, ribs, chicken nuggets, rolls, and tropical fruit for dessert. If the weather is good, you could sit at a table around the pool, but it was rather breezy and a little cool, so we filled our plates, and took the food back to our unit. Construction was continuing on Rt. 192, so the roads were a little trecherous. But, the location of the resort is good. There are 2 Super Wal-Marts close by, and a Super Target fairly close as well, if you need grocery items. Several years ago, we were fortunate enough to stay at Marriott's Cypress Harbour Resort, thanks to some friends who own a week there. We tend to use that as our "barometer" for the places we stay, and we like to say that resorts like Oak Plantation are Cypress Harbour "wannabe's". We doubt we will ever stay in a place as nice as Cypress Harbour again. But, all-in-all, we were very satisfied with Oak Plantation.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, my wife and I along with our three children and my mother stayed at the Oak Plantation in November. We were in a two bedroom two bath villa and we couldnt have been more pleased. The resort is very secluded and has a homey feel which made it easy to relax after a long day at Disney. It is about a 10 minute drive to the parks and the gated enterance helps make you feel safe. The resort is very clean and well kept just like they show on the online pictures. We didnt have time to swim in the pools but i did take a stroll around them and they were in exellent shape. There was a tiki bar in the pool area and they were having a barbecue with free food when i walked by. Overall taking into account what i got for my money i have to give this resort a perfect 10, we all loved it and it made it hard to go home at the end of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great (if you get to stay there)”
Reviews.Author: Leforge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oak Plantation in February of this year. This was our second time although we almost didn't get to stay here again. Upon arrival at Oak Plantation we were informed that it was overbooked and we were being moved to an upscale *5 star* resort. Instead we were moved to Fantasy Villas which is perhaps the worst place I've been in my life. After being told to basically fend for ourselves by our travel service (Expedia.ca) we went back to Oak Plantation on our own the next day to beg for a room. The reservation manager seemed to feel sorry for us and instantly found us a unit to stay in. After returning our vacation was great. Oak Plantation is a fantastic resort but I'm worried to book here again for fear of a repeat situation. Expedia did come through after a bit of a fight and refunded our one night at Fantasy Villas which is the least they could have done. The situation came very close to ruining our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Oak Plantation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort three times for the past three years. This place is clean, fun, and easily accessible. We love the fact the parking lot is in a circle and we feel safe there. The pool and all the amneties are excellent. The kids love to come to the Oak for Wednesday night movies at the pool. We would reccommend this resort to anyone without and reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation at the Oak Plantation based on the pictures from the web page. On arrival we were extremely disappointed in our unit. The unit was much smaller than we had expected. We only had 1/2 a roll of TP and no extras. The next evening while enjoying a drink by the pool we mentioned our disappointment with the resort. The bartender, Dave who was extremely nice and helpful, called the front desk to express our disappointment. We were offered, and took a larger room. This room, also a 1 bedroom was much nicer, and larger, however we still did not have extra TP and had to call 2x for someone to bring TP and extra towels. If you need maid service, forget it, you won't get it unless you pay extra for it. Since we are RCI owners, we were told that to get discount tickets all we needed to do was listen to 60 min of a presention. We thought we could live through this to save 100.00. Well it turned out that after 2 hours we had to fight our way out of there. All in all we will not return to the Oak Plantation unless they go through some major changes. It is apparent that the new owners are out to make a few bucks, but in the end this poor service will drive them into the hole.

Reviews.Title: “Try getting all of this for just $70 a night ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this resort four times in the past four years. We have NEVER had ANY problems at all. Staff has always been beyond helpful. The villas were wonderful, especially when you consider it was only seventy dollars a night. Yes, they do try to get you to attend a breakfast where they will attempt to sell you a timeshare, but you can simply say "no thanks" and they will not bother you. I have never attended or felt pressured to attend a breakfast for timesharing. As far as ants in any of the rooms goes, being a 'Northerner' who has lived in the south, the simple solution is to turn on the AC. Ants look for moisture and the ac dries the air out, forcing them to vacate. Oh, never had a problem with ants by the way. And as for others saying there are "narrow stairs"? I have always requested rooms on the second floor and I have yet to find these narrow stairs. Of course I am only 180 pounds. Finally, about the area really going downhill, I lived in Orlando for a while, and really the entire city is changing. It may be the home of Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck, but it is, and has always been, the home to many shady characters that do prey on tourists. The simple solution to that is....use your head. Don't be naive and think that ALL of the city is nice and sweet. Oak Plantation I feel is quite safe and comfortable. I have gone for many late night walks around the premisis without ever feeling unsafe. This is a great value and we will continue to stay at Oak Plantation for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “The family loved it”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn62
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and two sons, 15 and 23 July 13-20. We stayed in a second floor room. We checked in around 3:00 with ease. I was asked one time to attend a free breakfast and 90 minute presentation. I turned it down and did not hear from the staff again. The only problem I encountered was a loose toilet roll holder. It was repaired the next day, without me reporting the problem. The kids thought the sleeper sofa was comfortable. My husband loved the mattress in our room. They did warn us about the phone fees and they were not kidding, 75 cents for local calls. We had cell phones so this was not a problem. My sons spent every afternoon at the pool and loved it. My husband thought the water was too warm. There was construction on 192 but we were never more than 20 minutes away from any of the WDW parks or Universal. I prefer staying on WDW property, but the family enjoyed the home like feel of the apartment verses a hotel room. The washer and dryer in the room were very helpful. There were a few construction projects going on. I was having a tough time waking the boys in the morning, until Monday morning around 9:30 am when the jackhammer started up outside our window. That got them up. The room was very clean and I did not have any bug problems. I would recommend it for families who find hotel rooms cramped. One suggestion, bring your rental car. Shuttles are limited. I did not do any cooking, I was on vacation. I can only comment on the frig which kept the cokes and water cold. Over all it was a pleasant experience and the guys want to stay again, I prefer a four/five star hotel and all of its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Has Really gone downhill the past few years Please Read!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are considering booking Oak Plantation PLEASE READ! OK I will start off by saying we have stayed at Oak Plantation 4 times in the past 7 years. Our first 2 trips: Staff was FANTASTIC, pool really nice and fun for the kiddies. Down sides of those stays were that the stairs were very steep and narrow - a child attempting to climb the star gate (if you request one) could be SERIOUSLY injured. Traffic along the main drag can be bad - taking up tp 45 minutes to reach the Disney parks. Having said all of that the value and ammeneties were great. 3rd trip: We knew to book first floor accomodation because of the stair issue for the children. Traffic in the area getting worse - entire area seemed to be going downhill. We still thought it was a great value. Interactive childrens pool was about 50% functional. Staff was still fantastic. 4th trip: Great prices brought us back again... The area has gone down EVEN MORE. I kid you not there were "female solicitors" at the local Walmart! Our first room backed up to the woods - on the second day into our vacation - upon returning from a long day at the parks we were entering our apartment (door in the rear). There were some "male youths" walking along a footpath in the woods on the property directly behind the "gated" resort grounds that thought it would be fun to scare us. Something hit the outside light next to my husbands head and shattered it. Upon entering the room (with two terrifed little girls that had been happily dreaming of Mickey as they were being carried from the car until then) we heard laughing and shouting. We called the front desk and told them of the situation and asked to be moved - staff was very accomodating. This was at around 1am so we only brought enough things for 1 night and my husband would return in the morning for the rest. The new apartment had ALOT of ants - but I liked them better than the previous nights company. When my husband returned the next morning for the rest of our gear he saw that the large dining area window was broken. We are guessing our "guests" returned for more fun later that night after we had moved. We tried to book accomodation elsewhere but there was no availability with the kind of amenities we needed with our small children on such short notice - Our 2nd room was right by the basketball courts so we were in a central and better lit location - but teenagers playing late at night were loud. We were not charged for our stay - the staff really did go out of there way for us - but nothing can fix a trip after somethign like that happens. PS that trip the childrens interactive pool was not operational at all. We understand none of our troubles were the fault of Oak Plantaion - nor could it been prevented by them (except for the ants and childrens interactive pool). The resort itself looks so nice but the surrounding area is just REALLY, REALLY BAD and not as close to the parks as you might think. We recommend Cypress Pointe - they have all the ammeneties of Oak Plantation, nice, safe area - Very close to parks - no scary dark woods. Hotel Kingdom has GREAT rates.

Reviews.Title: “5 nights at the Oak Plantation”
Reviews.Author: blondiefromIll
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Oak Plantation where we had a 2nd floor 1-bedroom unit. The unit was clean, tastefully decorated, no bugs, and no odor. I was only asked once (after check-in) to join the resort for a complimentary breakfast and a tour of the property to which I declined. I was not asked again during our stay, and had no messages on my phone. I was very adamant about not wanting the breakfast, the tour, and did not want a discount on tickets (which a tour is now required to purchase discount tickets). It was just my personal decision to not participate, many did however as we saw the salespeople each morning taking people on tours. The resort overall was very nice, relaxing. The pool was great, my 7 year old daughter loved it! For the price I would much rather stayed at Oak Plantation than at a one room hotel with two queen beds...I travel often, and stay in 5-star resorts (which my company pays for) so I was worried I would be disappointed. I was not! I booked through Expedia - easy check-in, easy check-out, had a rental car, and found the resort close enough to Disney to get there with ease. Enjoy your trip!!

Reviews.Title: “CHECKED IN THEN CHECKED OUT”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityJakedog
Reviews.Content: Oak Plantation is advertised as a new resort. It is not. It is several years old under new management. The buildings are old and run down. Based on trip advisior, we had requested a 2nd floor villa. What we werent told was that all 2nd floor villa's require you to walk up, approx. 14 narrow stairs to get to the living areas. The carpet is old and bunched up at the seams. The decor is dated. The kitchen was noted to have lots of crumbs in the drawers and counter. The villa smelled very musty. We were very disappointed and checked out. The people at the front desk were very nice about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, they will try to sell you a timeshare, wasn't looking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there in 2002, and enjoyed our stay very much. We decided to go back. Check in was nice, and then we went to purchase tickets on site, and did not recieve a discount as we did before. We went to our room and it was like they just made the bed from the last night. My wife went to cook, and the grill to the exhaust fan above the hood fell off and almost hit her. We went to wash some clothes and the door was broken. The toaster burnt our toast on the lightest setting. We called about the maid service, we had it everyday last time, this time it was only done once a week, and if you only stayed there a week you were out of luck. We called to simply express our concerns, and were told we wold be moved into a different unit, to come down for our new key cards. when we went to the desk, they did not know what we were talking about, it took the manager 20 minutes to even show up, and were told since we were not "owners" of thier "Vacation property" we do not get a different room. They would fix things in our room right away. They didn't and still had the nerve to invite us for a presentation. Starwood did a better job managing this property. Will look somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Was pretty nice when we were there!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wanted to add my review of this place, even though it has been almost 4 years since being there. My husband an I stayed in a 1-bdrm condo for our honeymoon in July of 2001 and overall were pretty happy. The pool was a bit cold, but were not in it enough to really care. The biggest problem we had was the sales people trying to sell us a time share. They were worse than car salesmen! After we had said no for about the 20th time, they tried to make us feel guilty about how we choose to spend our money, instead of getting a time share. Imagine having been married 4 days and having someone treat you like that!! So, enjoy the hotel, but if they try to convince you to have a free breakfast early one morning and give you other free stuff, think it through before going....

Reviews.Title: “A small touch of Paradise at Oak Plantation Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spend 3 wonderful nights at Oak Plantation Resort. It was very peaceful, safe, secluded, clean and charming. Our first morning there my son awoke at 6:30 a.m. and peeping out the kitchen window saw a squirrel, and a goose with her dozen gosling. It was like living in a park. The view from our window was of the lake with the fountain - exactly like the pictures online. The two pools were immaculate, as was the hot tub. The kiddies pool with the water fountains/spray was a big hit. Although we were there Memorial Day, there were times we had the pool area to ourselves. The rooms were cleaned daily; the dishwasher loaded, and fresh linens/towels were provided. It definitely felt like home away from home. The only problem was we had a one bedroom unit, with a pull out coach for the kids. The only bathroom in the unit was off the master bedroom. It would have been much more practical to have the washroom accessible from the kitchen/living area.

Reviews.Title: “Lost some charm on my second visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I said I was considering going back in my previous review of Oak Plantation and I did. Stayed for 16 nights from May 15 - 31. The unit this time around wasn't quite as nice as last year, I was still able to get a second floor unit but this one was smaller (no loft) and was facing away from the resort into the woods. Our stay was quite enjoyable but we did however encounter roaches at two occasions. After our second encounter we contacted the reception and they sent a guy to spray the apartment immediatly. Didn't see any roaches after that. We could have done without this however, having roaches in our apartment didn't add to the charm. Also, they should really consider setting up a wireless network to access the Internet, going online via telephone line is expensive and slow. The resort was still as beautiful and peaceful, we spent plenty of time in the pool area. Oak Plantation is still a good choice for staying in the Orlando and Kissimmee area, but I think after two visits I'm about ready to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years back and I never wrote a review but I am currently planning a vacation and find everyones reviews very helpful in planning my trip so I figured I would do the same!!! The room we had was probably considered just standard at it was very nice for the price you get your own little "apartment" it has a kitchen, living area with t.v. and a seperate bedroom with t.v. The pool was very nice also!! Would definately go back here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “i think it was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first it wasn't easy to find in the end we found because my dad drove in the wrong lane and we forced to turn but when we got there it looked great. We stayed for three weeks. Each day the maid came in and cleaned the room to aboslute perfection. All the appliences worked and it was easy to come home to at the end of a very tiring day. SO THUMBS UP

Reviews.Title: “I have a better idea!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have a better idea- just up the road you can stay at Hapimag- for a better price and and nicer accomidations!! My family, which consists of my husband and 4 teenage daughters, planned our one and only vacation for spring break. Since this was our only "big" vacation we have taken, and probably ever will, we planned well in advance reserving a 2 bedroom suite at Oak Plantation. Upon arrival we found that they had over booked rooms and did not have a 2 bedroom suite available. So the first night, we stayed in a one bedroom - 1 bathroom (let me remind you-FOUR teenage girls!!!) suite. With the 6 of us, that was one of the longest nights of my life. We had to ask for additional cots, towels pillows, blankets etc... as the unit was only equipped to handle 4 people. The first night of the family vacation-our only family vacation I spent a few hours in tears. Luckily our travel agent pulled through and set us up for the remainder of our vacation at a resort called "Hapimag" also in Kissimee. Beutiful 4 bedroom villa, 4 bathrooms huge living area & kitchen for a much cheaper rate. Oak Planation very nery destroyed our vacation because of their "overbooking". We were told they do this often so they will not loose money in case of cancellations. But if you want to take the chance . . . Good Luck to you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8-day magical vacation with our 2 1/2 son. This resort is just beautiful, grounds and pool are very well maintained. Built around an artificial lake. Our son loved the ducks, the park and kiddie pool! It's a perfect place for a family vacation. There is activities every day for them, although our son was a bit to young to participate. We had a second floor one-bedroom condo in building 14, the most wooded area of the resort. It was quiet and well furnished. Really enjoyed having a full kitchen (they do supply diswasher detergent), ironing board, blow dryer, vaccum, washer and dryer. It was like home!The resort is close to everything, 20-minute away for the theme parks. Really convenient! Went for groceries at Publix, 10 minutes away. Staff was friendly, and we had no pressure for the time-sharing presentation. They first asked us at check-in if we wanted to attend a special breakfast. We said no and that was the end of it. We plan to return next year, but longer this time... just adored the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed for six nights in a one bedroom, second floor. The unit was clean, but a little smaller than what we were expecting based on the picture that was displayed on the website. Room service never seemed to make it to our room, but that was okay as we were able to get fresh towels everyday. The best part of this resort are the pools and hot tub. There were activities held around the pool everyday. The Activities director that was there was wonderful with the kids and was a total doll.

Reviews.Title: “Great little resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We broke up our week in Orlando with three nights at Oak Plantation to relax before going on to a Disney resort for the last four days. Had I known what Oak Plantation was like when I booked I might have stayed there entire week. It was terrific for our little ones (ages 2 & 6) a great kid pool and several diffreent activities each day for them. Although Kissimmee itself isn't much to write home about, once inside Oak Plantation you felt like you really were away from it all. A WalMart and Publix Supermarket are a short drive away -- the front desk will help you with directions --so you don't have to eat deep fried everything each night at the restaurants on the 192. The room was well stocked with pots, pans, glass ware etc. Our first assigned room was ordinary but we asked to be moved because we were directly in front of the basketball court, which can get noisy at times. We were moved to a larger one-bedroom at the endo building 12 - it was terrific: spacious, clean and quiet. Everything is within walking distance, and there are nice paths connecting the 16 buildings of the complex. Convenience store stays open late and the pool even later. Internet cafe, tennis equipment and basketballs are also available for you. As advertized, the staff was quite agressive in getting you to sign up for a timeshare info session but they did take no for an answer. Although we were asked to participate on several occasions, we were never asked by the same person more than once. We were so pleased. I agree with previous comments, people who were not satisfied must have had ridiculously high standards. We'd go again and recommend to friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to Oak plantations”
Reviews.Author: Travelgrl221
Reviews.Content: Having tiny ants crawling all over the kitchen counter is not my kind of hotel room. The staff seemed friendly, however were pushy. The hot tub was closed most of our trip for cleaning or maintenance. The pools were filled with leaves and debris. The resort is in a seedy part of Kissimmee and is about 30 minutes from Disney, not 8 miles like some places say it is. The only thing that was good that came out of this trip is that we got a great deal on attraction tickets for going to a tour of the resort. This is where the pushing gets involved. The tour is trying to get you to buy a timeshare which is actually a bad deal anyways. After repeatedly telling them, NO, we got our attraction tickets. The Kissimmee Municipal Airport is virtually across the street so low flying small craft airplanes are frequently disruptive. If you can’t tell, I do not suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came from Sweden after a long trip and the hotel was overbooked so they sent us to another hotel (Terra Verde) and gave us a voucher to stay on the Oak at another time. We booked the hotel again for our last four days and are very glad we did. No luxury but all you need you get. Everything was clean and the 1-bedroom villa was nice. The pool and location was great, we would absolutely stay there again. Our teens really liked the hotel, pool, spa and gameroom. And so did we. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: suezyq
Reviews.Content: my 16 yr. old daughter and i recently stayed for one week feb 20th. i had read the trip advisor reviews and some of the negative comments but my experience was excellent. i checked in at 6:00pm. with no hassles. one lady did ask if i was interested in the sales presentation with the promise of 2 tickets to arabian knights dinner. i told her that i would pass for now and she didn't press me. i was expecting a phone call for another sales pitch but it never came. we got a 1 bedroom on the second floor. it came with a pullout couch, fully stocked kitchen, microwave , fridge, stove, washer/dryer, coffeee maker.there was a general store with a starbucks. the grounds were excellent, with a playground, tennis court, basketball, 2 beautiful pools, hot tub, kids pool and a splash pad. it was 1 block from hwy 192, walgreens, 7-11. it was very quiet and well kept. i would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay and would recommend this hotel to families. We had a two bedroom which gave us lots of room. There were three tv's, large living area, nice dining area that seats six at the table. The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, microwave, stove,fridge, washer and dryer and even a garberator. The beds were made each day, fresh towels (not always face clothes) but not so sure the about the carpets being vacuumed. Despite having the toilet overflowing the first night and a cockroach one day and having a toaster that was defective, I would still recommend this resort.
