The Super Walmart is a block and a half away and there is a Bells across the street. There is currently lots of construction on 192 that really delays things. The resort is also a fair distance from 1-4. The pools were very well heated so swimming on cool nights was possible.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MomIAm
Reviews.Content: Our family of four ( 2 adults, 2 children ages 9 and 6) stayed at the Oak Plantation in March, 2004. Our huge unit on the 2nd floor was clean with no insects. We had a great time using the pools and enjoyed the pool activities. Unfortunately, when we returned on December 28th, 2004 for 3 nights we had an extremely small unit on the ground floor (we had requested a 2nd floor unit) in Building 15. There were two cigarette butts on the carpet when we checked in- the unit also had a very strong smoke odour. The carpet looked very worn and dirty. We arrived at 4:00 pm - our check in took over 20 minutes. When we returned in the evening - after eating out - we were greeted by a cock roach crawling under the kitchen table right next to the sofa bed my sons were going to sleep on. We checked out that evening - Expedia was great about refunding our payment ( excluding the first night). The pool area and pool are still very clean.

Reviews.Title: “No problems - we will return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2004. I did not write a review until I revisited this website today to find some negative reviews. (I was checking prices to return.) The initial checkin process was a bit slow (but we encountered worse when we stayed on property at Disney). There was an invitation to see the time share presentation, but we declined and did not get approached again. Our room was great for us. It was quiet, and I felt safe there. We were in town to look at real estate so my mother could become a snow bird. The staff was very helpful in answering our questions and even helped us with ideas on the relocation process. The kitchen was great, because one of us could be preparing dinner while the other went to the pool with my daughter. The trip also provided us an opportunity to see my brother, who lives in Orlando. Several nights, we grilled out as a family, swam in the pool, watched movies by the pool, and took daily walks. The manager met my brother who was grilling, and chatted with us for awhile. She made it very clear she wanted us to have a nice stay, and if there was anything we needed, to just call. The room was clean. We did not see bugs in our room. Our dishwasher leaked one day, and maintenance came right away and fixed it. The furniture was a bit worn, but it was fine for us. The manager had told us they were redoing the rooms with new furniture a few rooms at a time. The pool area was very clean, and the pool was well-maintained. The grounds were kept clean also, and the landscaping was well-kept. My husband, father, and my other 2 children joined us at the end of our week at the Oak Plantation, and we checked into Key Largo on property at Disney for the next week. Yes, the facilities there are more plush, and we had no problems there at all. However, for a fraction of the cost, the Oak Plantation suited our needs just as well. We plan to return to OP and skip the Disney Resort the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over Christmas break, the fam had a nice 4 night stay at the resort. Check in was smooth and only a couple "normal" calls to the front desk were necessary. They seduced us into discount Disney tickets and naturally we jumped at it. The required sales pitch was never going to take just 90 minutes, so we were getting quite antsy after 2 hours. We escaped unscathed and continued our getaway to the pool! Even central Fla. cooperated with some pretty nice days. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone really, unless you had a 5 star all inclusive resort in mind!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property a few months ago and was satisfied with the grounds. They had a pool and tennis court. The environment was quite and private. They have a kitchen, dining room and living room. If you can get this place for $65 it’s worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted you all to know about our stay at Oak Plantation. First off we resevered a room on ground floor and early check in, we arrived around 3:30pm (check in time is 4:00) our room was not ready so the put us in a third story villa. My mom was travelling with us and this was a problem. I called front desk to ask for a ground floor room as we had booked a ground floor room, 2 1/2 hours later we were moved to a smaller room, furthest a way from all faclities. We requested no housekeeping as we had money and valuables in our room, the first day we got back to our room there was a housekeeper in it. We received phone calls between 2:00 am and 3:00 am every night with the person hanging up. When I called front desk they said they dialed the wrong room???? 8 times in three nights??? I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great from the outside...”
Reviews.Author: rileycando
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia as part of a travel package. Because we have a five year old we wanted a condo type unit somewhat away from the Disney hustle and bustle. We also wanted something smaller than a high rise mega resort, so this fit the bill perfectly. Directions given by a Tripadvisor reviewer were helpful and accurate, however there was not a Super Walmart nearby as previously posted, but Publix was only a short drive away for grocerys. Check in - We arrived at 3:00 pm and room was not ready so we shopped for food and returned at 4:30. After check in we were sent to the "VIP" desk for our parking pass. This turned out to be a rather slick way of trying to get you to attend the 2 hour time share presentation. The lure was some slightly discounted Disney tickets which we declined. The Room - We inquired about the different sizes of room and were told that our was the smallest type unit and no others were available. We had requested a second floor room which ended out to be a good choice because it did have vaulted ceilings in the living area which made the unit seem larger, also lower units had bedrooms with large windows in front of the walking paths, so you would have had to keep the blinds closed for privacy. Our unit was in building 5 facing a lovely pond and fountain. Many units faced parking lots so we were happy with our location. The kitchen was well stocked but there must have been some glitches during construction because there were no drawers at all and the silverware and utensils were in a closet. Where the drawers should have been there was the oddest washer dryer combo that I have ever encountered (more about that later). Overall the decor was tasteful, but a little worn. The color scheme was nice and there was a seperate living room with couch, armchair and TV. The bathroom was small with a white tile floor which showed lots of hair - not ours. This was an omen of housekeeping to come! House Keeping - After returning from a long day at Disney around 5:00 pm, we found the room untouched. EEEK! I immediately called the front desk and someone came within 20 minutes. Day 2, after a nice day at Cocoa Beach we returned at 4:00 pm to find the room untouched. EEEK! This time we had no clean towels or toilet paper (only one roll is provided and our 5 year old uses more than his share). After calling the front desk I was told that they had no control over housekeeping as it was a different department. The phone directory gave a number for housekeeping which put you through to the -front desk. After 3 more calls I was told that housekeeping had until 5:30 to service rooms, and if I wanted anything earlier it had to be arranged by special request. The Grounds and Pool - Fabulous! This made up for any shortcomings mentioned above. Soft music piped in, three great pools, a large hot tub, plenty of chairs and tables. The pond was beautiful, lots of interesting water fowl with baby chicks. The exteriors of the buildings were quite nice and well maintained. It really is surrounded by oak trees and had a peaceful and quiet atmosphere. However every afternoon, families of locals appeared at the pool and stayed until close to dark. This wasn't really a problem, but our feelings are that guests only should use the pool. The Washer/Dryer - we packed as little as possible for this trip, so the washer was crucial. It was a combo that washed , spun and dried the clothes all in one tub. After reading the directions I was surprised to see that the shortest cycle took 3 hours! After finishing the first load it was close to 9:00 pm. I opened it up and the clothes were still damp, after trying to restart the dryer, I found that drying only was not an option - the 3 hour cycle had started again and the tub was filling with water! We needed that laundry, so I was up for most of the night getting it done, The clothes never did dry completely, so I draped them around the living room until morning. (There is a complimentary washer, etc in community room, but at that time of night I didn't feel like going out). Overall, inspite of some minor annoyances, we really liked this place. Hopefully this review will help you overcome some of the obstacles we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort, shame about the hurricane!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were overwhelmed with glee when we arrived at the resort in august 2004. We just couldn't believe that we had made such a good choice and that it really did live up to the amazing pictures and reviews we had seen. Our young daughters thought the pools were fantastic and they loved the villa as did we. We found the staff to be helpful (despite the annoying sales pitch when you first check-in) and the villa/resort was clean and well maintained. The location is superb - with easy access to absolutely everything in Orlando. We had absolutely no complaints and were even planning our next trip over....and then hurricane Charley hit. We learned very late that Charley had changed direction and was heading straight for Orlando thus we were all very unprepared when it did hit. We still had 3 days left of our holiday and were left without power, unable to use any of the facilities and had to throw all our food away. I feel a little mean complaining at this point however it was still our holiday - and unlike the american holiday-makers - we couldn't leave early. Once the hurricane hit we were pretty much ignored by the staff and left to fend for ourselves. Its a shame that after such a fantastic beginning it had to end on such a bad note - we couldn't do anything about the hurricane, but they could have tried a little harder to lift our spirits! Anything would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: Floridanut66
Reviews.Content: We stayed her from Oct 6 - Oct 27 and I do not know what any negative reviews are about at all. We had a 1-bed apartment for 2 adults and 2 children aged 10 & 8. Although the apartment was not as large as it apppeared in the photographs it was still plenty big enough for our needs, especially considering we were not there most of the time, being out at the theme parks, or even at the resort's pool or tennis court. The cleanliness of the apartment was second to none. We did see a cockroach one day, but if you go to any of the animal parks, they tell you at the insect shows that this is quite normal. The resort itself was great and we all enjoyed the pools and tennis (at no extra charge) very much, although the kids play pool was being updated throughout our visit. The only reason I have not scored the resort 'excellent' is because the housekeeping was a bit hit and miss. One day, the maid did not turn up until 6.00pm, but saying that it did not matter to us. Another part of the housekeeping we were not too happy about was the maid did not always leave us face towels (in fact about 5 times, and we were worried that they would think we had taken them and be billed) and one one day out of the 21, a maid did not do a very good job of cleaning up, in fact, she did not touch the kitchen sink, the beds still looked a bit tatty, and the towels were not folded on the rails, they were just stacked on the toilet cistern, but other than that, I would recommend this resort to anybody and we would definitely return at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish I Was Still There!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Oak Plantation for a little over two weeks in October. We got there hours before check in, but the front desk attendant (very nice) scrambled to get everything prepared for us. We booked the two-story one bedroom, which was spacious and clean: no bugs at all. It looked exactly like the pictures. Yes, the childrens' pool was closed while we were there, which equated to many young ones in the larger pools. My only complaint is that 192, the nearby main road, is very busy and under construction, so getting to the parks took triple the amount of time one would expect. (This, however, is not the fault of the resort). Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Meljc66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the OP in October. First impressions were disappointing. The first room we were offered was very small (nothing like the website pictures). I complained and we were moved to another 2 storey apartment which was better. The pool area was very nice, but the kids section was closed off for the duration of our holiday. The housekeeping service was excellent, but we still found a number of cockroaches in our room, which completely freaked me out! OK as a base, but no on site bar/restaurant which lets it down. Wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Your Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. It was the jewel in my trip. The resort is made up of multiple buildings containing 1-2 bedroom condos and is your home away from home. Each room contains a Living room, Breakfast nook, Full Kitchen, Laundry room, (1 or 2) Bedrooms and Bath. It is located 1 block north of the major east/west route US-192 that leads you to Disney and other major highways. The Resort contains 16 buildings set around a Pond and a swimming pool with other amenities. It was a joy to come home to. It costs is no more than a small Hotel room that contains a bedroom and bath. It is located about 8 miles from the south entrance to Disney World. This place is excellent if you don’t plan to spend all of your time at Disney because you are far enough away not to be in the traffic flow of the theme parks. You are one block from the major southern artery to the theme parks – US-192. They have information about all of the attractions and tourist sites for the Orlando area either in the lobby or Guest Services. Guest Services can obtain discounted tickets for the parks. This is a very well run facility. The resort is a “gated community” and you need to swipe your room card to enter the parking lot. They will maintain your privacy. I found out, after snooping around, that they do offer time-share opportunities but they don’t make a big deal about it. You will get a phone message to attend a complimentary 9:30AM breakfast and this is the extent of their pitch. RESTAURANTS AROUND HOTEL. The only downside is that there is no Restaurant on the premises. For me, this was not a problem because there are so many brand name and local restaurants within a mile of the hotel. Some of my recommendations are: - Breakfast – Friendly’s (Located in the parking lot of the Ocola Mall just across the street.) - Steak, Chops, Chicken – Roadhouse Grill is excellent and very casual. It is located around the corner, west of the hotel on US-192 - Ribs – Tony Roma’s has the best ribs that I’ve tasted. It is about a mile or less east of hotel on US-192. - Crackle Barrel – for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner. Located a bit farther west, in the US-192 corridor west of SR-535. Crackle Barrel is closer to Disney. This place was great for a late night dinner after Disney closes at 9PM. - Denny’s, IHOP, Waffle House, Pondorasa Steakhouse, Outback Steakhouse, Red Lobster, and other chains are all located east and west on US-192 Having a restaurant on the premises was not a problem, since hotel restaurants are normally expensive. SUPERMAKETS AROUND HOTEL. Each room contains a full kitchen so you can make anything you wish. So you may go to the local supermarket to buy what you want. - Publix on US-192 and SR-535 just a couple miles west of the hotel. It is on your way to/from the attractions. - SaveRite – on US-192 and Emory about a mile or so east of the hotel. - Albertsons (AKA Jewel) east of the hotel and a bit past SaveRite on US-192. CATHOLIC CHURCH AROUND HOTEL. Holy Redeemer Catholic Church is located about a mile east of the hotel. A block north of US-192 on Thacker. They were in the process of opening up their brand new church when I visited them. The new church is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Oak Plantation is a nice family resort. I went there with my two year old daughter and she loved it. They have a nice sprinkler pool for the kids and two additional pools for the adults. The villas are nice nothing above normal. Overall this was a nice experience except for the small lizards that keep popping out of the grass but I don't know if this is usual for Orlando. I would recommend it and I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sydneysu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in a one bedroom villa during our honeymoon September 27-October 3rd 2004. Our vacation was delayed a day and a half due to Hurricane Jeanne, the resort didn't seem to get much damage. We were a little disappointed in our room though, we saw two cockroaches on two separate days during our 5 day stay, the bedding didn't fit the bed they were a mix matched pair of sheets and not fitted. The kitchen table and chairs had crumbs on them from the prevoius guests, the dryer took three turns to dry two pairs of shorts, the air conditioning was extremely loud and you could hear it all night. The unit beside us was being renovated due to a water damage to the ceiling so we were unsure if that would have affected our adjacent unit (no one spoke english). Our bathroom flourescent light burned out so we called for a replacement and they brought a huge desk lamp to put on our tiny bathroom sink and said it would take over an hour to replace the bulb so they would come back in the morning. Needless to say no one returned even after a few calls to the front desk. The pool was clean and very nice in the evening, being no one was there. Overall, I don't think my husband and I would stay here again or recommend this place to anyone. There are so many other places to stay that I think there would be better service and a cleaner living environment. This was a wedding gift through an RCI trade, we based our choice on what we read on the internet and from pictures we had seen, I feel we were a little misinformed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Villa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Oak Plantation Resort from Sep. 14- Sept. 20 and I had the best time ever. It was clean and they provided great service. I had two instances where I had to call for assistance and I had someone knock at the door within 5 minutes. The atmosphere was calm and peaceful. The location was great. It was near many restaurants and shopping locations. I highly recommend this resort with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I love this hotel to death. The rooms are great and so are the staff. They do everything they can to make sure that your stay is as wonderful as it can be. Love it there.

Reviews.Title: “A great base near for your stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Nik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort during the latter part of July 2004. We found all staff helpful and courteous and check-in hardly took any time at all. We had requested a second floor apartment in a quiet area, based on other reviews on this website, and that is exactly what we got (with housekeeping, although this had not been booked). The apartment was very clean, spacious and well equipped and the resort itself is attractive, well-kept and very close to all amenities. In our opinion, the only thing it lacks is an on-site restaurant, although there are plenty to choose from nearby. We largely used the resort as a base whilst 'doing' the theme parks so were not there very much during the day. Apart from two messages left on our telephone during the 9 days we were there, we were not hassled into attending any time-share presentation. I would recommend Oak Plantation, but would suggest you request a room away from the pool area, as this is open to 1.00 am and could potentially be a problem for light-sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Unfortunately, cut short.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family visited the Oak Plantation Resort from 08/12/04 to 08/13/04. Our original vacation dates were from 08/12/04 to 08/19/04 but unfortunately, our stay at the resort was cut short by Hurricane Charley. However, for the time we were able to spend at the resort, we have no complaints. Check in was a breeze and our one bedroom villa was immaculate. Due to the severity of the hurricane, the resort lost all its power. We hoped that the electricity would have come sooner so we can enjoy our stay at the resort, but nature had taken its course and we were unable to benefit from the resort. We did not get to enjoy the amenities that the resort provides, therefore, during our next visit into the Orlando area, we are planning to book a villa in the resort and enjoy all the activities and amenities we were deprived of due to the hurricane. Absolutely a fantastic place for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: champagne93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of April 04'. We booked our hotel through hotwire so we did not know what we were getting until after we paid. I believe we paid a rate of $60 per night which we thought was great for a one bedroom suite w/kitchen and living area. I called ahead to request a second floor room after reading here that guests in 1st floor rooms heard a lot of noise from guests over them. Thankfully we had no problem and received a 2nd floor room as requested and check in was fast. The living area and kitchen were nice, nothing fancy, but suited our needs with a toddler. The bedroom was kind of small and the bathroom could use a little updating, but nothing we couldn't deal with. We didn't pay for housekeeping, but ended up receiving it anyway so that was a plus. If I had purchased it I may have been a little upset because most days they didn't get to our room until at least 4pm. Some days later, but we couldn't complain about something we received when we didn't pay for it. The pool are was nice and that was my favorite part of the resort. It wasn't very crowded when we went so there were plenty of chairs available and we were able to swim as we wanted. We were near the pool and basketball court, but didn't have any problem with any noise with that. The only thing that could be a little annoying is the planes constantly flying over throughout the day. OP must be pretty close to an airport because it felt like the plane was going to land at the resort. It is pretty close to the parks and took us about 15-20 at the most to get there. I would stay here again because I think it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Nativeborn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in resort from 7/31 to 8/7. Was worried about staying in a timeshare because I didnt want to be harassed about attending a sales pitch. Only contact was when I picked up a parking pass at the front gate and a daily message on the phone which was not at all intrusive. Stayed in a single bed room which was about the same size as my first apartment. It was overall a very nice room for the price. Also found the pools were nice although somewhat crowded. Another nice feature were the free washer and dryers in the laundy room near the pool. Was able to do all of my laundry before leaving to go home. Would stay here again, expecially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the Oak Plantation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed here on 6/12-19/04. Our room was full of Ants every morning. Housekeeping was not done until at least 3:30-4:00 pm everyday. We had to call to make sure they had not forgotten about us. Most important, at the beginning of our stay the safe broke down. We called the front desk to tell them, they told me they would send someone right over. More than 24hrs later at 10:30pm a maintenance man came over (after another call). He now tells me he has to get the engineer to recode safe. Engineer arrives next morning at 10:30am- he says it will be 1/2 hr to recode safe. After all was said and done- the evening before we left my husband and I discover 2 articles of jewelry missing. The ring missing -I had been married with 10 yrs ago. We brought the incident to the front desk Manager (Maria Ramos) she thanked us for not calling the Police and that she would handle the matter because the staff was "odbviosly not doing their job". It is now 8/06/04 after getting the run around for months with the Ins. company Mike Morra, accountant-Steve Straca, another front desk manager Aixa Soto (the worst by far) The assistant "GM" manager- Ray Del Campost calls me to tell me they have decided they are not going to do anything "the resort takes no responsibility-because there was no break in". I told him this was a "stupid" statement because ALL of housekeeping and All the maintenance staff had the keys to the room. After getting police report (they are doing an investigation) and having Log of everyone I spoke to with data and times, faxing them all information they wanted I am told " they are not taking any responsibility".

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelking2
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at Oak Plantation Vacation Resort in July, 2004. There were five of us - two adults and three children. We had an upstairs unit with two separate bedrooms. The unit had one king-sized bed and two full-sized beds. The unit itself was very comfortable and spacious. There were three working televisions. The air conditioning worked well. Plenty of clean towels on a daily basis. We didn't use the washing machine. We used the dryer several times. It seemed to work fine. The unit was fairly clean. My only complaint was that the floor was kind of dirty and scummy around the baseboard moldings in the kitchen and bathrooms. We did see some little tiny bugs in the moldy areas around the floor tile and baseboard molding in the master bathroom. We did not have any problems with ants, however. The water pressure in the bathroom showers was way too high! I suppose it is better to have too much water pressure than too little. However, the spray from the shower head was actually painful. Check-in was a breeze. It took us less than ten minutes to check in. The resort staff were friendly. The pool complex is quite nice. There are two pools and a great hot tub which is covered by a huge gazebo. The pool water was so pleasant and warm. Plenty of pool towels. The pools were definitely a hit! The grounds are well-kept and immaculate. There is a nice pond with a fountain and ducks to feed. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would stay here again. It was a nice resort for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there”
Reviews.Author: Noswad
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days in Oak Plantation. Deluxe two bed villa/unit spotlessly clean and well equiped, (albeit with noisy appliances). The resort is well maintained. Leisure facilties include three smallish pools, arranged centrally, and a games room. NB there is no catering of any kind - the one drinks vending machine was broken during our stay. And those of you wanting to access the internet, other than by dial up from your room, should avoid the property - the single ADSL connection in the lobby was out of order for 9 of our 10 days. All that said, Oak Plantation offers excellent value for money. There is much worse available in Kissimmee for a lot more. NB Location is slightly off the beaten track and the directions offered are not good. Take US192 (Irlo Bronson Highway) east from I4, left into Hoaggland and the property is immediately on the left.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Oak Plantation. We had a 1 BR unit. All in all we had a very positive stay. As most others have stated, the check-in took forever. Our unit was not available until 6:30 (check-in is 4:00). But it was worth the wait to get a second floor unit in the very back of the complex in Bldg 8 in a unit facing the back “woods”. It was extremely quiet there. I would avoid units facing the pools as they are open until 1 a.m. and it is very loud. The front desk staff were very cordial and helpful, especially Saimary. They even let us put our groceries in their fridge while our unit was being readied. I think the problem is that they just don’t have enough cleaning staff to handle the immense turnover on weekends. The unit itself was clean and cheery, although it showed a bit of wear. It was well equipped, but one thing I mentioned to them was that it would have been nice if they provided just a few coffee filters (we bought coffee but neglected to buy filters). Luckily there is a Walgreens just a few blocks away to grab those small items. We did suffer a few hours without water due to a water main break in our bldg, but it was fixed quickly. The swimming pools are very nice and a big hit with the kids. As others have mentioned, the washer/dryer units leave a lot to be desired. They are combo units (washer/dryer in one--never saw those before) and while the washer works okay (you must supply your own detergent) the dryer cycle is pitiful. Your best bet is to dry for 2 hours, take the clothes out and shake out the steamy moisture, then dry again before finally taking the clothes out to air dry overnight. That works for shorts and t-shirts, but I would not try something heavy like denim. For the price, we would definitely stay there again as long as we were well away from the pool area. Although it is a timeshare, there was no high pressure to view their presentation. However, if you don’t mind spending 90 minutes to listen, you can get some decent discounts to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Could be one of the best resorts in Kissimmee...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oak Plantation is a conveniently-located, beautifully-maintained resort which could be one of the best in Kissimmee- if the management coud somehow keep a consistent level of service. We stayed here for 18 nights from the beginning of July and were extremely happy with the location, the BEAUTIFUL grounds and the excellent swimming pool area which is superb for families with children. There were a lot of activites which our kids loved; hair-braiding, temporary tattoos, 'dive-in' movies, pizza party etc etc We booked a one-bedroom villa which we were moderately satisfied with but we asked to move after 5 days and were very happy with the offer of a much more spacious one-bedroom villa located close to the pool. The resort is a time-share resort and you will be invited to take the tour and, contrary to what others have written on Trip Advisor, I would say go along. You get a great breakfast, a friendly chat, a nice walk around the grounds and then a no-pressure sales presentation. Your prize? Strongly-reduced prices on theme parks tickets- a great deal. A word of advice if you want to buy into the time share- do not accept the first, second or even third price offer they give you, you can get a deal which is half the price of the first offer. Negatives? 1. Some of the reception staff are very unhelpful and unfriendly, but others are very service-minded. I got round this problem by checking who was in reception before I went there with a question. If the management of Oak Plantation read this: please sort out this issue because it is losing you friends and customers 2. The cleaning of the villas is very up and down, some days it was good, some days bad, all in all very inconsistent 3. Crockery and cutlery in our villa: there just wasn't enough, only a couple of plates etc 4. Range didn't work, but to be fair the maintenance guys were incredibly quick in arriving to fix things- they were virtually at the door before you'd finished calling them. As it happens, we hardly cooked at all anyway, it's cheaper to eat out! 5. No poolside bar (or bar anywhere). This place is crying out for a poolside bar and it would be no problem to set it up in the shaded area overlooking the pond. Alternatively there is another building with a deck overlooking the pond which would be great for a bar/ cafe. Conclusion: this resort has a LOT going for it and we would go back but next time it would be great if ALL the people in reception had the same customer-friendly attitude as the blond-haired girl (can't remember her name) who I think is the supervisor. Oh, one last thing, if the management really wanted to make this place unique, and VERY popular, they could offer child care facilities by extending the child care facilities in the sales presentation building. It would be easy to do and many families (like ours) would pay good money for a few hours to relax in the sun while the kids happily played in the kindergarten.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long 4th of july weekend at oak plantation. very nice. villa clean,bright and cheerful. Kitchen well stocked with dishes etc. bathrooms clean with plenty of towels. The grounds were clean and green. Very quiet area. TV in all rooms. I would stay here again. The villa was ready when we checked in. The front desk was just a tad slow with the check in process.

Reviews.Title: “We were satisfied for the price”
Reviews.Author: js64
Reviews.Content: The size, condition, and cleanliness of our 2 bdrm. unit was excellent. We booked through Orbitz and got our 2 bdrm. unit with housekeeping for $85 a night, can't beat that! I was very disappointed in the fact that we were in a first floor unit, I had requested a 2nd. floor when I called in before we arrived. The insulation in the units is poor and we seemed to hear every footstep from the family above us. The grounds and pool area were very nice and our kids enjoyed the activities that they held around the pool. The temperature of both pools was very nice, we never went in the whirlpool or the kiddie pool but they both looked fine. This resort is not as close to the attractions as many of the other resorts and HWY. 192 was under major construction while we were there so it took us a bit longer to get around. For the price I would stay here again but I would only do so if I could be guaranteed a second floor unit.

Reviews.Title: “Ant Plantation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi! We have stayed at Oak Plantation for our last three trips to Disney. This last time was our last! It's a shame because I use to really enjoy my stay, especially the pool area. We had a terrible time with ants in our room. The ants had checked in before us! When we called about the ants we were handed a bottle of complimentary ant spray. My husband had to spray every day because the ants continued to return...even though we had our food in air tight containers and we always cleaned up after ourselves. The day we checked in we had to wait two hours for our room. There were at least five other families who waited the same amount of time. The man named Brian was very friendly and apoligized for the inconvience. He offered us a room upgrade, which we took. However that upgrade included ants. Our dryer did not work well at all. You had to run it 2-3 times for clothes to dry. They never cleaned our room until 4:00 each day, which made it difficult for us to rest with the kids after a fun filled day at Disney. I think this resort would be wonderful again if they had more cleaning staff and better pest control.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this resort from 6/12/04 to 6/19/04 and had a wonderful time. This resort is a great find, we didn't know much about that area of town but the resort is in a good location. It's quite, entrance is gated, security on grounds, pools are excellent and well maintained, the grounds neat clean, villas are very clean and well stocked with everything you will need. In room w/d, stove, m/w, two tvs with vcr. d/w, full kitchen supplies. Bathroom extremely clean (even passed my wifes' inspection). Overall excellent place to stay! The only improvement I can recommend is in the check in procedure, it's very slow and the front end clerks need more training, they were all asking each other what to do, and a supervisor was right behind them all the time just overseeing the operation. Maybe they were all in training at the time. We had no problems with check in took only about five minutes once we got to the front of the line, but others in front of us were surely having problems. In summary: Great place to visit, clean, safe, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed while staying here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While we were here our unit was broken into. We discovered our door has been broken down when returned from a day at Disney, at 11:30pm. The night person at the desk was a hag! She said she couldn’t find us another unit and couldn’t give us a refund since we booked through Expedia. I got Expedia on the phone in their lobby and after a huge argument she came up with another unit. It was 1:30am by this time. While we were there two units had been robbed. The security here, the service and the entire place is a joke. We will never stay here again and I’m writing Expedia in hopes of getting this place removed from their web site. I couldn’t say enough to warn people from staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Oak Plantation Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 4090 Enchanted Oaks Circle, Kissimmee, FL 34741
